Summary: It’s was one of the best Motel 6 by far. The location is excellent and the facility and rooms are clean and staff super friendly. There is a market place and each floor have ice machine. They have a pool and spa located in there beautiful center courtyard. We will be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Spend the extra $ and book elsewhere
Summary: I have to be honest this motel was chosen based off of their pictures on the website and the affordable price. What it didn’t show was the layers of filth covering every surface, the hairs in the sheets and bathroom surfaces, or the bug droppings along the baseboards. Evidence of bugs on the mattresses when my husband pulled the sheets back was the final straw. We spent 3 hours in the hotel total so I can only review on the actual room and the room of our other family travelling with us. We contacts the Disney travelling company we booked with and was given a full refund right away based on our experience and photo evidence. We were moved to the Howard Johnson. I would recommend spending a little extra to be elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Experience Comfort and Convenience at Motel 6 Maingate in Anaheim
Summary: We had an amazing stay at Motel 6 Maingate in Anaheim! The room was comfortable and spacious, and it was just a short distance away from the Disney parks. The best part was the free coffee that was available 24/7 - it was delicious! Our stay was comfortable and convenient, and we highly recommend Motel 6 Maingate to anyone looking for a pleasant and affordable place to stay in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Hair, boogers, and stranger's piercings oh my...
Summary: I wouldn’t recommend staying here. Our room had countless boogers wiped on the walls, sink and bathtub. The bathtub was full of hairs as if not cleaned. The toilet had several hairs on it…. the floor was sticky and not swept. There was a belly button piercing left by the toilet. There was trash and a lot of hair on the floor and the room smelled quite strange. I don’t believe the room was cleaned prior to our arrival.  If you don’t mind filth, the walk wasn’t bad. About 15- 20 minutes from the the entrance.

Room tip: Don't stay here until they fix their problems.

The sheets and towels are old and should be replaced. The beds are also old and uncomfortable. There was no weather stripping around our door so that meant bugs and cooler evenings. Lastly, it’s incredibly loud. You can hear the neighbor fart in the next room. The room itself could use a little upgrading (especially the platform type beds)  but overall comfortable and clean. The pool and spa were amazing, and we loved spending quality family time enjoying a night swim. Our room had a view of the Disneyland fireworks, which my son will never forget after swimming, walking up to our room and seeing the fireworks! Amazing stay, and we will continue to stay at this inviting, family friendly location!

Pros:  - Location is not bad. 20-ish minute walk to the park but it goes quickly.  - Free coffee in the morning.  - Spacious rooms.  - ART stop right out front.  - Mini fridge.  - Staff was nice enough.   - Free parking.   Cons: - Floors felt dirty. We don’t wear shoes in our home but here I felt like I had to wear shoes and I hated that.  - Walls are super thin. We could hear a family arguing very loudly and clearly one night.  - Bugs. Summary Heading: Good rates and easy ART pick up
Summary: The rates are pretty good if booked far enough in advance. The staff is always nice. The ART stops right out front with frequent pick ups. There's a small store inside. No hair dryers in the rooms (must check one out from the front counter). The rooms are about a 2.5/5 for me. They're ok in size but the closet style bathroom doors are awkward, the beds are hard, it gets noisy and it doesn't feel clean (could just be the building's age). They do let pets stay for free, so there's that! Even with the things I don't like, we still stay there sometimes because it's an inexpensive place to stay with a nice staff :)

Summary: This is not the Ritz Carlton or Waldorf Astoria but it is a good value for people wanting to visit Disneyland. Staff are very friendly. Diana rocks as she made this a great trip for my son and I. They have bus stop in front of hotel that takes you directly to Disney
Manager Response: Dear JLu,   Thank you for taking time to share your review with us. We love hearing from our guests and are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you again soon.   Safe Travels.

Summary: This location is really close to Disney. You can hear the fireworks and see them if you walk to the end of the building.  My daughter forgot her very sentimental Pandora bracelet on the bed in the room when we checked out. We checked out and went for lunch and that was when we came to the devastating discovery that my daughter wasn’t wearing her Pandora bracelet. Immediately we got the cheque, paid and left. We got to the hotel and front desk radio’d housekeeping for our room, and SHE HAD THE BRACELET!!! The front desk female took time out of her break to track down the housekeepers cart and got our bracelet for us!! It was so awesome!! We were so relieved!!! Would definitely recommend to stay here. Rooms are very clean, spacious, and beds are super comfy!!
Manager Response: Dear Kanderson,    We appreciate you recognizing our excellent staff, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary Heading: Motel 6 Anaheim Main gate at a decient price
Summary: Motel 6 Anaheim Main gates is a average chain hotel but the room rates just blocks from Disneyland are not a bad buy ...   The Hotel has ample parking , clean rooms and in a area where You feel safe .....    Rates In January 2019 were $180.00 for Friday and Saturday night with 4 people ...   Take the money you saved on the room and help pay for the extra expenses in the mouseland of $5.00 drinks and $12.00 Turkey lege
Manager Response: Hi Gary, We are glad you had a great experience and appreciate your feedback!  We look forward to providing you with all of your future lodging needs.

Summary: As you all know, visitors stay in this area for it’s close proximity to Disneyland only. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Beds were comfy and the bathrooms had plenty of space. The service at check in was great and even though fairly close to the freeway, traffic noise was minimal. Easy 10 min walk to Disneyland. Would recommend this motel if you’re looking for somewhere to sleep whilst visiting Disneyland.

This is one of two motels I use when visiting Disney due to price and location.  Location is very close (2 blocks) to the Anaheim Garden Walk which has the House of Blues and restaurants. Denny's for brekkie is on the way to Disney, and Disney is about 6 blocks. There are city buses as an option.  The motel is older but the rooms are clean, bathrooms work well, wifi works and was free this time. Was only at the motel sleep so can't comment on other amenities. Large free parking lot.  It is next to busy roads but I'm a heavy sleeper so noise wasn't a factor. Highly recommend for the budget traveller looking for a place to sleep.

We were visiting Disneyland for a few days and had our two small dogs with us. This hotel is perfect as they are pet friendly, have a great pet area and the rooms are perfect as they are not carpeted.  Also, this hotel is a lot closer to Disneyland than we thought and is only a 12 minute walk. The shuttle bus also is right on this route and is an excellent option. It is a simple, no frills hotel but the staff are excellent and the rooms are clean. Great for those on a budget who don’t want to stay in a dump. Overall very pleased with this hotel.

Not fancy but clean.  0.9 miles to Disney.  We walked, it was okay in the morning, felt like forever on the way home!  It is a no-frills room, but we spent our time at Disney, not in the room.  Nice view of the fireworks from the 4th floor.  If I stayed there again, I would ask for a room that did not face the freeway, I could hear the traffic noise.  My only real complaint was that the sheets are cheap and "nubby".  I used a shirt over the pillowcase to make it not rough on my skin.

The hotel was conveniently located in relation to Disneyland, the staff were friendly, and the room was clean. You can get a great view of the fireworks from the 4th floor as well. It had recently been remodeled but it's still nothing luxurious. The amenities were very, very basic. They didn't even provide a hair dryer which I normally assume is part of any hotel. The biggest issue I had was the noise. The rooms are not well insulated against noise. We could hear the freeway very clearly from our room and anytime someone walked past the door you could hear everything they said. It even woke me up a few times when people were returning late or leaving early. All in all, it's an "ok" hotel for the price and location but it wouldn't be my first choice again.

That is offensive and can show that all though the hotel and the other staff were very good and I was fully refunded for 2 nights stay after his passive aggressive comments that have no place for some nit wit to act like he is a Philadelphia lawyer and to comment in such a way to a disabled person who was injured at another business, is sheer madness, particularly so when California is so PC but not for the real underdog, such as us disabled people, not withstanding that I found the USA seems to be very disablity unfriendly.

Summary: We stayed here last week.  The hotel is about 15 mins to Disneyland. The reception staff were very pleasant that we dealt with. Room was clean.  Only complaints were the wifi was so slow on 4th floor and the water pressure and hot water wasn't so good.

I come to Anaheim 3 or 4 times a year to visit Disneyland. I’ve stayed here many times in the past and will continue to as I will stay here again in November. Clean and quiet with great service from Management makes it a joy to stay here. Great prices with great proximity to the parks. My name is Bob and I approve this message!

Summary Heading: Nice in ways, not so nice in others
Summary: The price for the location was decent. Most staff were helpful and went out of their way to help me, there were 2 of them that weren't so friendly. One staff member gave me some samples to do my laundry for free.   The room was modern, there was a bit of soap scum left around the bathroom edges such as on the taps. There was a bathtub but I opted to have showers. The water pressure wasn't that great but the water was hot.  Bed was comfortable, air conditioner worked well. I felt safe as the door had a latch as well as another interior lock. Room was very large and felt spacious. Television had a multiple selection of channels to choose from. Free coffee and a coffee maker in the room provided. The sofa/ leather seat had a mark or stain on it so I did not sit there but a single

nice big remodeled rooms.  ART stops right outside and they sell tickets here.  hot Jacuzzi.  nice bed. didnt care for the aireator on the sink tho.  it sprays instead of flowing.  worst coffee of any hotel ive been to.  people said the cuppa chino was good but i drink coffee.  i liked it here and will be back

Summary Heading: Ok enough, but lacks basic amenities that other, cheaper hotels supply
Summary: Look, I wouldn’t normally hold high standards for a Motel 6, but I’ve stayed in cheaper places near Disneyland that looked worse than this place, and at least they offered each room its own hair dryer. Here, they’re available on a first come first serve basis, and if you’re not first, you are s.o.l. unless someone just so happens to check out and turn one in (keep in mind, I visited during a not so crowded time of year and still had no luck, so heaven help you on weekends/holidays/summer). Basically if you’re coming here and think you’ll need one, you better call in advance and try to request one, or make room in your luggage to bring your own.  Also no refrigerator or microwave, which is inconvenient but I can’t get over the hair dryer thing which will effectively put me off of

Summary: Staff really goes out of their way to help you out. They helped coordinate my scooter, my room was VERY accessible, set up my o2 machine - Thank you! The hallways need a good hard clean though, but the room itself was fine. Comfortable and clean. There is a bus (small surcharge) to go to the Parks, but it's an easy stroll. Lots of food choices around too. You can request non Smoking rooms.

We always stay at this hotel when we go to Disneyland.  The rooms have always been clean, no problems my family have always felt safe here and the pool is huge!  They have a front door shuttle service to and from Disneyland which is awesome!  My only complaint is it can be hard to find off the 5 so get your GPS ready.

I read some reviews and thought this could be a good, inexpensive option in Anaheim for a place to just sleep since we wouldn't be spending any time in the hotel.  Our room was dirty upon check-in.  The floors had dirty footprints as if someone had walked in with wet, dirty shoes, and also needed to be swept.  Our sheets had stains on them.  The sheets were also really scratchy as were the towels.  Room sort of smelled musty and damp.  Much better options in the area and worth the few more dollars.

But for a few bucks more you can stay at another nearby hotel and get everything you want and more for about the sameness price.

Summary: Motel 6 doesn’t have an amazing reputation and I was expecting a lot worse! The room was clean, decorated in that mid century modern style LA loves so much, and very close to Disneyland. You can see the fireworks from the parking lot. It’s not fancy, and the towels are not the softest, but it was clean, quiet and comfortable. The only thing weird were the doors to the bathroom-they need some work as they did not close all the way. I would stay here again.

We enjoyed staing atragantar this Motel. The rooms are neat and confortables. All days, you can watch the fireworks from Disneyland. The personal was very helpful and kind.  At the lobby they have food machines, microwave, ice machiner. There are a special bus that takes you to difrtenr places.

Summary Heading: A decent place to stay for a Disney trip
Summary: Stayed here for a 7 day trip to Disneyland with my family (myself, my husband, and our 2 year old) and our friends that had never been to the states before.   The room was always very clean. It looks like it had been updated very recently, which was nice, although there were a couple odd design choices. We missed having a dresser to put our clothes in (there was a little shelving unit instead) and the bathroom doors were double doors that didn't latch. Kind of annoying when you've got a very tall 2 year old that can just pull the doors open while you're in there. Totally reminded me of closet doors.   Staff was always friendly, although often uninformed about the resort shuttle. A couple of times we asked when it was supposed to be coming by and they asked us if we meant an

We chose this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland, it is pet friendly, and affordable. These were definite pros for us. The cons: the floor was filthy. After walking barefoot for 5 minutes, my feet were black. The beds seemed clean so if they would just take some time to thoroughly mop the floors every day it wouldn't be so bad. There was also no door separating the toilet/tub area from the sink area in the bathroom. This is inconvenient when you have more than one person trying to get ready in the morning. We ended up going to Walmart and buying a shower curtain rod to hang in the doorway and putting beach towels over the top to add a little privacy so more than one person could be in the bathroom at the same time.

I’ve stayed here twice now, it’s not as bad as you would think. It’s not luxury but it’s within walking distance of Disney, about 20 minutes. If you’re solo , this is the best place. I just need a place to sleep and this is the best value being that close to the parks

Another stay at Motel 6 Anaheim maingate. I stay here for proximity to Disneyland (walking distance). Nothing fancy but clean (I just need a bed and hot water) and the best price point around. Ask for manager Ali!

Incredibly rude staff. My room was filthy, and there were problems with both the electricity and the phone. When I pointed this out, the staff became incredibly defensive, then insisted it wasn't their problem. Once they got my money, They Just Did Not Care.   My expectations were low, but I didn't expect to deal with bugs, filth, and bad service. I called customer service for Motel 6, but I'll just tell you directly:   avoid this place like the plague.

Summary: Great location 10-15 minutes walk from Disney which is the main reason we stayed. Outside looks a bit run down but inside the room was nice. Pretty basic but was clean has a fridge, coffee maker, was a decent size and looked like the pictures. Wifi was free but you had to ask for logon slips.  Free luggage storage was available.

Summary Heading: Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate Could be an Awesome Place to be
Summary: Location, location, location, this place has it in spades. The main gate to Disneyland and downtown Disney was within walking distance, though I demanded that we Uber’ed. This Motel 6 seemed to have a very friendly team. They supported all of our requests with enthusiasm. They had coffee always ready with to go cups and they had solutions to our questions. They had a flat screen LG television with front USB and HDMI connections that enabled you to view your daily events. Not many hotels have that. Yes, parking was free.   In short, this facility had seen better days. Floors were tiled, but no out dated funky stained carpet usually seen in old hotel facilities. We could smell pest chemicals, indicating some sort of previous pest problem, nothing drastic. Our room had two-aged

You get what you pay for.  The room was not bad and looked just like the pictures.  The pillows were beyond flat. There was  a big cockroach in our shower, although this is gross it is Southern CA and not all that uncommon.  Overall it was decent.  The parking is Free which is nice compared to others around the area usually ranging from $15-$22.

Summary Heading: What you pay, is what you get
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights.   Pros: - Location is 5 stars. Easy to find because its located off the freeway exit. Very accessible to food like restaurants and late night 24 hr fast food within 2 miles. Walking distance to Disneyland and downtown disney.  - The staff was friendly, especially the manager in the front desk, very soft spoken and gave us a warm welcome. I just didn’t get her name.  - Hardwood Floors! - glad the room was not carpeted because my family has asthma. The room looks cleaner and I find it very simple and spacious. - The flat screen wall tV has good Channel selection. Summary: Motel is basic and good walking distance to Disneyland no breakfast available but free coffee each morning is a nice bonus! Rooms are spacious and basic. Towels could do with an upgrade! What we were most impressed with was the service the girls at front desk were welcoming and helpful!

Summary Heading: It's OK, but get the hot water fixed!
Summary: Lovely decor. Got upgraded to a room with a fridge. Friendly staff and good location with convenient pickup for the resort buses. Beds are comfy and the decor is modern. BUT. The hot water was non-existent. It was warm at best.

All the towels were dirty and had long black hair stuck to them. No hot water, not even warm. I will not be staying there again. It's not easy to find. Beds were ok. It was pretty dark around hotel and no food to walk too

Summary Heading: My go to place to stay for a Disney vacation
Summary: Had a falling out some time ago with America’s best value inn on katella. Motel 6 is close to DL. Clean and efficient and at a good price point. Manager Ali gives great customer service! I have had better luck booking through him at the hotel than using 3rd party sites. This is my 5th stay here and I’ll be back in May!

I can live without a fridge or microwave like I usually get in the cheap, seedy motel I usually stay at and pay less for, but when I come back from a long day and I’m locked out of my room for no reason, it kinda sucks. When I went to fix it they ask me if I’m checking out tomorrow. OBVIOUSLY! It’s what I already paid you for! And all we wanted to do all day was take a swim since it’s 100 degrees, but noooooo. Summary Heading: Fairly bland motel but cheap and comfortable
Summary: We stayed here when we took the kids to Disneyland: the great thing about Motel 6 is the price and cleanliness, and with an added benefit of a great pool and spa, the kids are happy and entertained. Location wise it's an easy car drive to Disneyland. Beds were comfortable and there are vending machines as well as coffee and tea facilities in a communal area. But the downside of these places are the sizes of the rooms (big enough for a couple, a bit crowded for a family of four), and the lack of amenities in the room such as microwave and coffeemaker as mentioned by one of the other reviewers. So good enough to stay for a night, but if you wanted to stay a few nights you really are better off paying a bit more for a room with more space and amenities. I found this hotel to be

I have stayed here previously  and knew what the place was about.  Value wise, you can't  beat it.  The only thing is, you have no in room amenities  like a REFRIGERATOR, microwave,  coffee maker, blow dryer...so if you're  staying  more than a couple  of days, it might not work out.  Both times I have stayed has been 2 nights at a time, so I just lived out of my ice chest.  Our room was on the ground floor and also next to the pool.  The room was huge and we discovered  that it was a room for not too ambulatory  of people.  The bathroom also was huge (I  have had motel rooms smaller) but there was no storage space. The room is ok, but you get what you pay for.  Service was friendly and pretty responsive.  The room was average, but one blanket did have a cigarette burn and a stain on it.  There is lots of noise in the complex at night. The walk to Disneyland is about 15 minutes.  I booked last minute, so the other nearby hotel prices were exorbitant and wanted to be within walking distance, so this was the last resort (no pun intended). we were so tired coming back to the room each night, it didn't matter where we slept, what we slept on, so we would stay here again in this situation.

Once we figured it out was no longer an issue. Would have been nice for employees to give us the heads up though. I'd stay there again if I needed a cheap no frills room. Don't walk back after dark, long walk & no other people around so doesn't feel safe. Take the bus instead.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: I'd stayed here 7 years ago and it wasn't too bad, hence our return to the motel. The motel is cheap, 10 mins walk from Disney, has plenty of parking and easy to find. The room was clean and fir for purpose. All we did was sleep there as we left at 7:39 each morning and arrived back at 11. House keeping was fine and clean towels were provided each day! I found a cockroach in my room one evening which was not pleasant but that was a one off. Also, one evening, the police had some guy over a car bonnet one evening when we got back! Yeah we slept with one eye open but most hotels near Disney are loud. Would I stay here again? Maybe!

Summary Heading: Great if planning on walking to Disneyland
Summary: We did not encounter bugs, homeless people, or other vagrants in or around the hotel. The hotel exterior is showing its age under the hot California sun - the metal roof paint is faded. The pool deck area could use a good power washing, but that didn't stop the kids from using it. The pillows in our room were flat - you may have to ask for extras from housekeeping. The rooms were not completely dark with the curtains shut (bring a sleeping mask). No hairdryer either. And if you don't like smaller, thin towels, bring one from home. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for a disneyland trip in August 2016, we asked for housekeeping to not clean our room during our stay because we like our privacy. The front desk wrote a note but after coming back from disney, our rooms lights were on, our curtains were opened, and our belongings were thrown on our bed. They stole a high end lipstick and my mothers brand new shirt. We also found a roach crawling on the floor underneath our bed. Smoke detector had a dead battery along with the air conditioner filter was filthy. Also charge for business center. Only pros to the motel are the friendly front desk staff,  decent view of fire work show from fourth floor, and also free parking.
Manager Response: Melinda, Thank you for sharing your concerns. Please know the service issues you describe are an exception to our guest commitment and as such, we apologize.  Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with your experience we have fallen short and would like to apologize for the service issues you describe.   We invite you to contact our Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: For what we paid was good. I went with a couple of friends to visit Disneyland and the location is good as well. Clean rooms, bathroom and beds. Not a luxury hotel but if you want to save some money this is an option.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when trying to save money
Summary: The Hotel was clean, the staff was friendly. If you are looking for a hotel just to sleep at night after a long day at the park, this is perfect. This hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland so if you have small children and don't want to be carrying them at the end of a long day at the parks, I recommend you use the ART, which takes you to and from your hotel to the parks. Overall great experience for the cost of the hotel!

Room was clean stood on top of lobby very quiet was able to get bus to Disneyland on the side of lobby which was very convenient water pressure in shower was very low outside of hotel was a bit dirty but good value motel HOWEVER BE AWARE WHEN WE CHECKED OUT ON MONDAY MORNING WALKED OUT TO CAR AND FOUND OUT THEY STOLE MY ENTIRE LICENSES PLATE OFF CAR so that made my experience bad at the end :( just that alone I would probably not be staying here again

Summary Heading: Good place to stay when on a budget
Summary: We were greeted by friendly welcoming front desk person. We had a late check in and our room was ready for us. They allowed our pet huge dog don't matter. No additional fee needed.  Bed is comfortable. Soft pillows. Just wished their toiletries are better

Summary Heading: Worst Part of our family's Disney Vacation!
Summary: After reviewing vacation packages for our family on the Disneyland website, my husband and I decided to go with this "Good Neighbor" hotel because of the price and close proximity to the park. Our mentality was that it was just a place to sleep, and that it would suffice. However, after the first night of checking in, my husband and I immediately regretted staying here. A person kept knocking on our door at 2AM. The next morning we thought that maybe somebody had the wrong room and we brushed it off. But, the next night it happened AGAIN and that's when we started feeling unsafe.   We have two small children, and it frightened us to be abruptly woken up by the abrupt knocking on our door. We never answered it because we noticed that some of the people around the hotel premise

Summary Heading: Not the best, but not the worst, either.
Summary: We stayed here on a Saturday night after visiting Disneyland with family. It was about $80-something for the night which seemed a bit pricey for a Motel 6, but I figured it was due to the fact that it was near the resort. I wasn't expecting much. When we got to the room, I was actually a bit pleasantly surprised- hardwood floor and new comforters with a modern bed frame. It was very simple. It wasn't super clean, but it wasn't super dirty, either. It did in a pinch. I would stay here again if we were under the same circumstances. They offer complimentary coffee until 10 am. They have a pretty big pool, too.

We stayed here to go to Disneyland and it was great room was big and clean! The staff was very nice! Definitely will stay again! They have a little gift shop too which was nice after a long day in the parks the coffee in the lobby wasn't that great lol

The price is right for the proximity to Disneyland​ (you can walk there in about 15 mins), but don't expect more than the minimum. Not the tidiest when we arrived, likely because the design features lots of nooks and crannies. It was acceptable, but there is no hair dryer in the room and there's only a limited number available at the front desk. There were a few dodgy characters milling about and someone was being detained by police in the parking lot when we left! Glad it happened on our last day and not our first.

Summary Heading: It's a Motel 6 people, not the Beverly Hills Hilton!
Summary: I really can't complain it's cheap. (Remember Anaheim "TOT" (Transient Occupancy Tax) of 15% on top of the daily rate.)  I booked through Expedia and it included it so be warned. it was cheap,  Or Cheaper than other places. I like free Parking, some places charge $18 bucks per day) First it's a Motel 6 So no Turn down service.  so don't get your panties in a bunch if they aren't. The room we had was unfortunately a room next to the laundry, when we got there they were doing it and it was Noisy.. They offered to move us the next day, however since we spent 99% of our time sleeping at night or at Disney they never washed during the time we were there other than the first day. What I didn't like:  Vinyl flooring  I know a pet peeve but I really like carpets. (I know I'm used to the

I booked a room at the Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate in February through Alaska, mostly for the price as I was taking an exchange student who had a very low budget. I was a bit concerned after I booked, because I went back to read the reviews, and they were mostly horrible. There were complaints of it being dirty, complaints of how far away it was from the parks, even complaints about the service.  From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with smiles and attention. Because we arrived at 9 in the morning, I did not expect our room to be ready, and they happily offered to store our luggage until we decided to come back from the park that night. We didn't arrive back to the hotel until close to midnight, and different staff by now, of course. They were busy checking a lot of people

Summary Heading: No complaints, served its purpose well
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in the spring break season. We were in town to go to a hockey game at Honda Center and to visit the Disneyland Resort. This hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland, though it is a little bit of a hike (about four blocks to the archway entrance, then at least another couple of blocks distance to the park gates). There are plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance, so the location is good. Honda Center was only about a $5 Uber ride away (not walking distance). The price seems to reflect the location.  I thought the condition of the room was acceptable...a little bit worn but nothing bad, and everything seemed clean and functional. The same goes for the common areas. The room did not have a fridge, which was a bummer, but

My son and I came down from L.A. to go to Disneyland so we decided to stay over night in Anaheim instead of making that long drive back to Los Angeles. Because of the price we decided to stay at Motel 6. The biggest mistake! I wasn't expecting the Ritz Carlton but I did expect a floor with carpet. Even with the heater on the room stayed cold. The beds were dressed with only 2 very thin covers. The mattress was so uncomfortable that I woke up with the worst back and headache. The towels, wash clothes, and hand towels were so ragged! The toilet was disgusting not even fully cleaned. I had to clean the toilet before my so or I used it. I definitely would pay more next time. I am not a very picky person, I promise. But there should be a standard that these motels should have to

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for a great price!
Summary: I booked this place thorugh hotels.com and as I arrived, the phone systems were down and they couldn't accept third party requests.  After talking to Hotel.com for over an hour (they refused to refund me the money-eventually Motel 6 got them to cancel it), Motel 6 gave me 10 dollars off (per night) what they had promised.  Shortly thereafter, I arrived in my room and was very shocked at how nice it is.  Not your typical motel 6.  It was a great lace, good location, and staff was amazing.
Manager Response: Dear Augie,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent service, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary Heading: My new go to hotel when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Great value for the money and close to Disneyland. Nice staff and clean room. I like the laminate flooring. Will stay here again in sept. Last budget hotel I stayed in Anaheim had bedbugs and was my worst hotel experience of my life. Where ever you stay always check the bedbug registry for that city. It is an eye opening experience in that you would think that expensive hotels are immune to this problem. Not true!
Manager Response: Dear Bob,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent staff, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: We were very pleased with our 2 night stay at this hotel. The room was very spacious and I loved the cubbies on the wall in lieu of dressers  because it was so easy to put the next day's clothes and personal items of everyone in their cubby! The room was clean and the table with seating was great to have snacks and games. I would recommend this to anyone going to Disneyland. The staff was super helpful and nice. There is a shuttle to Disney but it is for a charge. I think $6 adults each way $3for kids, but it doesn't run past 11:30pm FYI in case you want to stay late at the park. Otherwise it is a 5 minute drive to the parks.
Manager Response: Dear Sciandra,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent service, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: Booked this motel for a cheap stay post Disney Land to chill and shop.  If you are looking for a cheap, basic accommodation close to Disney then this is for you.  However our stay was not quite as magical.  We were given a room on the 3rd floor overlooking the Interstate 5 entrance/exit.  Constant traffic noise.  Room was very basic and clean.  However the biggest problem we had was our neighours who seemed to be out all day and night had a yappy dog locked in their room that barked constantly. We went to the pool one night and that was quite busy and nice.  So if you are looking for cheap basic accommodation near Disney then this is for you.  Just ask not to face the highway and beware your neighbours!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent value, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: I stayed at this Model 6 in Anaheim to attend the 2017 Wondercon (Convention Center) and found the location with search for local hotels. I waited till the week of the event so available rooms at under $200 a night were pretty limited but still (at that price level) expects a decent place aka clean, hot shower and decent. What I got for $140 a night was a blonde hair on the bed (not mine) and not able to take a hot shower both nights (hot water ONLY worked during the day).   Sadly I found the hotel to be AWFUL. The staff was polite and they have free parking but the room was dirty as heck. The first sign that this was going to be an awful stay was when the hot water did not work on Friday when we checked in after the convention. We wanted to take a shower and go to bed instead

My husband and I stayed at this Motel 6 for our honeymoon and it was amazing. The cleanest Motel 6 I had ever stayed at. 7 years I have been recommending this hotel to many people. Never again!   Our family (8 of us) had a week trip planned for Disneyland. My sister and her husband have expensive taste, and I wasn't even worried about this place for them. At some point my mom had a gut feeling that she should book somewhere else. We (her, me and my husband) would still need to stay here 1 night as we drove up with my dogs.   When we got to the motel, my mother and I went to check in. I had booked through Hotels.com, 1 room for her and 1 room for my husband and I. The front desk clerk said that she only saw one room on file, I looked up the reservation in my email and showed her,

Summary: It's about a mile to walk to Disney. When you are walking so much at Disney it really wears the kids out before they even get to the park, parents too.  I think the hotel rooms and property could have been cleaner. My kids got out of the pool and walked upstairs to our rooms and their feet were black from cigarette ashes. A good power wash would help ever so often. Also, the floors in the rooms didn't seem like they got mopped, just swept.

Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland. We were at the hotel for 6 days and enjoyed our stay. We wanted a place that would suit our needs, but not cost an arm and leg, as we would be spending most of our time elsewhere, and this worked perfectly.  The rooms are clean and we liked the table and chairs. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They have free wifi, you just have to ask at the front desk and they will give you a code for it. The only downside is that the code only lasts 24 hours, so you have to go get more every day if you need the internet for anything.  It's a short walk to Disneyland from the hotel, and they do have a bus that takes you right there. We could also see the fireworks from our room, so that was nice!  They have a gift shop that has a lot of cute
Manager Response: Dear Mitsliss,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent service, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: Best part is that they have free parking and the hotel is only a 15 min walk to the gates of Disney Land and California Adventure! Pretty clean, quiet, good shower, WiFi costs $2.99, the reception desk sells Disney California Adventure tickets for $95 each, no breakfast except for coffee and unfortunately they only use styrofoam cups. :(

Summary: We booked a room for us and the granddaughte {2 yrs}.  The room was clean and she loved the little table and bench.   The room was clean, it was just what we needed.  There was a shelf for our drinks/snacks that was perfect.  The table area was really cool, like a little diner.   The bathroom, okay, the door didn't lock.  Wasn't supposed to.  Because it was a king room?  I don't know.  But, it was okay,  The style of the room reminded me of a hotel you might book in Hollywood.  It was clean, modern.  The Hubster used the hot tub, he said it was nice.  He met people there from all over.  Families, couples, singles.   The bed was quite comfortable, slept very well.  There wasn't noise in our room, we faced the back parking lot.   The staff on check in/out were very nice.  The

Summary Heading: Great option for travelers who want a pet friendly stay within walking distance to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Maingate Motel 6 during the first week in February.  Our main focus was to have a pet friendly hotel within walking distance to Disneyland and this location was perfect for that purpose.  Julene checked us in when we arrived at 10:30 PM.  She was incredibly friendly and helpful and provided us with excellent and personable customer service.  Most of the front desk staff were courteous and helpful but Julene was the best! Upon arrival, we noticed the guys on bikes and other questionable characters hovering outside the hotel in the side parking area.  They watched us carefully as we unloaded our car but aside from that, they pretty much kept to themselves.  Actually, they were quite polite for questionable characters.  On subsequent nights, there was

I stayed in this hotel mid last year and can only express my total satisfaction for the place.   The room was large and very comfortable, great for resting the legs after a big day at Disney.   Speaking of which, the location in relation to Disney is unreal for the price I paid. This room was an absolute steal.   People will find the smallest things to complain about but there is nothing wrong with this place at all. Save yourself some pennies and head here.

This is our third stay here for a Disneyland trip.  We normally spend one night here prior to checking in onsite, but this time we stayed three nights in a room with a fridge as it was a quick trip.  Staff was very nice and accommodating as always.  Extra pillows requested were brought in as promised during housekeeping.  Beds are comfortable, the heating/cooling works well, and room was spotlessly clean.  It can be a bit of a 'trek' to your room and even using the elevators you may encounter a few stairs in the outside corridors getting to your room.    The following is just some general information for those staying for DL trips;  The bathroom is one room, the toilet and shower/tub are not separate from the sink/mirror area.  Something to keep in mind if you are a group that

Late review however I still wanted to give my opinion on our stay. Family of four (2 kids & 2 adults) stayed at this hotel in July for our visit to Disney. Had corner room with view of fireworks at night. Great stay with easy walk to Disney. Would stay again.   Room:  Spacious  Mini fridge  Clean   Hotel: Free parking  Downstairs by lobby there was a vending machine, microwave, coffee and small area to eat. By entrance also a store that sold some food items along with souvenirs. Computer desk with printer at entrance (not sure what fees may apply to use as we did not use).

We stayed here for two nights because we were visiting Disney.   The room was clean. And provided what we needed.   A place to sleep and shower.  It was a little farther than we wanted to walk so we paid for the shuttle to get to the park. It was convenient and five dollars a day.

We had a great time at this hotel, the staff were so lovely especially Victoria and Heather. The pool is great too. Excellent value for money and it was the best place we stayed on our entire trip to the US! It's not super fancy but when you spend all day at Disneyland all you need is a place to crash!

A friend and I booked at this motel for our recent Disney trip.  I chose this motel because of the location and price.  It was cheaper ($60ish/night) than even the Air BnB's in the neighbourhood which worried me, but everything was excellent.   The location is within walking distance of Downtown Disney (about 6 blocks) but I also saw buses coming and going from the motel so there are other transport options if walking is difficult.  I asked for a quiet room and got one that faced away from the highway and it was very quiet and comfortable.  We were able to watch fireworks from our room.  The room itself was clean.   The shower worked well.   The only issue was the wifi.  First, I was surprised there was a charge for wifi since it's been years since I have had to pay for wifi.

I stayed at the hotel because it was close to Disneyland. The good thing is that the service of the staff is very good. The know their business. The rooms are spacious. However there is no breakfast served at the hotel. It is a 12 minute walk to Disneyland.

I spent just one night here while visiting the Disneyland area. I was pleasantly surprised at how neat and clean the rooms were. The new style and design made it so convenient to store my and my partner's luggage. The front staff were very nice and helpful; overall a great place to stay! It's definitely economy because there are very limited amenities, but the service and cleanliness alone has convinced me to try this place again!

Yes the outside is a little old and dated. However, the rooms have been updated and are very clean.  I was unsure of what kind of adventure coming here would entail. But I was pleasantly surprised to a very clean and simple room. The floors are a faux hardwood and there is an orange accent wall. We did not have a dresser, but there is a closet and some 'modern' box shelves for your clothes.  The beds were comfortable as were the pillows. The bed is a little on the firmer side. The sheets were clean and looked new.  The bathroom was just a typical bathroom. It was clean and they did have little shampoo and conditioner packets for your convenience.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! We pulled in late and the lady at the front desk got us checked in and on our way in 5

This location is a great value. It's not fancy and the exterior could probably use a good scrubbing but our room was clean, we felt safe, and the staff was very friendly & helpful. We had two dogs with us and the staff was very kind and accommodating. My only suggestion is that fans in the bathrooms would make the room feel more fresh.

Pros: Great location (about a 10-minute walk to Disneyland park). The size of our room was good for a family of four. Check-in was fast. Free ample parking. Hot shower. AC/heater in room. Flat screen TV.   Cons: The facility and the room need a facelift. We weren't too happy about the hardwood floors (we were on the 2nd floor). No microwave, fridge and coffee in our room. There was no privacy door tag.   Overall, it was okay. I wouldn't recommend it for families with little kids, especially if you need to heat up something or need a fridge for formula, milk, etc. You get what you pay for. Good for maybe sleeping there for a night if you're driving in from San Jose, San Francisco, etc.

I recently stayed here for a trip to Disneyland, and overall I would say that the hotel is average. The best part of this hotel is that it is right down the street from the theme park.  The hotel staff is very kind, and the lobby had lots of vending machines, coffee/cocoa, a souvenir shop, etc. However the room did not have any amenities.   The room was large (I booked a double queen), and had a little kitchen nook in it as well which was convenient. I had no problem with cleanliness while staying here and the room was stocked with plenty of towels and washrags.   I will say that the walls were pretty thin, and I could hear people walking down the halls and in the room next door at night but I had earplugs which helped. I was also unable to connect to wifi the entire time I was

Do Not Stay Here!  I understand it's my fault, I was trying to be economical and smart because if we are going to spend from 8am to midnight, why spend too much on hotel right?  Wrong!!!!!   We arrive and its pretty regular for a budget motel.  As we go to our room on the third floor there is a lingering smell of urine, dirty old laundry and old faint cigarette smoke.   We get in our room, it's laminate floors thank God.   I believe they tried to remodel but it is still barren and cold.   I had paid for WiFi which I couldn't connect to at all.  I called and she said it must have been my phone.  Our TV worked then didn't, then did.    Then to make things safer and better, there were a few police and three cars arresting someone.  The lot is patrolled by security too.  We washed

Hello I just visited this hotel in Anaheim, the room is very limited, no refrigerator, no coffee machine and no carpet. They have a great staff very friendly and courteous. The good thing about this motel is the distance to Disneyland, knots berry farm and the price, if you do not care about luxury and just want a place to crash and take a shower this is the place to reserve. I hope this review helps any body make a decision.

Summary Heading: Don't get fooled b teh pictures and the price
Summary: I write this review with great deception I was expecting more. Always one to cheer for the underdog I was hoping that Motel 6 chain poor reputation was just urban folklore ... last weekend Motel 6 Disney Way prove me wrong the place was a dive. A friend and I went to Anaheim to catch a couple Blue Jays game and thought that we were gonna go economy style or accommodation with the reasoning that we were only gonna sleep there anyway we were wrong. The first non-smoking room we got smelled like smoke and you could see cigarette burns on the bed linen (it was an eye opener) back to the lobby the amazing staff (not kidding here staff was great) had no problem giving us another room we got lucky the second room did not smell like smoke it just had pubic hair in the tub. Although the

I  stayed here several times over the last year and find it cheap, convenient, and pet friendly.  The rooms are always clean and fresh, and the staff friendly and helpful.  On the plus side the linen seems to have been upgraded so very my last visit.  On the down side, and this is a major issue, is the grounds.  They are full of litter, cigarette butts, and stinky from pet smells.  Management needs to address this or I will be unable to continue to recommend a stay here.  And Motel 6 NEEDS to offer FREE WiFi.

The front desk staff were pretty good.  The wifi was horrible and barely worked. The rooms looked liked the were renovated recently. But the one complaint I had about the rooms were the strong chemical smell. I can't put my finger on the smell but I'm assuming it was roach spray.  The hotel grounds were also pretty dirty and not well maintained.

Summary Heading: Okay for the price and location
Summary: This motel 6 is very big. But when you are near Disneyland, lot's of people need a cheap place to stay. The room was pretty modern. The bathroom was clean. The room was clean. The outside was not the greatest. The smokers and people eating junkfood left a mess. The location is about 5-10 minutes walk to the entrance of Disneyland. But around the block is the outdoor shopping venue with club, restaurant, and bars. It is also right off the freeway exit, which is nice. There are places to eat along the main street. It is near many stores like Target and Walmart about 5 minutes drive. We did not use pool as there were tons of kids playing in it. They do have tea and coffee. Also maps and brochures of the area's offerings. Parking lot did not seem very secure. But luckily nothing

Summary Heading: Good for families trying to save some money
Summary: I found this hotel to be very clean. I have stayed here twice the first time for 4 days and the second time for 8 during a Disney Vacation. Walking to Disneyland is a very good option if you don't want to pay for parking I honestly think you walk just as much in the Disney parking structure.

I've stayed there the last 3 years now and it was just dirtier.  Smokers are plenty and trash everywhere outside. Place could use a power washing. The bathroom just seems to be wiped down but not cleaned. Found long dark hair on bath floor when my daughter and I don't have that!  Definitely a trade off to consider next time. Nicer hotel or cheap?

Summary Heading: Good value, convenient location for Disneyland
Summary: This is a good hotel for people who want a cheap place to lay their head down between visits to Disneyland. It's certainly not the Ritz or the Disney Grand Californian. But then, this place isn't $600-$1,000 a night. There are cheaper motels in Anaheim, but those I found were quite a ways from Disneyland or they had horrible TripAdvsor reviews. If price is an issue, like it was for us, this place is a decent choice. Do be aware that the rooms are sparse. No decorations, just the basics--barely.  The GOOD: Our room was clean, as was the bathroom. Saturday at 8 a.m. and Sunday at 10 a.m. there was plenty of hot water! We paid $6 a night for a mini fridge and glad we did. It kept our sodas ice cold. Floor is a cheap laminate--much better than hotel carpeting which is usually gross.

Summary Heading: Location and price were great, but not much else :(
Summary: Mattresses are not comfortable, pillows are worse, and there were nats flying all over in the bathroom. I understand of course, that the bugs probably flew in when the room was being cleaned, but we had 2rooms with an adjoining door, and the second room was bug free. Also found a dead, hardened bug stuck to one of our "clean" bath towels! I will say tho, the front Lobby staff were very nice. I personally will spend more and stay elsewhere next time.

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay.
Summary: This motel had a very friendly and helpful staff. The Anaheim Resort Transit has a a stop on site so it's easy to get to Disneyland. Of course this also means you hear bus noise every 20 minutes until about 1am. But that's not a big deal. The rooms are really cute but kind of stark. There's nothing on the walls and the floors are bare. There's no fridge, microwave, or in room coffee, but they have microwaves in the lobby area and morning coffee. There's no hairdryer in the rooms and they only provide soap and shampoo (no conditioner or lotion). There also aren't any "do not disturb" signs which always made me feel like I might be disturbed!  There is a nice laundry facility on site and vending machines. There's also an arcade game (Ms. Pacman and Galaga)!  The pool is pretty big

We were really surprised at the rooms here. They were clean, had laminate wood flooring, and were spacious. It met our needs for staying close enough to the Disney Parks while not being too expensive. It's also part of the Anaheim Resort Transit routes so it was a short wait and a quick ride to the parks. I think they even clean the rooms twice a day for the guests that take naps halfway during the day as one of the housekeepers walked in on my fiancé and I taking a bath...we couldn't stop laughing! It was our fault for not locking the dead bolt. Didn't use the pool and no continental breakfast. Either way, we would choose to stay here again.

Recently remodeled to give it that 1960's look and feel!   Beds are comfortable.  I wish coffee was served all day.  It is avaable until 10;00AM only.  Hard wood floors in all rooms.   Nice pool and hot tub!  Relatively quiet.

This is an excellent place to stay if you're looking for an inexpensive hotel and within walking distance of Disneyland.  Staff was very informative on how to best experience our trip to Disneyland.  Hotel is right off the freeway, so it is very easy to get to.

The hotel is good for the price. The rooms have been updated and they are clean. towels are a little small but they do the trick. only about a 15 min walk to disneyland with restaurants along the way. The only downfall is the bed was not very relaxing and the sheets are very thin. I would recommend this hotel if your looking to save money on hotel and to be honest your only there about 10% of the time.

We stayed here a few years ago when we went to Disneyland. We were satisfied at that time. This time, the room had NO amenities in it. We expect to have a fridge at least. I've NEVER stayed at a Motel 6 our Super 8 that didn't have a fridge, microwave, or in-room coffee maker. All we got were bed and bathroom. That's NOT good enough Motel 6! We WILL NOT be staying here again!

I mean it's a decent place at a decent price. Gets the job done, pretty plain but when you need somewhere to stay for a pretty good price, here you go.  Pretty close to Disneyland, so if you are traveling on a budget- here you go!

This motel tried to cut corners where it hurts.  It is a long walk to any restaurant.  There are no stores nearby, either.  To attract Disney families they should offer a simple continental breafast.   I would stay at this motel only if they had a breakfast.  The floors in the rooms are weird, but ok.  The rooms needs a dresser.  I would recommend paying an extra $5-10 or so to get a motel that comes with food in the morning.

I will say the rooms are acceptable. Fully "modern" Wall lights. Corner seat-thing. table. And New TV wall unit/with the accent lighting.   Big Bathroom/and wood doors.   a wall cubby, and raised bed. It was close to $100. My room faced the Anaheim Blvd/Haster Street, by the I5 on ramp. The walkway outside had a pile of rags and trash all day. and noisy persons, smoking outside. The people next door to mine, had people, tapping on the door, whistling, and conversing loudly, at 3am.  I thought it unsavory.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a week at Disneyland!
Summary: I'd have loved to stay at a Disney hotel, however these are extortionately priced so I simply chose the cheapest hotel I could find within a reasonable walking distance from the parks. I made an excellent choice! Well, a couple of friends actually stayed here and recommended it - so technically they made the excellent choice.  The motel is around a 15-20 minute walk to the park entrances, but it honestly doesn't seem that long. Once you come out of the hotel and turn a corner you can see Grizzly Peak, the Matterhorn and Tower of Terror looming in the distance which makes the walk all the more exciting. I stayed here alone (27 year old female) and walked back to the hotel in the dark alone every night (I honestly thought there'd be other people walking back too but I never saw a

I usually don't ever stay at Motel 6's but this one seemed ok from online pictures and reviews.... Boy was I wrong.  It was dirty (especially the bathroom floors) and cheap looking and feeling.  The towels were thin and the mattress was hard.  Overall, even for Anaheim it was overpriced and a big disappointment.    Also, our sheets had a big stain on it which is always gross.  And the staff were unfriendly and unwilling to help.  At best they were apathetic about their employment and seemed more concerned with talking to each other than assisting guests.  I will never come here again.

Summary: Recommend hotel clean room, close to the parks good for the price nice staff.  Will go there again had a good time nice bathroom comfy bed plenty of free parking. Nice and quiet easy check in and out thank you staff

This is my go-to motel when I stay in Anaheim and going to Disneyland is always clean and I feel that some of the reviews are unfounded and unkind to this Motel they always treat me very well true it is a bit farther away from Disneyland that I would like but it's a clean safe very affordable place to stay on a budget

We stayed here for a concert at the Honda Center and it was a good option for us. The staff was very friendly and made the whole process very easy. We arrived a bit early but they were helpful and even gave us tips on where we could go to pass the time. The rooms were very clean and there was little noise at night even though we were near the highway. It was a very pleasant stay and they even called us to inform us we had forgotten some things in our room. I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for....
Summary: This is a budget hotel near Disney.  If you are on a tight budget then it's a good option.   If you are hoping for a little bit more than basic you will be disappointed.  It's close (but not walking distance) to the park.  The shuttle to the park is ok if you are not in a hurry.

Summary: The initial appearance of the room was okay however once we got into the room I found all kinds of issues. The floor was absolutely filthy. I ended up using some cleaner I had in my car to clean the floors enough to feel comfortable with my kids being in the room. I then looked at the towels and washcloths to find that they had stains on them, which made me wonder if they were even clean at all. The bathroom had hair all over including in the tub. Upon waking up the first night I found a cockroach climbing up the wall by the toilet. The second day there my family needed to do some laundry and after drying our clothes for 2 hours we finally brought them up and hung them in our room to dry them. When my husband complained about the dryer not working he was pretty much laughed at.

Summary: We just stayed at Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate for two nights, for our one day trip to Disneyland. We needed to go cheap, and with the deal we found, it was great. Room was very clean. Travelers should know that it is directly across from the freeway, so there are those sounds. That said, I requested a room on the opposite side, and they were happy to accommodate me. I am a *very* noise sensitive person, and was happily surprised that (with my noise machine on at night!) it all went very well. Our room was just up from where the shuttles come and go, so there was that noise to deal with. Summary: Well we just needed an overnight stay while visiting Disneyland.. This did the job, don't get me wrong I wouldn't want to stay here for a week! The check in was fast and friendly, the room was clean and practical for an overnight stay, but as there was no wardrobe or rails or draws, no way could I have stayed longer.. The pool looked tired but tidy, didn't look to inviting... It served its purpose, and not to long to walk to the parks, maybe 15 mins...

Room was clean with fresh linens. Front desk staff went out of their way; even giving driving directions to the hotel. The morning coffee is a good medium roast. Close enough to walk to the Garden Walk.

Summary: the overall stay was good, the room is big and clean.  there's a ART bus station just right outside, and it's 15 min walk to Convention center, I think it's great for what's paid.  Cons: there's no hair dryer, no fridge, and no hot water kettle in the room.

We stayed at Motel 6 for 3 nights to go to Disneyland.  We picked it because of it’s cost (one of the cheapest places I could find within a reasonable walking distance) and proximity to Disneyland.  The room accommodations were simple and modern.  Since we were in the parks all day, we only came back to sleep, and for this is was perfect.  The parks were a little less than 1 mile away, about a 15 minute walk.  This was fine for our adult only group, but with smaller kids, it may be worthwhile to spend the extra $ to stay a little closer.  Cost wise though, everything else around was 50% more per night.  There is a pay shuttle called the ART if you do not want to walk. My only dislike was the door to the bathroom area were two ½ doors that came together instead of one more solid

I stayed here on a Saturday night to visit Disneyland on Sunday.  The staff at the desk were friendly.  The room was refurbished in the style that a lot of Motel 6's are going to; hardwood floor and modern furniture.  The room was spacious, clean and had a comfortable bed.  Parking was free as well as the wifi.  The hotel was as quiet as you would expect a hotel near Disneyland to be; I went to bed about 10pm and slept through the night.

Summary Heading: Not the best place to stay .....
Summary: I was very disappointed at the condition of the room;  poor working lights, dirty bedding and poorly kept grounds on the outside.  There were people constantly lurking in the parking lot and on property during all hours of the night, despite presence of onsite security. It was often noisy with cars racing through the parking lot.   I would not recommend this hotel.

Everytime we walked in they asked how our day was.. The room was clean. Floors had bamboo wood flooring.. Far better than carpet. Room was quiet beds cozy. Disney is a short walk away or they have a bus to take every 30 min. Will stay here again and the price was great for the location❤️❤️

Summary: 1st, the the lack of furniture was jaw dropping! There was hardly any! A couple of narrow shelves to put some cloths on but that's it, no dresser at all as well as no night table for one side of the bed!  2nd I was told that they provide a breakfast and there was none! They do however provide "complimentary coffee/hot chocolate and it had more water than flavoring! 3 the pool closes strictly at 10 far earlier than when people are returning from the park! 4th there if a very strict curfew for EVERYONE INCLUDING ADULTS at 10:30! 5th I waited for over an hour for clean towels to be delivered to our room! 6th The clerk gave us incorrect info on shuttle passes. They were supposed to sell them to us, we had to hunt down the info for it. Then misinformed us on how they can be used too.

Great place to stay for Disney trip!   Pros- newly renovated, contemporary rooms, great value for the money, quiet, walking distance to Disney (10-15 min), friendly staff, clean rooms  Cons- small towels, no hair dryers, no on-site breakfast (but can walk to many places)  Would definitely stay here again and recommend it!

1st time stay and never again. Stains on both comforters of the beds (Really, not that hard to wash things or replace), Bathroom was nasty. The wall towel holder had what looked blood inside it, bathroom floor was in desperate need of a mopping, overall room smelled and towels did too. I didn't even sleep inside the bed sheets for fear of God knows what. I know this is Motel 6 but seriously, you should have basic rules for cleanliness. Fire your housekeeping staff or something because that was ridiculous. My advice, DON'T stay here. If you do, do a thorough check of your room, THOROUGH! For the money, there are way better and cleaner places.

When I made my reservation online. the price for the room were $201.00. When I checked into the room, it went up to 269.00 for two days. It is misleading when you book the reservation. And we had no choice but to take it, because there were no rooms, and it was late and we traveled 4-5 hrs.  SO BEWARE OF PRICE CHANGES.

Summary Heading: Pretty good for a budget bed near Disneyland
Summary: This Motel 6 was serviceable and honesty seemed like a good value for what I paid.  I paid for two nights upon arrival.  In the afternoon of the second day I had to cut my trip short and return home for a work emergency.  Upon checking out, without my asking, the attendant at the desk offered to refund the second night.  This was unexpected and much appreciated.  All the staff I encountered were very helpful and courteous.    There are a few rough edges but it was clean and a fair value.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, service could be better
Summary: We stayed here for one night while visiting Disneyland. The rooms were clean and very comfortable, and the location is fantastic (very close to Disneyland and also a 7/11). Diane (the older one) and a guy (Josh?) at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, but the three other employees I dealt with were quite abrupt and seemed a little annoyed to be bothered with anything. My room also smelled of smoke even though it was meant to be a non-smoking room, but aside from that it was perfect. One thing to note is that the rooms do not have a fridge unless you ask, and it's $6 extra per day. I would stay here again if I was in the area.

Summary Heading: NIce if your on a Budget
Summary: I love this Motel  I stay here whenever were doing just a quick trip to Disney...  the rooms are recently updated which adds a nice little touch  parking at night can be a little hard once returning to your room from a day at the park but that's understandable

great upgraded rooms.  when i checked in i found no remote for the tv so i had to wait for that.  then some people were outside talking at 11pm and the noise came through the door bottom because there was no door bottom.  the next day i told the front desk about this and they gave me a new room that was not on the major walkway.  it is .6 miles from disneyland though.  i was real happy with the staff, they were very helpful and nice.  i would stay here again

Me and my family stayed at this motel while visiting Disneyland, and what I didn't like was you only get a sheet and 1 thin blanket, and I was FREEZING at night,  I had to ask for another blanket,  it was another thin blanket,  helped a little,  but not a lot.  My son who was on the other bed was also really cold,  he also requested a blanket,  but the office personnel told him there were no more.  Also once we turned out the light, I had to turn it back on after a few minutes,  and was shocked to see 2 huge cockroaches crawling on the wall, Eek!  Not only was I disgusted, but I also freaked out, since I'm scared of any creepy-crawlers. You can imagine,  I did not have a good night sleep after that,  always on the lookout if anything was going to crawl on me.  The bad thing is

After a long day at Disneyland, we followed Google maps to this hotel and it was right around the block! The front desk clerk was very helpful when we needed directions to food and shopping and the room was spot on. We were a trio of adults happy to find someplace clean, close and very very cost-effective. Great, spacious layout of the room, quiet and nicely appointed. Adults and families will not be disappointed!

This was, at one point, in the late 80's,  a "Hotel Ibis".  I had a friend who worked here.  The room I had was a "modern version" :wood floors, pedistal bed frame,  wood cubby-tower. orange walls, raised bathroom sink. all new, and nicely maintained. Huge new TV. with taxes it was $98. There are several Motel 6's in the area. I can think of three, (all of them are substandard)  this one?  IS NOT! they first tried to stick me in a "handicapped-accessable" room.  I had to return to the front desk and tell them "it won't do". I was immedediatly reassigned

The motel is conveniently close to Disneyland. You can walk a short two blocks or take a shuttle which operates every 30 minutes for $5.00 per person. They don't offer breakfast but they do offer complimentary coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby. They have a vending machine with fruit, sandwiches, pizza pockets, breakfast sandwiches and etc with a mixrowave to use. Motel does say they charge for WiFi but when I asked for free WiFi he gave it to us at no charge. Very accommodating to our stay.

I stayed at Motel 6 because they not only allow dogs but don't charge extra for them. The rooms were very clean, recently updated + also kept clean during our stay.Loved that the floors didn't have carpet. I consider carpeting to be a filth gathering thing to have in hotel rooms.

Close to Disneyland which was great.  The staff was great!!  But our room smelled like smoke horribly and they sprayed it, but someone had been smoking in there and it ruined the whole time in the room.

Staying here was ideal for central location to Disneyland(shuttle available!), beaches, etc. Updated decor, carpet-less floor and mini-fridge upon request were highlights for me. Small con was no alarm clocks. Family-friendly environment, security patrol, clean neighborhood, great room service and staff at front desk were professional and friendly- quickly becoming highlight of my stay, besides Disneyland! Thanks a lot, guys!

Summary Heading: Kinda ok budget hotel close to Disney
Summary: I ended up staying at this hotel as the one in Santa Ana on 1st street was sold out on Thur night. The one on Katella was also sold out. I had stopped here after Disney just to check on availability and price since I saw it off the fwy as I was leaving Disney and it was a few minutes closer than Santa Ana. However, for $30 more, I was going to drive to the other hotels and pay less. But they were sold out, so paid up and stayed here.  Was in room 235 with 2 beds in the back of the hotel. It had a corner booth like table. Bathroom water I thought sprayed too strongly and splashed. Toilet flushed way too hard and fast as well. I really liked the Santa Ana Motel 6 better, but was stuck at this hotel. The elevator was ok. Parking was convenient.   What I really didn't like was

You can't get more basic than these rooms.  We had two rooms with two queens in non-smoking rooms.  No dressers, no closet, wooden floors with a quick, easy walk to Disneyland.  There were issues with one of the rooms and the motel desk clerks and manager could have and should have done more to make the situation easier to live with. We received an e-mail from Motel 6 Guest Relations to contact them about the issues we had and they were quick to help out.  They contacted the motel while we were on hold to see if any compensation was given to us.  There hadn't been, and immediately the guest relations woman told us that she would refund the full price for both rooms even though only one room had the problem.  Thank you Motel 6 Guest Relations!

I cannot say enough about this location, was stressfully booking a trip that's 8-months away, and had to make a last minute change. Kelsy was a joy to speak with and went above and beyond to take care of us. I will forever be a Motel 6 customer. Thanks Kelsy!!

Summary Heading: Our Go To Place in Anaheim
Summary: This motel used to be a Red Roof Inn and I was a little hesitant to try it again after Motel 6 took over. I love this motel. No hidden fees, no nonsense check in and the rooms have been updated and are modern. I wish a fridge and microwave were standard in every room, though. We have stayed here several times and have never had a complaint (except wishing for a fridge and micro). Will continue to stay at this hotel until they give us a reason to choose elsewhere.

We liked the wood floors and how spacious the room was. Great rates and close to everything  downtown Disney, Disneyland, Knottsberry farm, and the downtown Anaheim area   Not far from beach    The common areas were kept clean and the plants were very nice and had plenty of parking   It was a big hotel and we parked in the same parking space every time every day and we left 5 or 6 times daily and for up to 8 hours at a time

Summary Heading: Celebration 50th And 60th BirthdaysDisneyland and California  Adventure
Summary: Most of the other Hotels had us priced out because Mom and Dad were paying hotel and admission and shuttle. 5 Adults and 2  Children 1st time. . Grandparents Joy.  2 bedrooms with 2 queen beds with AARP card $600 for 3 nights Motel 6 Maingate.  Admission 5 adults and 1 child day pass for each park Saturday and Sunday about $1000. 2 Day Hopper is about $$220 x 5=$1100 Save $100+. Shuttle from hotel $5 per day adults $2 children.  McDonalds across from entrance to park on Harbor Blvd.  Enjoy life. All day. Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary Heading: Location is only reason for 1 star
Summary: We stayed at this motel for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.   THE STAFF STEALS! I had a watch and a bracelet taken from my room while I was out for the day. I contacted the front desk and they repeatedly told me they would look into it and get back to me. No one ever got back to me. I had to keep calling after I left and it boiled down to "we asked the cleaning staff and they didn't see it." And that was it. There is no excuse for stealing and no excuse for the horrible customer service.   It IS within walking distance to Disneyland but there are plenty of other places to stay.

Where to begin? We booked this hotel because it was the cheapest one we could book within walking distance of Disneyland. The only good thing I have to say about this hotel is that it was mostly clean (besides the smell) and you could walk into Disney. The first thing you are hit with as you walk into your non-smoking room is the smell of smoke. The furniture is nice and very modern, but the shower was awful. Summary: I chose this hotel based on many positive reviews here and elsewhere. I wish I had gone with my  gut. These rooms are very Spartan, no carpet, no closet or dresser, no fan in the bathroom or microwave. Beds are not very comfortable, no continental breakfast. Extra charges for wifi, the list goes on. Staff was friendly and helpful but there is only so much they could do. gut.

Summary Heading: This isn't a 5 star hotel... But very nice.
Summary: I came out October 2nd and stayed till Monday October 5th. The check in was super easy, and the customer service was awesome. The room was nice, and the bathroom was clean. They have a shuttle that picks you up right outside the hotel, and will take you to Disneyland. The hot tub felt great after a long day on our feet. There were only a few issues I had while staying here: 1. The shower wasn't working correctly. 2.On Saturday night while walking up to our hotel room, the people staying the floor below us looked as though they were going to have a party. Summary Heading: Not great, but fine when all you need is a bed and a shower
Summary: This hotel isn't particularly clean or well-kept. The "clean" towels provided by housekeeping consistently had previous guests' hair stuck to them and the bathroom floors seemed grimy. Also, it got crazy humid in the room from the A/C so everything felt damp. BUT, if all you need is a place that's a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bus ride from Disneyland, this is your spot. We got a room for $65/night booking well in advance for off-season dates and considering we spent from approximately 7:30 am to 10:30 pm at Disneyland everyday, it served our needs. Staff were good and at least tried to help guests out, but they seemed understaffed. We stayed here for 3 nights whilst we went to Disneyland, and was impressed.  It's the easiest to find as its right opposite the slip way from the i5 so can't miss it.  Really friendly staff! So cheap on price for the location, it's 2 min drive to Disney or 20 min walk. And a shuttle runs daily every 30mins for $5 each a day.  It's got a descent pool and hot tube which is open till 10pm so can go for a cool dip after the parks!  The room is a descent size, really clean, good house keeping, done a good job.  There's plenty of restaurants, 7 elevens, gas stations, etc all in the area of the motel.
