Summary: Our family stayed here during Disney's D23 Expo in August.  We were going to be here multiple days, but we figured that we wouldn't be in our hotel very often, so we were okay with a place that would give us the basics - a place to sleep and to shower.  Since it was a Motel 6, we had very low expectations, but the room actually wasn't that bad - the rooms looked fairly renovated so they had a somewhat modern look and feel to them.  It's close to the Disneyland Resort, but probably outside of walking distance for most families.  We walked from here to the Anaheim Convention Center, so the distance is reasonable.  We also felt the staff was helpful and friendly.  This place is a good choice if you're looking for the basics and are trying to save money.

Summary: We stared here on our trip to Disneyland.   Everything was very good except the area around the elevator left a little to be desired.   But, everything else was a pleasant stay.  The bus picks you up right out front so it's very convenient.

This was a quick last minute trip for an event. I didn't want to spend much because I wasn't even going to be in the room for more than a few hours. Thankfully, Motel 6 had a few rooms left (this motel does sell out). The staff is super friendly and helpful. Checking in was quick and finding my room was easy. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The shower, sink and toilet were all clean and in working order. There is a fairly large flat screen tv that I never turned on, a small table with a corner bench and a chair, and some shelves. The AC was on when I got there and was in working order. Room was clean, confortable.  Staff was nice. It's a motel 6 so I didn't expect too much beyond that. It wasn't terrible. The beds were comfortable, no visible signs of wear and tear on the room. Would recommend it.

This is a pretty typical Motel 6 (except for the location.)  It is an older, but pretty well maintained motel.  I paid $78 a night for a single with King bed, which is pretty cheap these days.  That price included all fees, taxes, etc.  There was no, MUCH HATED, "Resort Fee," or any nonsense like that.  I checked many Motels near Disneyland, and this was the best value I could find by far where the motel was rated above a mid-7.  The room was very spacious and clean, with hardwood floors which were a nice touch. It was cleaned every day I was there. The bed was large and firm (which I like.)  The water was hot.  An A/C unit kept the room cold.  I am hearing impaired, so I couldn't comment on the noise, but it IS VERY close to the 5 freeway, so a light sleeper may want to take

We stayed in this hotel because it's near Disney and reviews were great. Its good to stay back in average budgetary and basic like this one. Clean and service was great. Staff was very helpful specially girls in front desk and they guided us for shuttle also. They have shuttle from hotel to Disney which unfortunately don't wait on stop for more than a min so you have to go there and stand. Also there are shuttles to sea world near by so its complete package if you looking around sea world and Disney. Also they have Disney tickets if you want to avoid queues.

Not sure where to start. I got a double room with my adult sister. There was no door for the shower/toilet area. The door enclosed the dressing area, where the sinks, closet, mirror, toilet and shower were. This is a bit inconvenient when you want some privacy but others need to get ready. The bath towels were so thin, I had to use two to dry off. If you have long hair, you may actually need a third towel. The room appeared clean but greatly worn. The laminate was bubbling in some areas on the floor. It was also coming up around the shower in the bathroom. Although we spent little time in the room, the time we were there was not comfortable. The noise from other rooms and the street is loud. I always travel with earplugs, but that only minimized the conversations in the room

There are restaurants and fast food outlets close (we loved del taco) The wifi wasn't free, but the reception staff gave us a couple of free codes to help us search online for bus routes. Summary: Arrived on a Super Shuttle from LAX which took about 40 mins to pick us up, but only took about an hour to get to the hotel.  Check in was painless, and we went up to our room. This was a cheap motel room so we did not expect help with cases, and none was offered; however there is a lift.  Room was big and clean with a super king bed and ample pillows. Bathroom nice although shower was fixed head. Temperature and pressure of shower decent. Plenty of places to hang towels etc and air con unit functioned well without too much noise. Yep, first impressions very good.  Big pool that was seeing a lot of use, but we did not have time to use it.  About 5 min walk away is a shopping centre with a few retail shops, plus some restaurants, but it was all a bit deserted and weird, despite

Summary Heading: Okay motel, good for a Disneyland trip
Summary: We had a family of 4 staying here with 2 kids ages 6 and 14.  The room was fine.  It had modern styling with wood floors.  The flat screen tv was scratchy, we believed it was because of the cable connection.  We didn't mind because we were barley in the room.  The room was decently clean.  The weirdest thing was the double door entrance to the bathroom was outside of the vanity area.  Then there was no separation between the vanity/sink and the toilet/shower area.  Would have been nice to have the door there instead.    The workers were friendly enough.  We had requested a fridge with our room.  When we checked in she mentioned it would be cheaper without it.  I decided we didn't need one since we had a cooler.  However, the price was the same as what I had booked it for online.

Upon our arrival at about 5:30 p.m., July 9, 2015, we were given a first floor room near the pool.  Husband was told the room was ready.  Entering the bathroom area, we found DIRTY towels left over from previous occupiers.  The laundry staff acted like they didn't understand  we wanted clean towels & to please pick up the dirty towels.  The bathroom had absolutely no ventilation and we felt as though we were suffocating. There was mold growing on the bathtub faucet and diverter cover (I have pictures).   In fact...after the first horrible night....we left early after our Disney experience that same day & headed for home.  We had paid to stay another night.    I would NEVER recommend this Motel 6. Summary Heading: A Basic Motel, a Little Far From Disneyland
Summary: This is an ok place to stay if you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room. If you just need a place for you and your family to put your head at the end of a long day at D-land, and you're looking for a way to cut down on costs, this will probably work. You do have to take the shuttle or something if you've got small kids, as it's about a 20 minute walk to the park (or a 7-buck taxi ride, by the way).  It is basic and you get what you pay for: The room is unappealingly plain but clean (no pictures on the walls, and a strange industrial wall color). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom area was clean. If I'm signing up for an inexpensive motel, that's all I'm looking for. Also, the TV worked easily and the air conditioning was quite efficient.  The front desk

Summary Heading: Usually our go to place to stay
Summary: whenever my wife and i plan our vacations to disneyland, which is about 3 - 4 times a year, we try and stay at this motel if possible. hotel staff is friendly and accommodating, romms are up to date, and clean...only downside i can think of is it would be awesome if this place would at least serve continental breakfast to get our days going on a good note.   i made the mistake a couple times thinking staying some where else cause it was cheaper,

Summary Heading: Was a little nervous, but pleasantly surprised
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights for the 4th of July weekend. We were not planning on a hotel stay, but due to a family emergency, our sleeping arrangements changed. Being a holiday weekend, things were pretty booked up. We had our dog with us, so that also made our options limited. I saw this, knew it was near my family and thought ok, it's fairly reasonable for a holiday weekend.. here goes. I must say the front desk was EXCEPTIONAL. I came in to find 2 ladies helping 2 other guest. I was standing there for maybe 2 minutes  when another front desk attendant came up and apologized for my wait. Quickly got my key and headed to the room. We were near the pool, so there was noise from that, but it was promptly quiet in the evening when it closed. Room was pretty clean, very simple. The

My daughter and I planned an overnight visit to Disneyland. There are a few properties we frequent, but thought we would try a more budget-conscious hotel as we only needed basic accommodations: a clean and quiet room within 2 miles of the park for some afternoon down-time and a good night's sleep.  Our choice of Motel 6 @ 100 West Disney Way was a huge mistake.  I had read a few unfavorable reviews for this property, but I took them with a grain of salt as many people are quicker to offer bad reviews rather than good ones. Mistake number one.    We arrived at the hotel at approximately 4:30pm. We noticed the exterior of the building could use a fresh coat of paint.  Entered the lobby to check in. The gift shop is closed between 12:30-5pm, so if you check in during that time and

Summary Heading: Take it from a Disneyland Veteran
Summary: Absolutely can't go wrong with a stay here, I've stayed in hotels ACROSS Anaheim, and considering you will be spending MOST of your day at the parks why pay a fortunate for a room you won't be in except to sleep? Check in was easy, parking was safe, shuttle was cheap, rooms were trendy, rates were super reasonable. For more info check out my blog post:  https://mermaidtailsblog.wordpress.com/2014/11/18/magic-roots/

Summary Heading: If You're Not Picky You Will be Happy
Summary: Clean, you get what you pay for (bring your own towels and an extra blanket if you get cold easily).  Walls are thin and amenities are light (no hair dryer). Parking lot is packed and there's lots of work trucks, but if you come back early in the day for a nap, you won't have a problem.  If you're only using it as a place to crash and you're not real picky, it's perfect.  They have a free coffee/hot chocolate/cappuccino dispenser in the lobby that was an unexpected perk and is pretty good (again, if you're not picky).  The front desk staff are super friendly and helpful.  I came back from the parks with a horrible sore throat one night and they were happy to turn on the hot water maker just so I could have a few cups of tea to take back to my room.  Customer service in my

Great Pet Friendly hotel that didn't charge "extra" $$ fees for pets !!!  Typical Motel 6 on the outside but inside was a nice modern-style room with hard wood flooring and NO carpet. There was a small patch of grass near the pool for the dogs to use and limited areas to walk the dogs but the rates were cheap !

Comfortable sleeping room. IKEA type furnishings. Front desk personnel extremely friendly and helpful. Wonderful little gift shop in the Lobby. Close to Disneyland. ART bus stops in front of hotel. Would stay here again. Had a room that gave a view of the Disneyland fireworks.

You get what you pay for. When you drive up and see a large sign hanging from the balcony looking for housekeepers you can expect less than normal service. Decor outdated and needs a make over! The rooms are very large and we had plenty of space to unpack and spread out.

Summary: I had some concerns when my bf reserved a room at Motel 6 for our Disneyland trip. I have worked in hospitality for almost 8 years now as both a housekeeper and a front desk attendant, and have always received exemplary customer service and cleanliness reviews personally, so my standards are naturally high. I lowered them for this motel but was still not satisfied. The room was cleaner than I expected, and the bed more comfortable, but housekeeping's attention to detail was sub-par. I drew a bath after a long day at the parks and was disgusted to see mold growing under a lip in the shower, as well as in the toilet (of which I had a clear view). These things are so easy to take care of! Spray them with bleach and scrub them down; it adds....maybe an extra two minutes to the time

I've stayed here twice and both times was very pleased! The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable. Very powerful showers! We had a room this time near the elevator so there was some pretty loud foot traffic outside the room, but it wasn't enough to lose sleep over.

Stayed midweek (April 28 - 30). We had an issue with our first room not locking properly but front desk was able to move us right away to a nearby room. Everything in the room looked spotless clean. I checked the towels and bed sheets and no signs of stains or hairs. Loved the rooms, looked very modern. Don't expect nothing grand like a Hilton or Hyatt would have but it had everything we needed. We just needed a clean and quiet room to sleep in after a long day at Disneyland & California Adventure. Staff was wonderful and very attentive. Housekeeping did a great job in cleaning our room while we were away. I will definitely stay here again once I plan another trip to Disneyland. Thank you Motel 6. Great Job!!!!!

Was just there for Star Wars Celebration, service was excellent as was the room! Michelle at the lobby was outstanding, always with a gorgeous smile and super hellful. An easy 15 minute walk from Disneyland too! Use route 8 on the bus to get from Disney to the hotel

I stayed here twice after they remodeled and thought it was a great hotel.  Loved the "Ikea" look and it was super clean.  I have told several people to stay at this Motel 6...which I regret now.  My friend and I checked in about 330pm and our room was ready.  We got to the room and one of the beds was not made and there was still garbage in the garbage can from the previous guests.  BUT, they did make sure to make the little v shaped fold in the toilet paper.  We inspected the beds closer and found hairs on all the pillows, so we stopped by the lobby on our way to Disneyland and asked to have the beds made with clean sheets.  The wall behind the headboards was filthy with dust.  Same for the floor under the bed.  This hotel would be ideal for location and price if the rooms

Summary: this motel is a great value! we usually stay at a minimum of 3 star hotels so i was a bit hesitant to book. however, i'm so glad i did especially since the prices of hotels around spring break was more than i would spend on a room just to shower and sleep. for me, i don't really see the value in spending more money on a hotel room during a disneyland trip because all you need it for is to get clean and rest for mickey. the parks are about a 10-15 minute walk depending on your speed. anyway, i'd stay here again. and oh yeah, they're pet friendly with no extra charge!

Summary Heading: Read before booking! Spend a little bit more to get something much better.
Summary: Two of us stayed at this place for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. The location was pretty good, an easy 15 minute walk to the park entrances. The staff seemed nice enough.  We got in late on our first night, around 9:30. The room was a good size, with very simple furnishings and laminate floors. When we got all our stuff up to the room my friend took her shoes off and was figuring out a change of clothes because we planned to go to Downtown to shop a bit. After walking around only for a few minutes she knelt down and I saw that her feet were very dirty looking. We both thought that was pretty gross. We tried to call to see about getting the floor cleaned but they said they didn't have anyone there until tomorrow. So we decided to not let that ruin the start of our vacation

Summary Heading: Hard to find fault for the price and location
Summary: Ok so this place isn't fancy or grand or particularly special, but what it is is clean, cheap (by Anaheim standards) and located within walking distance of Disney. The staff were friendly and polite, although I didn't appreciate the call from reception asking us if everything was ok at 11 o clock at night when we'd just arrived jetlagged and gone straight to bed!   This is a Disney "good neighbour" hotel and my advise would be, don't book it through the Disney website as part of a package because Disney rip you off at an incredible rate! By booking the hotel separately through their own website and then booking Disney tickets separately I saved several hundred pounds!

Really enjoyed my time here at the Motel 6 Disney Maingate. Was able to check in early and the staff called up to my room to make sure everything was ok. Was able to walk to Disney within 10 minutes. A+ place to stay for under $100 near Disney Land

Summary Heading: Okay value for the price, but disappointing.
Summary: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland.  This motel is in walking distance to Disneyland and surrounding attractions, has a decent-sized pool, and overall is an okay value for the price I paid.  There is an Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) stop on the property and it is a reasonable cost.  The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and there were plenty of pillows.  We had a poolside room, which tends to be a bit noisy, but there are quiet hours during the nighttime.  The desk staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable, and there is a small gift/necessities shop in the lobby which has pretty good prices. All that being said... I wasn't expecting the Hilton...I had booked the room primarily for price and you get what you pay for.  The room floor was

Summary Heading: Great Motel at a bargain rate!
Summary: I just recently stayed again and promised the staff I would write another review. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are spacious and clean, and it is very close to Disney. I will continue to stay here and recommend this place to everyone traveling to the Disney area. Thanks again!

My boyfriend and I stayed there for five nights as we were (of course) visiting Disneyland! I found the room to be exceptionally clean, large and all in all very nice!  The reception staff were helpful and friendly when we were trying to arrange airport transfers etc  Only downside was that the wifi didn't work but really, who needs wifi when you're minutes away from Disneyland? The hotel is also a five minute walk away from a Denny's, iHop, a pizza place and a few other restaurants! Nicely situated.  Definitely recommend for a few nights stay! No downside to our stay at all :).

Summary Heading: Good value and great Disney location
Summary: We stayed here when visiting Disneyland. We requested a quiet room and  Heather put us on the fourth floor room 479 away from the traffic and the pool. It was a great room which was quiet and also allowed us to see the Disney fireworks. We really appreciated Heather's  friendly welcome and helpfulness. It made us feel like we'd made the right decision to stay here. And we did. The rooms are functional and funky, clean and spacious. Basic but comfortable. Beds are comfortable. Shower had good pressure and lots of hot water. The rooms were surprisingly quiet. We slept well. There is a shuttle every 30 minutes to Disney for $5. Staff are friendly. There is a $3 charge per device for 24 hours of wifi. The only downside to this hotel. Pool is very nice. Would stay here again without

Well, we found this hotel at a decent price (and the pictures we saw looked better then the actual room.) So we picked this one because of the price and location, but never again. It is not well taken care of... Our beds had hairs in it, floors didn't feel clean and generally just did not feel well. We have not been pleased with our stay. Pass this hotel people!

We were at Disneyland for one night.  We arrived at 8:30am on Saturday. Checking was very smooth. As expected our room was not ready. We purchased shuttle tickets for $5 per person for day.  Went directly to Disneyland ,  we arrived back at hotel at 12:30 am.  Room was just right for what it was intended,,SLEEP.  Quiet, clean and basic.  Checked out 11:00 am Sunday well rested after day at Disneyland .. Plus free parking.. No frills.

Summary Heading: Great for a solo Disneyland visit
Summary: Motel 6 is one of the cheapest places to stay within easy reach of Disneyland. If I wasn't travelling alone, I'd want to be at one of the motels across the street from the main entrance but for a solo trip I don't mind waiting a few mins for the bus. Love the fact that the Motel 6 doesn't have carpet and always seems clean. Free coffee in the lobby in the mornings is a bonus. I also love the clean pool and really hot hot tub!  You can't expect a motel this cheap to have all the same amenities as a five star hotel - but if like me you bring your own shampoo/conditioner and body wash, and coffee maker/electric kettle, there's not much in it other than a lot of $ saved at the Motel 6!

Upon hearing my husband had gotten us a Motel 6 room for our short Disneyland trip, I was immediately worried. We normally stay in nicer hotels and was worried about finding a roach, dead body, etc in the room. When we arrived I was surprised. The lobby looked nice and we were helped right away. There is even a nice gift shop for all your last minute Disney needs. The rooms have been recently renovated and you can tell they went for the modern look. I actually did like it for the most part, but it could use a proper couch/seating area and the orange wall was eh. The room was very large which was nice but, it felt so empty...like Japanese empty. The bed was hard...my husband loved it, me...not so much.  The bathrooms were fine and nicer than other motels but, not bad. Overall, as

Was a little iffy booking this hotel as it was close to highway and a bit of a walk from Disney property - went with it anyway.  Was very pleasantly surprised.  The rooms appeared to be recently redone and were very clean.  Pool was nice, but a little cold.  The walk was not bad to the parks, but was brutal coming back at the end of the day from Downtown Disney.  Thought that there would be more options for dining in the mall next door, but was let down by that.  Overall, I would stay here again if on a budget.  We only paid around $70/night, so a very good deal. With so many options around, it would probably make sense to look for a closer hotel to the parks if possible.

I stayed here for just a couple of days during the NAMM show. Check in was speedy, and Melissa (I think) was warm and courteous, very professional. The room was OK, not great, but it was super clean and all that I could ask for. I didn't really use the facilities available but was a bit miffed at the price of wifi (something like $12 for a 24 hour period... really?) and the fact that you had to pay to use the computer in the lobby. As far as I'm concerned that's pretty lame. Of course, I wasn't there to surf the web so I just went without. All in all, it was enjoyable and within walking distance of the convention center. Would I stay again? Sure, as long as it wasn't for business.

We arrived at the hotel at 8am (after coming all the way from New Zealand) and were expecting to leave our suitcases in the lobby and go straight to Disneyland and check-in later in the day.  We were therefore very grateful to be advised that our room was ready and we could go straight up. The room was sparse (if you like minimalism this is not an issue) but a decent size. We were unable to access the wifi :-( And the towels were threadbare. As it was winter the bed could've done with an extra blanket too. It suited our needs, however, as we were only there for one day to visit Disneyland, not to hang out at the motel. It is close to Disneyland (15 minutes walk) ... I didn't know about the complimentary shuttle until after we left! It is a good price for what you get.

Summary Heading: At least it was relatively cheap.
Summary: A typical Motel 6.  The room was clean and there was plenty of hot water to wash off the tacky after going to the Tackiest Place on Earth.  I say relatively cheap as the hotels in this area are ridiculously expensive

Summary Heading: Was good place to stay on a budget
Summary: Very clean and super comfortable beds.  Room and property felt safe and convenient to the freeway and a few blocks from Disneyland.  A bit tricky to get in the parking lot the first time but, who cares, once you park there's nowhere you need to drive anyway.  We were able to fully recover from a long day at the park and really enjoy the second day of festivities.  I would definitely go there again.

We stayed in a number of hotels during our recent trip around California. I've stayed at many hotels and motels in Anaheim over the years. This one was by far the worst.  It started badly; flickering light bulbs in the parking lot and entrance. Grim, low-rent and poorly maintained public areas. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful, which is a point in the Motel 6's favour.  The rooms have been recently renovated, but I absolutely hate the bare, pseudo-modern style. Everything has been done to reduce maintenance costs and cleaning times. All the furniture is raised off the ground and nailed to the walls. It's like a prison cell with a bright bed cover.  The room and bathroom were both reasonably clean, yet the outside spaces seemed grimy and in need of a good scrub.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our award winning Phoenix room redesign featuring wood-effect laminate floors, vessel sinks and ambient lighting. Please know that the conditions you describe are atypical to Motel 6 standards for quality and we apologize for the inconveniences you experienced in the parking lot and entrance. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable stay for our guests and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest, and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the noise concerns you describe. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary Heading: Clean and close to Disney - walking distance
Summary: The outside may be a little dated, but the rooms are all remodeled and clean.  Close 10-15 min walk to Disney  Easy check in check out  Got it for two weekend nights for about $99/night and about $250 total with taxes

Summary Heading: Bargain rates for a bargain sleep.
Summary: I booked late for an event and this was low on funds so this was a good deal. My only complaint is the bed/bedding. Cigarette burns in the bedspread and the bounciest spring mattress I've ever slept on. I could feel the springs digging into my side after only a minute or two.  But overall you get what you pay for and my budget doesn't afford luxury in so cal. So if you just need a place to sleep without the luxuries, this will do it.

We were in between two trips when we decided to go to Disneyland for Thanksgiving. It was kind of a spur of the moment thing and we needed to keep it as cheap as possible. We've usually stayed off Katella but the rates were much cheaper here and we had heard from a FB friend that the rooms weren't too bad. We made the drive the day before thanksgiving and arrived a little faster than we expected, my husband went in to ask if we could check in early and they were super accomodating.   The front desk staff was always nice! We locked ourselves out of the room a couple times and they quickly gave us new keys. The hotel itself is a little dated but the room was very clean, the bathroom was spotless, the bed was fine. The room is really basic, it doesn't have a fridge or a blow dryer

Summary Heading: It's a nice walk to Disney
Summary: It's a little further away than some other cheaper and better priced motels but it's definiatkey good. Theyre great for having extra kids in your room and there's plenty of space. Loads of parking and it has a nice family feel to it! I'd defo recommend it to stay

A few pros, close to Disneyland an easy 10min walk, great friendly helpful front desk and the pricing couldn't be beaten.  But it needed a really good clean/scrub especially the floors and it didn't smell great.  I personally won't stay again and I wouldn't recommend it unless the price point is essential.  Would suit young groups of students perhaps

Summary Heading: This place has gotten a bad rap
Summary: I always consult this site for hotel reviews and generally they are pretty right on. This motel is totally adequate for the price point. And I mean adequate in a good way. Clean and no bugs and very close to disneyland. I didn't experience any of the negatives I saw stated in these reviews. Front desk was great. I usually stay on harbour but I saved $300 by staying 5 min. Farther away from the park!

Summary Heading: It's what you pay for, without a door.
Summary: It's what you pay for, the room was spacious comfortable. limited amenities, hair dryer, fridge, coffee machine etc wasn't there but if you just need a bed it's fine. the one thing i would say is the bathroom is attached to the wardrobe and sink area, which would be fine but the door is like a cupboard / wardrobe so it's not the most sound proof, so maybe think else where if you're going here with a business partner. Its a 10 min walk to disneyland, 10 minute walk to local shops, restaurants etc. Free parking, friendly staff they gave me a late check out which was really helpful. It was clean.

I usually don't write a review unless it's VERY bad and this place was! I checked in on Thursday November 6th. The room was clean but had a TERRIBLE smell. Seeing as though I was there for Disneyland I excused it because I knew I wouldn't be in the room long anyway.   Friday night I got back to the room at 11:30pm. I walked in the door exhausted... only to find a COCKROACH! I actually got the cockroach and took it to the desk. The girl apologized and told me she would refund one night and make sure everything was stripped the next day.   Saturday I returned to my room late and it had NEVER been cleaned. When I checked out Monday morning I went to the desk to speak to them about the issues. I was given a refund of 1 night but it was the cheapest night I stayed and not the Friday

Summary Heading: Friendly staff but Unclean rooms! Black Mold!
Summary: Booked this room based on price.  Arrived earlier than check in and front desk was able to find us a room.    Layout of the room was very practical and liked all the outlets provided as my family brought all their electronics. Bed cover had a patch on it instead of them replacing it.   First thing I did was check for "bed bugs". Didn't see anything, phew! There was an odor though and there was people always smoking on the balcony so it could have came from them ...  Read reviews about hair in the towels and thought I'd give the hotel a chance. Well,  review was true! Several of the towels, although seemed washed, had hairs stuck in them.  So, I thought the smell would go away over time, but it didn't.  I pulled the AC (loud window unit) filters out and it was filthy! Took them
Manager Response: Michelle, Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We do accommodate our smoking guests with assigned smoking rooms and are sorry you experienced dissatisfaction with the concerns you describe. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. Please know that the conditions you describe are atypical to Motel 6 standards for quality and we apologize for the inconveniences you experienced. We proactively have standing contracts with exterminators to monitor and treat affected areas in case there are any pest concerns on our premises, and we apologize for any alarm this caused you. Please accept our apologies that your stay was less than satisfactory during your visit to Disneyland. We encourage you to contact Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Stayed here as recommended by the Disneyland website. It is definitely one of the lowest priced accommodations they recommend in the area. With that being said, there is only coffee and hot cocoa available in the morning. I'm sure staying at a place for a few more bucks a night that has a free breakfast would offset the cost of having to pay for it, especially if you have kids and need to be fueled before heading to the parks. The beds were very minimal, if you're a person who can't get comfortable to sleep "anywhere" I wouldn't recommend this place for you.  It is very close to Disneyland, though, which is very convenient. The staff was very friendly and even gave us free bottles of water when we checked in. I would consider staying here again.

I haven't stayed in a motel 6 for a very long time but I'm glad I did. The motel was clean!! I had white socks on and walked around the hardwood floors and my socks did not turn black. We walked to the Disney parking lot shuttle down the street and took the pumbaa bus to d'land and it took less than a few minutes, no wait at all. The parking lot does get crowded around closing times but we were still able to park our car although it was not in an actual space. I would definitely stay here again. Most of the guests are d'land guests. Make sure you check out the gift store on the bottom bc it'll save you money. My husband ad I bought matching shirts n they were really nice for 2 for 15$ what a steal!! Coffee is very bland so we just got that inside the park.

Great price.  Close to Disney!   We walked to the market place.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.  We really enjoyed the pool.  Was a relaxing weekend getaway.  It was easy to get to since it was near the freeway.

When walked into the first room they gave me there was nothing in the room except two beds, a tv and a small desk. There was no where to put clothes or even hang anything up. So I went to the front de a k to tell them the problem and they said they had no idea the room was like that. To me that means the people who run the front desk have no clue what's going on in the motel. There are large puddles of water every few feet on the first and second floor of the hotel and the water is coming from the maintenence rooms throughout the motel. So I wake up on the last day of my stay and what do I find a cockroach the size of and adult thumb alive in the bathroom and where there is one roach there is thousands. The only renovating they did to the rooms was to mount the tv to the walls
Manager Response: Melissa,  Thank you for sharing your feedback. We strive to deliver a great guest experience, but it sounds as though we did not perform to our usual standards in this case. We have procedures in place related to our pest policy that should have prevented the inconveniences you describe. We are sorry that you were unsatisfied with the expected amenities; however, Motel 6 standards for quality are rooted in economical practicalities to consistently deliver on our goal to provide the lowest price of any national chain. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your stay to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Great location for visiting Disney. The parks are within walking distance and the rooms are big, clean and great value. Staff was very friendly. Only downside is the charge for WiFi which is no longer considered normal in 2014. WiFi is no longer a luxury these days....

Summary Heading: Meh, it's a Motel 6, Cheap & Near Disney
Summary: Pros Friendly & welcoming staff Close to Disney. You could walk but why? Pay the nominal ART fee & catch the shuttle. It runs every 20 minutes - an hour before the park opens and 30 minutes past closing.  Good view of DL fireworks from the 3rd & 4th floor Good sized rooms Even though my room faced the freeway it was pretty quiet.  Cons Old laminate floor what looks filthy.  Old crusty bathroom Small TV mounted too high on the wall  Beds are just a mattress (no box spring) on a platform. Modern looking but not sturdy. The mattress slipped about the platform. Better not let the kids jump bed to bed or the mattress will be on the floor.  Scratchy and flimsy towels. It was like a loofah on my rear! Even scratchier sheets - I thought I was sleeping on sandpaper.  Stained and poorly

Summary Heading: Awesome deal and a nice place
Summary: Great value for a clean and friendly place.  After all, when it comes to Disneyland, all you basically need is a hot shower and comfortable bed to get some sleep.  The staff was super helpful and friendly.  This is about the 3rd or fourth time I've stayed here in the last 4 years and I've had a great experience each time.  You can't beat it for the price!  Planning to stay when we visit again.

I booked a few months back for September, and it was around 60 a night. Pretty cheap compared to the other hotels. For being that close to Disneyland,that price was amazing. The room was clean and the beds were pretty big. The room itself was pretty big. It was honestly one of the best Motel 6's I've stayed in and I've stayed in worse and paid way more. I'd definitely stay here again. The only downside was that the vending machines were pretty pricy so it would have been helpful to stop at a store before we checked in. Also, the t.v. wasn't that big and it's mounted on the wall pretty high.

I was a little unsure of staying at a Motel 6, but I read several positive reviews of this property and decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised with my stay. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and I was able to take the shuttle to Disney Land which picks up at the property at a very low cost which was a real plus. The pool is HUGE and lots of pool furniture to use. The rooms are very spacious and I really like the modern look of the rooms. I only wish I had a mini fridge, iron, etc, but after mentioning this at check out the manager overheard & mentioned that some of the rooms actually do have mini fridges. He also said that the property does have some irons & hair dryers for guest use. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and will be sure to stay

I literally planned this visit a day before I drove to Anaheim for a pre-move visit.  Considering I was visiting in early august, the rate of $72 per night, for a motel less than two blocks from Disneyland was quite appealing.  Yes, I knew this was a Motel 6, so I was well aware of what I was getting myself into.  Unlike what others have said, this Motel 6 IS ABSOLUTELY within walking distance to Disneyland.  You can be inside the main entrance in less than fifteen minutes.  The street is very safe, but there isn't much to see along the way.    The rooms here are very, very standard.  There is nothing special about these rooms.  Beds are decent.  No carpeting, just linoleum flooring, and everything is mounted to the wall.  Even the seating area, which consists of a

It is a good location for Disneyland.  Liked that the shuttle picked you up in front of the hotel.  Not so into the modern "look" of the room.  The staff had their moments.  Some of the girls were nice, some were rude.  It was hit or miss.  Went to the pool area but did not swim.  It's old and outdated but if your looking for price it's a good place to stay.  We walked to the Gardenwalk and it was a nice walk through to eat the Bubba Gumps.  I would recommend it if you want to save money for Disney.

Stayed there on labor day weekend. I would stay here again.   Pros: Room was clean, friendly staff, reasonable price. Location is really good; Disneyland is about a 10 min walking distance, area looks safe to walk at night. Free parking is a big plus, saved $17 Disneyland parking fee per day. Also, head south a couple of blocks to the Gardenwalk area, nice area with stores and restaurants everywhere.   Cons:  Internet is not included; must pay about $3 per day to use, and since I did not use it, I can't comment on how fast it is. Sprint users will get a decent cell signal, won't need the hotel wi-fi. Also, there is NO continental breakfast; they just offer coffee and that is it. Also, prepare to pay about $16 more per night; city taxes NOT included when booking. Lastly, there is

I have stayed in many hotels in the Anaheim area.  The customer service in this hotel is fantastic. The Desk always makes sure you have everything you need. The rooms are clean, the price is great, and the bus picks you up at the door to go to Disneyland. There is no parking fee. The front desk people are gracious and kind to everyone. I highly recommend this hotel. It isn't the Ritz but who hangs around the room in Anaheim.  It also has a great pool and hot tub.

Summary Heading: Took care of me at the last minute
Summary: Due to my own mix-up, I ended up at a conference in Anaheim without a place to stay. This Motel 6 took care of me and, even though I had to book a smoking room (not my first choice), I am grateful that I didn't end up "homeless" in Anaheim. The location is GREAT for anyone attending a conference at the nearby convention center, and it's also super-close to Disney.

This hotel was great, everyone was very friendly and helpful.  The room was spotless, beds were comfortable. The shuttle to Disneyland was a bonus as it was a little to far to walk especially after a long day. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Only problem was no coffee machine but we just bought a cheap one from Walmart and gave it to one of the cleaning staff when we left.

The staff is friendly and accomodating when necessary.  Have stayed up to 10 times in the last two years.  The rooms are clean.  Housekeeping everyday unless otherwise requested.  Depending on the time of year, rates are reasonable.  There have been issues with the rooms, but resolved and/or refunded (if applicable, within reason).  Not every room has a mini fridge, it is extra charge.  The handicap accessible rooms are small and feels confined.  If not needed, request and stay in a regular first floor room.  Motel 6 has been updating certain things.  The bed covers sometimes have burn holes or stained due to age, however, it will be replaced when requested.  Also if you are in a non-smoking room and a guest has been smoking the staff will accomodate (only time may not be able

Summary Heading: Great Rates, Great Service, Great Stay!
Summary: We had such a wonderful vacation here!  You can't beat the price within walking range of Disneyland.  The staff was helpful, nice, and very accomodating.  I really enjoyed the pool, and the free coffee in the morning was surprisingly good.  I'd spend your money at the park, and stay here in a second.

Staff and Manager is extremely friendly.....however.  Three days in a row we got stained sheets.  Some with cigarette burn holes in them.  Plus there was no moisture barrier between the mattress and the sheets which is just plain gross!!  The decor is something out of the 70s and can be categorized as extremely dated.  The place didn't even have drawers to put clothes in, just some weird shelf things.  I also could not get the wifi to work with my laptop even after calling tech support.  I complained to the manager and he comp'd us a day and let us out of our reservation early.  The staff there could not be anymore helpful and understanding.  The place is close to disneyland but not within walking distance.  I would not recommend this place at all.....only for the desperate.

Summary Heading: Didn't even get to my room.
Summary: I had reservations here for a few nights. I booked here because I saw it was pet-friendly and check-in was at 3. Let's just say I didn't get in my room at 3. In fact, I was so agitated that they kept my puppy and I waiting for the non-existent room service to ready the room for two hours that I booked another hotel. I will not be bothering with Motel 6 again.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are modern but they don't have any drawers, blow dryer or iron.  And you have to pay for the WiFi. Loved the shuttle service to Disneyland but that's also an extra charge,  but its very convenient.  House keepers cleans and gives fresh towels daily which is nice. Microwaves are in the lobby and if you would like a mini fridge that's an extra charge as well. All in all I would stay again.

I'm really surprised that one tripadvisor reviewer stated that the rooms were "modern" w/ ikea furnishings.  NOT true.  The furniture is from the 70's.  Floors - FILTHY, Bedding- FILTHY (stains and filth on the bedspreads), Batheroom - JUST GROSS!  COCKROACHES in both rooms (we had to change rooms because the smell of urine in the first room). They "offer" coffee service from 6am -10 am, however powdered creamer which they ran out so we couldn't have coffee.  The floors were so dirty we had to wear shoes at all times (no carpeting, the floors are that tile flooring that you find in gas station restrooms). I made an effort to check the cleaning staff's cart as they were cleaning rooms and noticed NO mop to clean floors and I noticed NO clean bed spreads on the cart...I guess that

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights.  Right off the freeway with ample parking. Clean rooms with a modern flair.  Yes the rooms have IKEA style furnishings. I would say there were only 2 downsides to the setups of these rooms.  The bathroom doors....very difficult to close and get any privacy, and the fact that there was no dresser.  The shelves were nice but only enough space for one person's things.    The hotel is plenty close enough to Disneyland to walk though the hotel does have a ART bus that picks up there about every 20 minutes or so.  Great to buy a day pass for the bus so you can come back during the day to rest up or eat. I  was truly glad to see security walking the grounds of the hotel at night. I felt safe.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I wish

I did A LOT of research on the all Disneyland hotels and I mean A LOT.  I was looking for the best of the cheap hotels and settled on this and was glad I did - No regrets. You can get a room with a fridge but the microwave is near the lobby with the vending machines.  The staff were very helpful and kind.  I had some issues with the printer/computer as it wouldn't print out the page I needed - waste of $. Lobby internet is for a fee by the minute. The pool was clean and the hot tub was just slightly hotter than luke warm. Shower pressure wasn't great.  The room was remodeled just like the pics but was a little humid/musty? AC worked well enough. Sheets were not good - scratchy and a little stained but this isn't the Hilton. Really liked the nook in the corner for eating.  Rooms

Summary Heading: The absolute best cheap hotel near Disneyland without sacrificing cleanliness/niceness of the room
Summary: So tonight I'm getting ready to book what will be my third stay at this motel 6 with my boyfriend for a Disneyland trip. For awhile I browsed Expedia and other sites in an attempt to find a cheaper option, or an option similarly cheap that still provided a decent-looking room within walking distance of Disneyland. After searching for at least an hour, I realized that it doesn't exist. You will not find a cheaper, better looking room within walking distance of Disneyland for this price range (70-80 a night). Hotels nearby that are priced the same as this motel 6 are far worse looking--those rooms look like what you would imagine a dingy motel room to look like: old bedspreads, dated bathroom/lighting fixtures, aging carpet.   The motel 6 on the other hand, has been remodeled, and

Let me first start off with the pros of this motel, the staff was very friendly and helped our family in anyway possible. Only a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland gate, but i would recommended getting the ART buss pass, walking back is very tiring.There is a pool & Jacuzzi which is nice after a long day of walking. The beds are comfortable, but do ask for a change of bedding before checking into your room. The rooms do not come with refrigerators or microwaves, they do have a microwave people can use in the lobby but refrigerators are about an extra 3$/ night. The lobby does have a small gift shop which carries some really nice Disneyland souvenirs.   Now the bad about this motel, I didn't expect much from a motel 6, the rooms were nice but the very first thing i saw as i walked

Summary Heading: Disney trip . Room not so clean
Summary: Staff was great at the front desk . The room was not that clean shower head had pink mold on it, all floors were dirty I suggest wearing sandals the floors and baseboards especially in corners of bathrooms dirty. Never use blankets in motel they do not wash them that often so think about that. Toilets take 2 to 3 times to flush

Summary Heading: Pleasant Surprise! GREAT service, clean rooms, good price
Summary: Really impressed with the quality of this :motel!"  Good location to Disneyland with very affordable prices. Pet friendly. Nice pool. GREAT customer service!! Really impressed with each employee we spoke with!!!!  The only negative is that the balcony lights stay on very late and shine into the room even with the block out curtains.

Usually when I think of a Motel 6, I think of a dingy place.   This was not.  This is a minor upgrade from the norm.  It is still a Motel 6 so dont expect it to be at Marriott or Westin standards, but it is good for the price and proximity to Disneyland.   It was clean and the furniture is modern.  It is a 15 minute walk from Disneyland, which I did with my 3 year old while pregnant.  If you don't want to walk, there is an inexpensive shuttle with day passes.   I highly recommend the shuttle.

Summary Heading: Clean, great service and close to Disneyland!
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights in June while we visited Disneyland. Within walking distance to Disneyland, clean rooms, clean pool and the employees were very helpful with Disney questions and with room accommodations. I would recommend this hotel to families traveling on a budget that don't don't need anything more than a couple of beds and a pool.

Was very Close to Disneyland with very affordable prices. Shuttle at the front door. Clean room, ended up changing our first room due to squeaky air conditioner unit but no hassle given to do so. Would consider staying again for the value an location. The pool and the Hot tub very clean and not busy during our stay. Nice to have Disney gift shop in the hotel

Summary Heading: Heather at the front desk was great!
Summary: Heather was a great help! We booked a wheelchair room by mistake. She helped us move to a different room that would work better for our family of four. A close walk to Disneyland. If they offered breakfast would even be better. The room was quiet, clean and spacious.

This hotel was a good hotel will not Stay again because I feel you can find something else a bit better overall it's a good hotel if your just going to sleep. It is about a mile away from the park so it's a little hard to walk back after a long day at disneyland

As this was the first stop on our trip to US, we did not have very high expectations of this motel 6 due to the average reviews it received on tripadvisor. But when we first entered the room, it was surprisingly large and clean with way more furniture than we actually need. It was clean and sufficient enough to catch a good night's rest. Just note that the walk to Disneyland is not as near as it appears so expect about a 10-15minutes walk.

Our experience went from good to great because of the person touch of one of the night managers named Dustin.  He went out of his way to help us in a situation that was difficult.  He took the time to assess our situation and make a decision in a personable way.  In an age of internet and phone messaging, it is reassuring to know that there are still breathing, kind people that will talk to you and help you when they can. Thanks Motel 6 and thanks to Dustin.

We stayed for 3 nights at this motel and we had a great experience. The welcome could not have been more friendly and at all times the reception staff were helpful. We were there to go to Disneyland and it was close by so we walked a couple of times but also took the shuttle bus service as well which was good value and regular - you get dropped off very near the entry gates. We think the motel was excellent value for what we paid and although there is no kettle in the room they do free coffee in the lobby in the mornings and there are other vending machines for cold drinks if you want them. The room was a good size, clean and perfectly adequate - probably better than we expected. We found a good choice of nearby restaurants and as we had a fridge in our room we also stocked up

Summary Heading: Room was clean and great staff!
Summary: Recently stayed here for a Disney trip because it's close enough to walk. Usually stay at the Super 8 but their prices keep going up and this was the cheaper option. The rooms were cleaner due to not having carpet and having been updated. The bed wasn't the best, pretty firm but for what I paid and what I was expecting I would definitely stay here again. Didn't use the pool but it looked nice and clean. Parking was never an issue and the staff was friendly and very helpful.

Nice hotel, very clean, spacious. Staff very friendly &  happy to answer any questions. The Hotel is a short 10/15 walk to the Disney Parks, easy to walk too & easier to walk than take ART Shuttle. 7/11 is 2 min walk away. This hotel was 1/2 the price of Hotels across the road from Disney! To me, saving an extra $500Aud & walking 10/15 min meant extra shopping in my pocket!

We stayed here because part of our family had already booked a room & we wanted to be close. We got a single king room. I think most rooms must be double queens because the room was practically empty: a bed, built in shelf thing on one side & built in night stand/table on the other. There were very few plugs to plug in phones, ipads, battery chargers for the cameras, etc. The room was clean, but had vinyl flooring that was supposed to look like wood. There were no other floor coverings - like a rug - so it felt similar to being in a large dorm room.  The bed was the worst part of our experience. It was awful. First of all, there was no box spring, just a frame, & the mattress was beyond horrible. The springs creaked with every small movement & I could actually feel them move as

Disneyland just down the street easy to walk. Nothing fancy, but the room was clean. Front desk staff very, very helpful and friendly - Heather was amazing with our check in and check out she wanted to be sure that all was wonderful. Priced just right.

This review says March 2014 but it was actually 2012. I just signed up with Trip Advisor.  Not bad but for the price it should be better. Housekeeping was bad & we found a hair in and stains on the sheets. They gave us a free night for that.  They won't change your bedding unless you request it and they don't clean the floors so all of the dirt you bring in on your shoes ends up on your bare feet and then in your bed. The pool and spa were open and that was really nice. The hotel is about 1/2 mile from Disneyland so we chose to walk. Not ideal but it saved us money on parking. The bathroom doors are very strange and compromise your privacy so watch for that if you're staying with people you don't want to see you in the facility. Hotel parking was free and they have free

The price is the best for the location. The room very clean. Staff pleasant, amenities very few but it's a motel 6. Drawback was the toilet setup. The toilet and washing basin all in one room. No fan, no separation just door that separates from room and bathroom. Walking distance about three quarters mile. Yeah you can walk it. Paid shuttle picks up/drops off. Stay here again...maybe

Summary Heading: Not worth it even though the price is right
Summary: I've stayed at quite different types of hotels and motels during my adventure called life and this is my first negative experience in Anaheim.  Reading multiple reviews on TripAdvisor I should of know they were all true.  / I arrive at motel 6 main gate greeted by a smiling front desk agent which made me feel very welcome.  I have you here for one night in a non smoking room.  I agreed and went to my room. It was spunky and retro but that were it went all down hill. When I walked in the room smelled like heavy smoke- Was told this was a non smoking room but there was a ash tray in the room. Also the AC had at least 7 inches of dust.  When going into the bathroom the shower nozzle looked like it hadn't been cleaned in five years.  - I also notice mold in the tub and toilet wasn't

Booked a double room with Motel 6 at the last minute as my family and I decided to arrive earlier in the USA then first planned. As we had already had a hotel bookend for our main stay we grabbed a room at Motel 6 for the extra few nights.  We were very surprised at the size of the rooms and how big both the moan room and bathroom was. With a TV and fridge and large queen size comfy beds you couldn't ask for much more.  The actual motel is rather large but there was minimal noise associated with the large amount of guest etc.  It is very close to Disneyland and only a short distance from the express way and the GardenWalk for restaurants etc.   The price of the rooms is amazing for what you get at Motel 6 and had we had known earlier we would have stayed here for our whole

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland on a budget!
Summary: For the price, the room was so much better than I was expecting! Perfect if you are wanting to go to Disneyland on a bit of a budget. The room was very comfortable, nice big bed, close walking distance to Disneyland and restaurants. The girls at the front desk were really helpful as well.

This is the last night in a 4 night stay we booked with motel 6. Check in went well, the room seemed clean enough, though I did notice stray hairs here and there right off the bat. The bathroom has closet doors, which is really weird to me. The tv is nice and the micro fridge works. I'm traveling with kids, so when they took all the towels out of our room on the second day and didn't replace any, we decided to just go buy our own and save the hassle of dealing with the front desk, and so we would have towels for the beach. We spent the day today at disney, and came back to towels for the first time since we checked in, but as soon as we were in bed getting ready to sleep, my husband jumped up, grabbed a shoe, and smashed a FREAKING COCKROACH that was climbing on the wall near

The location is decent, and the room was surprisingly modern for a budget motel.  The staff was courteous and helpful, and the ART shuttle stops to Disneyland stops in front.  This would not be my preferred choice for a return trip, but it is a fair value for a budget traveler.  There is no breakfast or restaurant, however, only vending machines and a gift shop.

Took a recent father-son trip to Disneyland, and decided to stay here in order to keep the costs down. The rooms are simple, but comfortable. (okay a little on the sparse side), but that is okay after a long drive or day at the park. It has a very convenient bus stop on the RAT system, which makes getting to and from the park easy. No parking fee, and had no specific time to leave the lot, so we were able to check out and still go over to the park for the morning.   Only 2 negatives, and both seem to be a running theme at every Motel 6 I have ever stayed at. The shower curtain is hung in a odd way and does a poor job keeping water from splashing around, and they love their sprinkler systems. The outside always feels damp, and the door mats are soaked in the morning.

Had trouble find this hotel, really thought it was NEAR the main gates but it really isn't but it's not far and they have a shuttle bus that is $5.00 a person for the day and pick up times and drop off times very convenient.  Lots of parking if you have a rental car.  Room was cool with orange paint .... laminate floor, beats carpet any day.  Only complaint I'd have is no coffee maker in room and no where really close to get a cheap breakfast other than a 711 (I don't mean a sit down meal)  Would I go back.. maybe if with family again but wouldn't if with a spouse wanting a romantic vacation... but certainly was good for the budget.  Didn't try the pool but it looked good and clean.

Very, very, very basic room.  Our room smelled of cigarette smoke even though non-smoking.  No hairdryer or fridge.  I expected no fridge but the hair dryer was very annoying-kind of a standard thing to have in a room.  The pool and hot tub were fine for my 9 year old to splash around in. Very loud traffic noise from I-5 so if you can't sleep through traffic noise don't stay here.  No elevators so not fun if you are on the 3rd level like we were.  Not a bad walk to main gate of Disneyland in daytime (15-20 minute walk). We took the shuttle which runs direct to the parking lot so that is probably best way to go, especially at night.  The motel is off the main strip so it is a bit isolated when you are walking back at night.  They have ample free parking which was great.  Front

Summary Heading: Possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.....
Summary: We booked this hotel as we couldn't get a third night at the Travelodge in West Ball Street, near Disneyland. We thought, despite some less than stellar reviews, that it couldn't really be all that bad. I checked in at 10pm after spending all day at Disneyland and was surprised how strongly the lobby smelt of smoke. Check-in was fine, room keys given, People with young kids, or lots of luggage shoud note that the hotel does not have elevators, or if it does, the receptionist didn't tell me about them. As soon as we entered the room, the smell of cigarette smoke overwhelmed us. I immediately called reception and said the room stank of smoke. The reply 'oh, I'm sorry, would you like us to spray the room?' - I'm tired and obviously not thinking clearly as I should have insisted on

Booked my room a week in advance despite poor reviews, I took my chances and took a leap of faith to staying at this location. I will say that I will never again stay here nor ever refer someone to either. I booked a NON smoking room for myself and kids whom are asthmatic and was having difficulty having this met once checking in.   I ended up biting the bullet since it was late in the evening and taking a room the front desk said had an "odor". once we settled in I called the front desk asking for more pillows that were never brought to my room.! I rather pay more money for a better experience in the future than to stay at Motel 6 again!

Now I know it's a motel 6 and with that comes certain things, like you get what you paid for. Well, I understand that but to have maid service skip our room all together on our last day there was not one of them! After being gone for 12 hours walking around Disneyland and California Adventures the last thing I want is to come back and have not only need to make both beds but wait over an hour for clean towels to be brought to us. I had to call twice to remind them that we needed towels. When I told them that the housekeeping had not been to our room I got, "oh they didn't? I'm sorry" nothing about let me get someone there to help you out or any type of compensation. When I reviewed on their website I got a reply stating their sincerest apologies and that's not how they run

We stayed at this location after it was recommended to us by several friends. It is close to Disneyland and has a nice gift shop downstairs. The rooms are updated and looked clean. Check in was fast and friendly. Staff was courteous. The room did not have a coffee pot, microwave, refrigerator, or even a clock radio. The water in the shower took forever to get warm, which didn't last long. The air conditioning was super loud and didn't cool the room very well. I am grateful that we didn't spend much time here. I was even more saddened we didn't have the "Great" experience our friends had. We won't likely be staying here again.

Summary Heading: I thought Motel 6 was better than this
Summary: The hotel staff was courteous and the hotel looked new but that is about where it stopped. The room did not have a coffee pot, microwave, refrigerator, or even a clock radio. The air conditioning unit/heater was extremely noisy. I took literally 5 minutes to get "warm" not hot but warm water to the room before I could take a shower.  They do not serve breakfast, only coffee. To use the computer in the lobby you must have a credit card.  I think for what they are charging for this place a few amenities should be provided.

Don't know why all the neg reviews.  The price was even cheaper than most Motel 6 we have stayed.  The best employee is Heather she has a smile and greeting that is not fake and the most helpful of all.  If you want the Ritz go pay for it but if you want to have more spending money in your pocket stay here and take the shuttle from the hotel.

Summary Heading: For the price can't be beat
Summary: I can't complain. The rooms aren't as large as they seem in the picture, but everything was in good condition and clean enough, like all motels I've stayed at near Disneyland the really detailed cleaning gets behind sometimes. The staff was friendly and helpful. Things I didn't like were that smoking rooms were next to non smoking rooms.  Since the A/C units are on the outside of the rooms the smokers smoke from outside wafted into our room all night.  Just really awful for an avid non smoker. There were some sketchy people but I didn't feel unsafe. We wouldn't stay again just because the room is not big enough for our family. If our family was smaller I would hesitate to stay there again if we were on a budget.  I'm going to put the same caveat I always do on motels/hotels that

Summary Heading: Best price and Great Bargin in my opinion
Summary: I have been going there now for the past 5 years (Once a Year) on my Annual Disneyland trip. The place has extremely friendly and helpful Staff.  The rooms are more than adequite for myself and my friends.  Always clean and very comfortable.  For the price you pay I feel it would really be hard to get better.  I know it is my first choice all the time.

Summary Heading: Fits the Budget; Clean & Close to Disneyland
Summary: For the price paid ($70/night including taxes), I thought it was just fine - we were only in our rooms to sleep after long days at the park.  Our room was very clean and had a nice new bathtub/shower and sink.  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.  It was just a short 15 minute walk to Disneyland and restaurants.  You can also catch a Shuttle to/from the Park for $5/day (seniors were $2/day).  There is also a gift shop in the lobby and vending machine; also an outdoor pool.

I have stayed at this motel 6 a few times over the past few years, most recently 2 times in October for a trip to Disneyland. The motel is very close to the park, about 15 minutes walking distance, and the rooms have been updated to the modern motel 6 decor. The price is anywhere between 59-85/night, depending on what deal you find and what days of the week you are staying. While the rooms look nice, and the price is decent, I have found more and more things that I do not like about the motel.   The first night in October that we stayed, the floor under the bed was dirty with food, and the bathroom floor had hairs on it that were not ours. There was a dog barking in one of the rooms nearby that barked all morning long, and the bed was also extremely uncomfortably and noisy, as

Summary Heading: Great price and close to Disneyland
Summary: I have seen some sub par reviews of this place. Not sure why people expect top notch amenities at a $50/ night motel. The place is cheap and therefore doesn't have high class linens and floors and such. It is, however, a clean and safe place to stay after your long day at Disneyland.  The rooms are redone and look great. The classic gross motel carpet is gone and nice bare floors in its place. Nice, clean linens. Good size rooms. Very friendly staff that greets you every time you are in the lobby. ART shuttle picks up right outside lobby. Save some $$$ and stay here!!!

This motel 6 is far  above what you would think of as your average Motel 6.  Perfect location to Disneyland well within  walking distance.  A shuttle is offered for a small fee.  Gift shop in lobby.  Front desk staff is nice and very attentive.  Have stayed there before and will again,  Great place to stay when on a budget.

Summary Heading: Worth the $ more than Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We've stayed at Disneyland Hotel and for the price you pay it wasn't worth it. This motel was definitely worth the price!  First the good:The rooms were modern, staff was very friendly and helpful, heated pool and spa( something you don't get even in higher priced hotels sometimes). We had the room with the refrigerator($3 extra) & that worked out great for our budget(brought our own food, breakfasts etc. ), especially for our trip to Disneyland $$$. We thought it had a microwave in the room, but found out that it was in the lobby by the vending machines. The gift shop in the lobby was great! reasonable & friendly. We bought a couple of light-up Minnie Mouse ears for our girls & they got tons of compliments on them at the park. Everyone wanted to know where we bought them. Of

Don't stay here. We booked 3 nights and stayed one. The floors are all Linoleum which doesn't help. The room (with our pet) was not clean. We had a room at the back of the hotel. We felt itchy once entering the room. Noisy all hours of the night. Scary if you need to take your dog outside at night. I think drug deals were going on. Spots on the bedspreads. Just Terrible. They have tried to fix it up, but was like putting lipstick on a pig.  The only good quality was the lobby.

Summary Heading: SCARY, no really, a place from your nightmares.
Summary: There is some kind of METH scene going on at this hotel. People hanging around in the hallways at ALL HOURS, looking completely spaced and messed up in the head. The room adjacent to ours was a DRUG nightmare. A man was abusing a woman verbally, screaming and screaming at her, rehashing the same idiotic statements again and again. We could hear every word through the wall. Then it turned violent, and he started beating her. People gathered outside our room, speaking in indecipherable meth talk. We couldn't leave and were scared to call the desk (yeah, right). Police? If they came and just told them to be quiet and left, we felt like we'd be in danger. At check-in hair on the floor, then the  worst part was hair in the bed and on the pillows!! Credited one night with promise of fresh sheets the next day. We came back from the park and the keys won't work, then the sheets were never changed one of the pillow cases was missing! When I called the desk I was hung up on multiple times, so I had to go back to the desk. The person at the front desk had to come change our sheets.... The next day after running a half marathon we had asked for extra towels but none were provided so back to the front desk. I was given one I didn't look at it but when my friend went to use it, it was filthy on one side and not stained, dirty. They were supposed to bring more but all were dirty.
