Ideal for disneyland tourists.  Very clean and large plain rooms. Bathrooms very clean. Only fridges in some of the rooms. Oneside if the hotel was quiet other not maybe just guests. Very hekoful staff and shuttle service running all day and late in the evening. Free wifi and coffee in the morning

The location is close to Disneyland. There is a bus that runs every 30mins to drop you off to Disneyland. They have friendly staff. Rooms are of good size but no remote control for TV. No hair dryer or fridge but we only paid around $80 pero night so I guess you get for what you paid for.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, offset by iffy cleanliness
Summary: Wife and I stayed here to save a few dollars during our Disneyland trip. The front desk staff were very helpful, especially Alejandra. WiFi access is usually a charge, but she gave us two days worth of access codes if I promised to fill out their online survey.  Biggest plus to to the hotel is the proximity to Disneyland, 10-15 minute walk to the main entrance.  Door to our room (328) was very sticky and took a lot of effort to get it open. The room itself was very spartan, despite being one of their renovated locations. Laminate floors had an odd crunchy sound when walking on them. Bed was okay, but not very supportive.  The morning of our checkout (having had housekeeping service the day before), I pulled out one of the bath towels to use, only to find it smeared with dirt and

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, FANTASTIC staff!
Summary: The review by JimLinda hits the nail on the head.  I cosign on their review - no point in rehashing the same details.  The main point - if you want more amenities, then pay for it.  It will NOT come at the <$80/night price per night we paid for this hotel.  When I checked surrounding hotels, they ran OVER $200/night.   Yes, it would have been nice to have a microwave in the room - but it would have raised the room price.  We did just fine with a cooler and foods not requiring warming up.  The hotel is so centrally located that Dominos knows where to deliver.  We had the pizza delivered poolside, as the children did not want to leave the pool.  We also saved enough on the rooms that we were able to splurge on really nice dinners!  Considering that we were in the room only long

Okay just to be clear, it was "OK" but just OK.  Some people that write their reviews of this place can be too critical but my opinion is that's what you get for the price.  I paid $90.58 per room out-the-door.  I rented two rooms and one rooms door was stuck and had to be opened with a shoulder.  Renventions looked cheap and entrance to the bathroom area looked like an old folding closet door, it did not lock.  Beds were NOT comfortable in both rooms.  I believe they were new but not high comfort.  No complementary shampoo, conditioner.  Just to sleep somewhere it was doable.  Not somewhere to be comfortable.  Security guards where very nice and helpful. I don't like how the manager was extremely pushing the perfect 10 score needed on the Customer Service Review M6 sends out.

Overall this place serves its purpose, the rooms are clean and comfy. I wasn't there during the day since we only used the room to crash at night after coming in exhausted from Disney. The ice machine on the 2nd and 3rd floor wasn't working so we had to trek up to the 4th floor, slight inconvenience. Also the credit card machine was down at the front desk causing us to miss the shuttle to Disney while the front desk girl "called in" my credit card info. Like I said overall not bad for a Motel 6.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, safe, quiet AFFORDABLE Disneyland accomodation
Summary: I give this motel 5/5 because it exceeds MY criteria for a DL hotel.  If you prefer to pay more for luxury, or spend more time in your room,  then this is not the place for you.  If you would rather spend your time and money in the park this place is perfect. My minimum criteria is  1) clean, quiet, comfortable and safe  2)  excellent price w/o hidden fees 3) extremely convenient to DL and 4) affordable  internet and  5) coffee.   In a nutshell clean, quiet and comfortable and "affordable" hotels near DL go for $125 - $135 night.   Rooms under $80/night are likely to be scary, worn and dodgy-- even if some reviewers recommend them as an affordable place to flop your experience may be a crap shoot.  Motel 6 hits the "sweet spot"  impeccably clean, quiet, safe, modern, great

I recently stayed at this motel six, my trip was from May 29-June 4 so six nights at this motel. After reading bad reviews from previous guests I didn't know what to expect but I decided to take a chance and book this motel. We arrived around 7pm and the women at the counter Monica had told me that I had no reservation made but no big deal she booked me the room that I wanted which was fine with me. We stayed in room 358, every bad review was nothing like our room. It looked brand new! The beds had no stains, no hairs on the sheets and in towels, it smelt fresh, the bathroom was spotless, and the fridge was clean. There was absolutely nothing wrong with that room. This was a great room for 3 college students wanting to take a vacation but needing a cheap place to stay. You get

Stayed here for 3 nights. Room was clean and large. Loved the vinyl flooring instead of dirty carpet. If you want luxury this is not the place for you. It's a simple room to crash after a long day at the amusement parks. Only complaint I have is they didn't leave towels for the last night in the room. Loved the cubby where we could put our shoes and small luggage out of the way. The staff was very friendly, check in and check out went very quickly. Only thing better would have been to have check out through the tv so you wouldn't have to stop on your way out.

I have stayed a total of 4 times in this hotel in the past. I have seen a lot of negative rooms about this Motel 6, most of them being about cigarette burns in the sheets and the smell of smoke. Motel 6 has non-smoking and smoking rooms. My very first time staying here we stayed in a smoking room and it was terrible. The previous three stays have been incredible, I always make sure to ask for non-smoking rooms and there is never no problem at all. The mattresses are super comfortable, I wonder what company manufactures those mattresses. Overall this hotel is  really nice and super affordable.

P-L-E-A-S-E read! So my first visit here was in april 2012 and we did a road trip with my boyfriend and i (18 and 21) we brought his little brother(15) and my two cousin and my little sister.(14,15,16) we drove from Seattle, Washington to Anaheim. It took us 18 hours and 1,500 miles to get to Anaheim and we were completely exhausted when we arrived! We literally checked in and unloaded our bags from the van and sat down in our room. There was a loud car that parked right outside our window who was blasting his music SO loud, but we just ignored it because we were too tired to care. Within 10 minutes, someone from the front office came to our door and started accusing us of blasting music. He was SO incredibly rude and walked away before we could even speak and to tell him it

Although they have tried to improve the rooms over the years and some do look nicer, I can never get past the loud noises and the wet dog smell in the rooms. It's because of this that I rarely stay at Motel 6's even though the value is usually there.

All the staff were friendly and helpful, it's slightly less than 15 min walk to Disneyland Parks and a huge, clean room awaited when I arrived. Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate is also one of Disneyland's Good Neighbors Hotels so there is a shuttle that takes you directly there from LAX. The only thing was, there's no food nearby if you happen to go hungry at night (save from a vending machine). Other than that, it's value for money. I dont mind going back there again.

Summary Heading: Absolute perfect stay for me and my husband
Summary: As of the date of this review, I have had a total of 49 visits to Disneyland since Feb 2012 and 48 of those days were booked with Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate. I work in a virtual office environment so many of these stays I was a solo guest while my husband stayed back home to work. This Motel6 has consistently provided comfortable, spacious, clean lodging and quality customer service across the board. Motel6 is Good Neighbor motel and provides the best value for my money.  It allows me to stay in a safe and comfortable room close to the Disneyland Resort at a price that gives me the chance to get in extra visits with my Disneyland Premium Annual Pass. These magical visits have given us a chance to really get to know the accommodations offered at the modern Motel6 Anaheim and my

If your on a budget but still want to enjoy Disney, this is your place. The way I look at it, if your going to Disney all you need is a place to sleep and shower and this is the perfect place to do so.  This was my 3rd time staying here but 1st time staying during a busy season, and I will return.  PROS:  -Microwave in lobby area (so bring food from home to heat up. we did oatmeal & mac n cheese. If you can't bring food from home Target is a 5 min drive on the freeway) If you plan on doing this, request a room w/a fridge. -ART Shuttle stop on property. For those unfamiliar with ART, this is a shuttle that takes you to and from Disney. It's $4/day for an adult and I think $2 or $3 for kids 3+. It runs 40 min before Magic Morning & 30 min after park closing. This is 1 of my main

Very disappointed considering the cost per night when compared to other low cost hotels in the area. This is absolutely bare bones, there's nothing extra. The mattress on the bed frame slid away from the wall, it moved side to side as well. The bedding, although clean, was only a sheet and a very thin blanket, nowhere near enough to stay warm at night unless the very loud heater was on. The bath towels had to be the smallest and thinnest I have ever seen. No glasses/cups in the room, no microwave, no fridge, not even a chair to sit on. No in-room coffee but they did have a coffee machine in the lobby but it didn't work. Even though it is posted as non-smoking, people were, including pot. Wanted to check the interweb for other area attractions but it was $2.99 per day..... Went

We stayed at this motel during our recent trip to Disneyland as they were listed as a good neighbor hotel. I saw online that the hotel had recently been updated so I was excited to book as they are a cheap option for Disney. After arriving I was kicking myself for trying to save a buck. What a dump! The bed sheets were gross stained and had cigarette burns in them, it was so bad I went to the local rite-aid and bought my own. The elevator was scary and gross. There were no materials in the room for anything, nothing for the surrounding parks or room service we had to go get them from the front desk. Also they have no do not disturb signs which I found odd. There is no lock on the bathroom which was not fun given I was traveling with children. On the plus side they do offer free
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We apologize for your unsatisfactory experience; the condition of the sheets you described is not consistent with our standard for quality at Motel 6. We take your feedback very seriously and will take it into account as we work to improve our guests’ experience with us.

Summary: The Motel 6 is a nice place to stay for long or short term, close to Disneyland for coming back in the afternoon to take a nap so you can go back for nighttime park fun. The rooms are clean and is pretty quiet, I like the fact that you can tell the manager that you dont need the room changed everyday, because its better on the environment that way. The staff is always on-call and helpful

We stayed here originally do to parking availability of our truck and trailer and proximity to the convention center. Clean room ,comfortable ,very basic you get what you pay for,refrigerator was extra as well as wi fi which I thought was kind of cheap these days to charge for. Staff very friendly and helpful,nice pool .

Summary Heading: Decent location, and great price but...
Summary: You really do get what you pay for. But a few washcloths in the room would have been nice and towels big enough to actually wrap around an small child would have been even nicer.  Concerning the distance to the park: easy walk with two major crosswalks and the distance isn't bad if you're feet aren't killing you after a day of walking. Walking back late at night was a little creepy, there are sections that get dark with minimal streetlights and a section in which you pass a strange and empty overgrown, but gated, parking lot.  Check-in was facilitated by a friendly woman who carefully explained that our room was located near where some painting just took place. It became clear that she was warning us about the chemical/mothball smell that permeated into our first-floor room. If

Summary Heading: There was noise and our bed was sunken in on 1 side
Summary: For the price I would say that this Motel 6 was "ok" but be prepared for noisy children as most of the people at this motel are either going to Disneyland or have just returned from there & there are lots of children around. The new renovation of the rooms was nice & it didn't look like a Motel 6 as it was much nicer. However, we also had problems accessing the so called "free Wifi" as the front desk didn't call us back with our free code until almost 1 hour after we had called them. The bed was also literally sunken in on 1 side so be prepared that you may have this in your room as well which doesn't make for a very good night's sleep.
Manager Response: Hi Babs,  Thank you for taking time to share your review with us. We love hearing from our guests and are happy you enjoyed your stay. We also appreciate your feedback regarding ways we can provide an even more comfortable stay for our guests. We hope to see you soon. Safe Travels Lilith Team6

Summary Heading: just the basics, very nice & helpful employees
Summary: Very simple rooms, no closets or drawers. I guess you can pay extra for fridge/microwave.  Not too long of a walk to Disneyland but there is also available shuttle.  This is an older, cheap motel so don't expect much and you won't be disappointed.  The customer service was impressive.  The employees were very nice and helpful.  They even were able to accommodate us when we wanted to add a night last minute - on a busy saturday no less! Unfortunately the 2nd room had a dead bug in it, some trash under the bed and the bathroom sink plug was stuck down.  I didn't want to complain since the first room was fine and they accommodated our last minute request, AND they let us get into the rooms early.

The room was clean and it was within walking distance to Disneyland. The customer service was excellent. We asked for a room on the top floor and we were given one facing away from Interstate 5. That helped a lot. I'm sure rooms on the other side of the motel would be rather noisy from freeway traffic. We spent the extra money for a room with a fridge and it was a bonus because it had a separate freezer so we could freeze our ice packs. They have plenty of parking with is really nice for a motel near Disney. The only down side would be the beds. They are very hard and not very comfortable. Overall it was a good place to stay. I would stay there again.

I had a difficult time trying to decide what to rate this location for a number of reasons. My family and I stayed here for four nights last week for our trip to Disneyland, which was within walking distance to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and the California Adventure Park. I expected an cheap hotel considering this is a Motel 6, but whatever disarray fixtures and walls are in, I expect a standard of cleanliness. That being said, the floors of our room as well as in the lobby were in need of a deep clean, there was dust and hair in the circular shelves next to the mirror in the bathroom, where clean towels are placed, and one of our pillows was missing a pillow case.   Upon returning from a day at Disneyland with my young son and husband, we walked by a man continuously knocking

Summary Heading: Quick Disneyland Trip before New Years
Summary: We stayed 2 nights at the Motel 6 near Disneyland.  I was a nice experience. The customer service we received was wonderful! I lost my debit card (in disneyland) and they were able to change the reservation and place it on my wife's debit card. That was a relief as it was cold and rainy and super busy in Anaheim that weekend.  The room was nicely renovated with ikea products.  It had a nice televison and room service availabe. There was also security who watched us unload our car late at night.  The towels were small and terrible, but not a huge deal for 2 nights.  The ART picked up quickly and early in the morning to go into Disneyland. I would stay there again for a quick trip and warm bed.

We have stayed at this hotel twice and noticed that the most recent time the hotel looked a little more run down than two years ago. It is good value for money as it is around a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and lots of resturaunts. The staff are pretty helpful and the rooms are clean. I'm not sure if I would stay here again but overall it wasn't a bad experience and for the cost it is very reasonable.

Summary Heading: located within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: Located about a 10 minute walk away from Disneyland, this location is convenient for people visiting Disneyland. You can hear the traffic from I-5 but it quickly becomes white noise after a long and fun day. The motel seems to have had room updates in recent times. The beds were comfortable and the rooms clean. A good value

Summary Heading: Free transportation for Tinkerbell Half Marathon
Summary: We stayed here during the Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend (Jan 19-20).  This is considered to be a "Disneyland Good Neighbor" hotel and free transportation was provided to/from Disneyland for the race events via an Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle.  Aside from price this was our main reason for staying here, although we've stayed at this Motel 6 before.  Close proximity to Disneyland and the Garden Walk shops/restaurants.  Offers smoking rooms for the husband!

Summary Heading: Great location and a better Motel 6 experience than most
Summary: The primary reason anyone is staying here is most likely the value, low price ($62/night in Jan), and proximity to Disneyland.  The room and bathroom overall were clean.  There were a couple stains at the foot of one of the bedspreads, but the sheets and pillowcases were spotless.  Hardwood floors, a breakfast "nook", a small rack in the bathroom for clothes, and all appliances/lights were in working order.  Front desk staff was very friendly.  I did not get a chance to view the grounds or pool.  A shuttle will take you from the motel to Disneyland for $5/person if you don't want to walk or drive yourself.  I have to say, for Motel 6, this is not the typical standard I remember.  I've been spoiled by work travel lately but was on a budget for this personal trip and decided to

Summary Heading: Great location near Disneyland Resort, clean and freindly
Summary: I planned my trip to Disneyland Resort rather late and a lot of the hotels closter had been booked up, I found Motel 6 listed on the Disneyland website under the good neighbour hotels list. I just needed a bed and a shower for my freind and I between days at the Disney parks before heading back to continue my stay in LA.  First of all the picture of the room on the site are exactly what you see. I found the room clean, I don't go through the room looking for dust but the sheets and pillow where clean and the bath and toilet where clean and the floor didn't look dirty either, thats all I need. I paid extra for the fridge in the room so we could keep our drinks chilled and our breakfast. I was excpecting a small fridge but it was a rather big fridge, plenty of space and that

Summary Heading: "We will leave the light on ?" " Should be " They leave the Crystal Chandelier On"
Summary: Let me tell you, I have a whole new perception of Motel 6 now that I have had the pleasure to stay at this one. I would post a picture but others before me have captured this Motel and the reason for my Heading.  I am still traveling for work , still at the Mercy of a "Suits" budget for choosing where they accommodate me ( I will be more than happy if they keep choosing Motel 6 Maingate LOL ) Where to begin ,,, upon arrival - nothing but Hospitality, Service, and Friendly Smiles. Tip: If you are on a tight Family budget - tell a few jokes to " Brittanie" ( Front Desk ) and Laughs get you a possible great rate. "Marlen" ( Brittanie's Wing Girl at the front desk ) will have to be impressed on the Jokes as well so make them good ones ! ;)  "Charlotte" The Assistant GM was a

Summary Heading: Save $$ on transportation to Disney. Read this review.
Summary: Free Parking, close to Disney. Very affordable for family vacation.  They also sell Disney ParkHopper tickets at the front desk that will save you a LONG line at Disney (same price).  We stayed in the 2-queen room with a refrigerator (the larger dorm-type fridge) for a very reasonable rate, under $100/nt average at Christmas Week.  The beds are a little firm, being on a solid base as opposed to a box spring, but that was fine for us.  The room was immaculate, even after our kids trashed it daily.  Front desk staff were friendly and super-helpful.  Manager was very approachable and equally helpful and friendly.  Nothing bad to say about this property at all!  We got (as requested) a room with a Disney view to watch the fireworks, but can't say how good the view is because we fell

We stayed for 6 days, second floor.  Recently done.  Laundry room on site.  Bigger mini fridge in room.  Internet available  Free parking  coffee in office  No microwave in room - but there is two in the front office.  The rooms were clean.  Walking distance to Disneyland with our teenagers.  This is the only motel 6 I will ever stay in again. (I have tried two others, and this bench mark - will not be met by any others)

Summary Heading: Clean room, friendly, helpful staff and convenient to Disneyland Resort
Summary: Check-in was flawless and reception staff were courteous, friendly and helpful.  Room was clean (except for a couple long hairs in the bathroom).  Having read reports of bedbugs in area hotels I took extra precautions including thoroughly examining the room with a magnifying glass, really.  I did not find any insects or indications of the presence of insects.  Stayed for a full week.  Fresh towels were provided, daily.  One day no face clothes were provided, but obtained directly from a passing housekeeper.  Walked to and from the Disneyland Resort multiple times, daily.  Only complaint was terrible WiFi Internet reception.  Using www.speedtest.net, download speed was 0.38 Mb/s and upload speed, 0.49 Mb/s.  (Global average was 12.5 Mb/s.)  Basic web sites were slow to load.

This was our second time staying at this motel 6 and as before we had no issues. This motel 6 is within walking distance to Disneyland and the rates are the best. Will stay again on our next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Good stay at above average Disneyland-area Motel
Summary: My stay at this Motel 6 was good, even though there were a number of issues that popped up during my stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly when problems arrived, which is why I rate this Motel 6 as Very Good for a motel. I checked in to my original King room only to find that the A/C unit was very loud. Requested a room change and was quickly assigned a new room down the hall. All was well. The next night, after a full day and evening at the Disneyland Resort I returned to find that my key did not open my room door. Checked with the staff and it turned out that I was never officially moved to my new room so the key was not registering. This was fixed and I returned to my room only to find that since I had not been officially moved the room had not been cleaned. Not a

We stayed here during the Thanksgiving holiday. We didn't know what to expect of this motel due to motels and hotels of good and bad experiences. Staff were great, got early check in with no problems, room was in great condition.Very modern. Staff gave us advice on saving $$$ in the area. Made it easy for our stay. This be a perfect place if you are trying to save a buck and enjoy Disneyland.

This place was very very affordable. They remodeled it and it looks cute and trendy. It had everything we needed. The front desk staff were very nice. The Internet was spotty but I didn't have to pay for it so that was fine. Disney shuttle was great and had Disney characters painted all over it. We just slept there when we would get back late from Disney. It was a nice stay for us. Didn't see any bugs or get bed bugs. Towels are thin but I didn't care. We made it through an earthquake while we stayed there too. Good times. Also we were able to see the fireworks from Disney from just outside our room on the balcony.

I've stayed at this hotel a few times now. Both before and after the remodel. My most recent stay was October 24-27 2012. Check-in was quick and simple.The staff is very friendly and helpful. They even called us once we were in our room to make sure the changes we made worked out for us. The room was very clean. There aren't many amenities, but it has everything you need. You can ask for a mini-fridge for an additional $3 a night. There are not blow dryers, coffee makers or microwaves in the rooms (there is a microwave in the vending machine area). My one major complaint is the comfort of the beds. They are very hard and can be lumpy. We heard others complaining about the beds at check out. Check-out was quick and easy. We were on the bottom floor on a corner with high traffic,

Summary Heading: Great Stay for the seond time
Summary: Big family trip to Disneyland.  Reserved three non -smoking rooms and got them all side by side as requested. Rooms were very clean again.  The hotel has two elevators in the front and back of the site. Purchased all passes at the hotel including the transit passes to the park. Very few hotels offer free transit to the park anymore.  ATS ( Anaheim Transit System) comes to all the local hotels and I recommend getting the passes.   The hotel is close, but when you are tired a ride is the best way to go.

We stayed for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. When we had arrived they didn't have me in the top floor like I requested. When I mentioned it right away they pulled me aside and upgraded me to a top floor room with a refrigerator. The room was clean, updated very nice at first glance I so impressed. UNTIL I layed on the bed it felt more like box springs . It just wasn't a very comfortable bed. With that being said I would stay again. And be prepared to wait up to 30 minutes to get the shuttle to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: great hotel for a great deal!!
Summary: My husband and I and our 2 dogs stayed at this hotel for a week. The room was very clean. The staff was so friendly. The hotel is right around the corner from Disney!! There are lots of shopping and dinning right around the corner. We could see the fire works clearly from the hotel too!!! We will always stay here for now on.

I am accustomed to staying in higher end chain hotels like the Hyatt and Hilton, and was slightly hesitant to stay at a Motel 6. However, I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Since it was just my teenage son and I , and we were just looking for an overnight for Disneyland, it worked well. Rooms have been given a facelift and look nice. Beds are pretty comfortable- I slept great. I do suggest bringing your own pillows though. Staff here was awesome. Super nice, super helpful. Shuttle to Disneyland was convenient- 5 dollars for adults and 2 dollars for kids 3-9. Overall, I would say great budget hotel if you basically just need a place to sleep while at Disneyland.

I booked the Motel 6 for a spur of the moment trip. I liked the price and I knew that it was within walking distance to the parks. We didn't find any bugs (which I was keeping my eye out for...) The bathroom was not what I would call clean. The floors looked as though the only way they had been mopped was with a damp cloth. They were streaked with dirt. There were stains on the sheets, comforter and towels (some of the scratchiest towels on the planet might I add.) Folded in the scratchy towels were waded up "cleaned" hairs. The decor is minimal but has been remodeled. We didn't notice the traffic noise from I-5 even thought we were very close. If the cleanliness was there I would say that Motel 6 would have a good deal going.

Summary Heading: No where to put your stuff
Summary: This hotel is great if you are on a budget.  There is a charge for everything and the room design is ackward.  There is no where to really store your clothes and things.  The beds were not the comfortable.  I would stay here again if I needed a good budget motel.

Summary Heading: Apparently, A Bugs Land relocated from Disneyland.
Summary: While the low price was great and the room looked good too, I learned not to judge a book by its cover. I woke up to my wife screaming because there was a roach the size of my hand in the bathroom. It was the biggest roach I've ever seen and I live in NYC mind you. In addition to our roach friend, there was a pesky fly, a few moths and a couple of mosquitos. The maids obviously keep the doors wide open while cleaning. I would have sacrificed clean towels if it meant our critter friends were gone. Other than this, the bed was rock hard. Might as well have slept on the floor. In conclusion, shell out a few extra bucks and stay somewhere else. You get what you pay for here.

My entire family booked with Maingate when we could not find any other hotels(cheap or expensive!) close to DisneyLand during spring break 2012. I mean, it was our fault because we waited last minute to book our rooms, but we didn't realize it was "spring break" & that everyone AND their mother were going to DisneyLand for their spring break! So anyways, we found Maingate online, saw the remodeled rooms & thought they looked nice. We really had no choice but to book the rooms or else we would have to cancel the trip altogether. We weren't expecting anything great or fancy since it was a "Hotel 6" & honestly, we just needed a place to lay our heads for the night since we were gone from early morning to late @ night. We booked 3 rooms, 1 for my family(2 adults & 2 kids) our room

I book a room for my daughter and her husband for a 2 day trip to Disneyland.  Funds were a little tight for the couple so I helped them pick this Motel 6 near the kingdom.  They loved the room was very nice and clean with a very modern look and feel.  Was a great place for them to stay for the few days the were visiting the Magic Kingdom!

We stayed at the hotel for a trip to Disneyland. Check in was easy and the staff was nice. I knew not to expect too much because even though its been renovated, its still Motel 6. When we got to the room I noticed right away that one bed had stains on the sheets. The whole three days we slept on top of the covers. I consistently found someone elses hair every where and the bathroom needed a good scrub. When the maid stocked the towels they would only give us one wash cloth so we had to ask for more since there were two adults and a two year old. Unfortunately we were also put next door to a guest who brought their dog along with them. They locked the dog in the room alone so there was constant barking night & day. I didn't think the hotel was horrible but I wouldn't stay here

Summary Heading: SUMMER FUN NEAR THE MAGIC KINGDOM!
Summary: Booked through travel agent. Desk clerks at check in were very pleasant as well as helpful. Checked in and informed clerk I had bus (ART) pass/Disney Tickets waiting. They were in the manager's desk locked up. I could have waitied till next day, it was after 11pm after long train ride. Though girl who helped me at front desk was so good to call manager to get my bus and Disney passes.  Bus stand was right out by lobby back and forth to Disney, how convenient! Used pool area and spa, very great to have after walking around Disney all morning and early afternoon. Room was nothing fancy. Though I'd be at Disney most of the time. Come back to use pool room would be all tidied up by maids. I would tell anyone needing a clean comfortable place to stay at a verrrrrrry reasonable price

Highly recommended, only problem is they don't have much parking. But they still get an A++++ It was clean, not noisy, vey private, has a clean pool. The workers are very friendly I have stayed there on three Seperate occasion even if it's not close to my destination! And you also get to enjoy the fire works every night

After a horrible experience at a motel 6 in San Diego, we figured we would give them one more try. (It didnt help that we had a free night due to the horrible experience). We surprised our son with a trip to Disneyland. Upon checking in we were greeted by a super friendly front desk clerk. We got a non smoking king room on the 4th floor, the room was spacious had lots of storage space, bed was comfortable, bathroom was spotless and television had a wide variety of channels we got to watch the Disneyland fireworks from our room. We had a blast and had no issues with the property. we will return very soon.

We traveled down to Anaheim on business and on pleasure.  I had an event set-up on Saturday night and my husband had business training on the following Monday and Tuesday so we decided to stay Saturday-Wednesday.  We were also traveling with my mom and our dog.  I searched and searched for decently priced 2 room suites in the area and only came across suites that included twin or full sized beds in the other room due to the fact that it is the Disneyland area.  We came across the Motel 6 online and found that we could get two rooms for almost the price of one anywhere else and booked right away.  Pets stay free which was also a plus!  We did call the hotel to see if they had adjoining rooms and were told that they did and to write a note in the comment section of our reservation

Appreciated the fact that they had rooms available at midnight, but was definitely not impressed with the remodeled rooms. The sheets and floors were dirty... :(  It was extremely loud 'til around 3am, and that's understood since there so many families. The noise from the people walking up and down the hallway seemed like it was inside the room.   Best thing would be the flat screen TV. But for the price, expected a bit more.

We have stayed in many different Hotels and Motels by the Disneyland Resort. By far this hotel has had the best customer service. I would not say this hotel is within walking distance. After a full day at the park walking back would in my opinion be a nightmare. They do have a shuttle service which we did not use because we have free parking at the resort.   Because we arrived a night early we had to take the only room available and were switched the next morning to another room so that we could have ground floor access. The hotel staff made this transition very easy. The rooms are spacious but are lacking in drawers. They do have cubbies where you can stick your clothes. The beds are on the harder side, which I didn't mind. After reading reviews we chose to bring our own towels

Summary Heading: Not a nice place to stay
Summary: Where do I start?  The positive reviews for ths place are hard to believe.  When we arrived the girl at the front desk was rude and suggested that I haul both my luggage and my special needs child up the stairs because the housekeepers and other guests were using the elevator.  Then she proceeded to direct me to go up the wrong elevator so I had to haul both my kid and a large luggage rack up two times.  When we finally got to the room the air conditioning was broken s we had to move anyway.  The regerigeratorvi paid extra for barely kept anything cold, and the air conditioning never really cooled the room.  Both the sink and tub backed up.  The wifi either dd not work or was too slow to use depending on the day.  My feet turned black from walking on the floor in the room.  I

Our room and towels were dirty and my husband and I found two cockroaches. Staff admitted to it not being a first time complaint about the bugs. After a huge ordeal they refunded us half of our money. It's worth paying extra money to stay somewhere clean. I'll never stay there again.

Summary Heading: Best hotel we've stayed at for Disney in 27 years
Summary: We are a total Disney family, and have stayed at nearly every property in and around the park for 27 years. This is by far the best bang for our buck and the place will stay at EVERY time we visit in the future. The hotel staff was extremely accomodating, putting us in a room where we could see the backside of the park. The property was safe, clean, and the rooms are completely revamped. My Mom was blown away upon entry, saying "this is a Motel 6?" Normally we sacrifice the quality of our hotel for distance because after walking for 10+ hours in a day we like something nearby...Fortunately this hotel offers a shuttle that you only have to pay a few bucks for and the pass is good for the return home too. I wouldn't compare it to a Hyatt or Disney Resort property of course, but if

Good points: affordable motel... and friendly staff Bad: bathrooms do not HAVE DOORS! Hello...are you kidding? No. There is a double door, kind of like you're entering a saloon, into the sink area...but this also connects to the toilet and shower, so if you want to have any privacy (shower or toilet) you have to make a statement to your family, "Please stay out of this entire area!" Capish? Not a good fit for a normal family.   Beds are comfy but...BUT...bring your own blanket. The blankets are just a bit thicker than the sheets. We asked for extra, but there was only 1 left in entire hotel. We reserved a rm w/ a refrigerator, but none was available...although they did bring one the 2nd night at no chg. The walk to D-land is kind of long...WAY too long to walk back at end of the

Summary Heading: Fabuous for Motel 6 !  VERY VERY NICE !
Summary: Wow.  Pleasantly surprised.  Lobby was very nice, fresh coffee is served. Gift shop was cute.  Service was excellent.  Right after check in, they called to see how I liked the room and if I needed anything. Rooms have been redone with IKEA style furniture and are huge !  Pet friendly and CLEAN ! The rooms are huge and so is the bathroom.  They even provide shampoo and conditioner. If you dont want room cleaning service, you just let the front desk know and they handle it.  Extra towels ? Not a problem !  You get plenty when you ask. Beds were clean and comfortable.   Price was $79.99 for two queens. $82.99 for the same with a fridge.   I will always stay here.  Its  walk, but you can walk to Disneyland and the Garden Walk is right around the corner. Love this place.   Cant say

Summary Heading: Will never stay here again! One word- "Disgusted"
Summary: My husband and I came for a Disney trip from July 5th to the 8th, 2012. We had stayed here three years ago and had a good experience then. At that time we stayed in one of their accessible rooms. Maybe those rooms aren't used as much, and are more sound proof but this go round was quite opposite.  The staff, location and price are the only positive things about this property. I have never stayed in a dirtier or louder hotel. We were unpleasantly woken up each morning by the sounds of our neighbors using their bathrooms(lets leave it at that). The maid did visit the room each day, but the floors were probably more clean BEFORE she mopped. Each day I had to wipe them clean just to feel like it was safe to walk barefoot. In the end I wore socks. The bathroom was horrible. The floor

The location is perfect, walking distance to Disneyland. Our rooms were clean and tidy everyday. The price is very cheap. The downside is no breakfast, the laundry service can be costly because the dryers r not the best. I would recommend this hotel and stay again, overall a good value!

Staff was nice, exterior needed some work but interior newly remodeled and quite comfortable. I was surprised how soundproof the walls were...an unexpected surprise. However, it's definitely economy. The dirty towels only get changed out every three days, there are no microwave, refrigerator, ironing board, hair dry nor coffee maker. Wifi is $3 per day.   If you're looking for a clean and comfortable place to sleep, this is it. If you want all the amenities, look elsewhere.   Oh...buy the Anaheim Resort bus pass.  They pick up right at the lobby and drop off at Disneyland. You can transfer there if you need to get elsewhere in the area.

Most people when they hear Motel 6, some people expect not so great stay. From the outside it looks like an okay hotel, and does need some exterior touch ups. Elevator is old, but still works.    THEY HAVE EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I can't emphasize how great the everyone who works at Motel 6 was.   My daughter and I stayed in the newly Renovated King Room for 3 days 2 nights. We got there early at 7:30am, and they checked us in (but our room wasn't ready yet - which was fine with us). We left our luggage in the locked up luggage storage area. Then off to Disneyland we went! They let me leave the car parked too (and parking is free). Shuttle service was very convenient. Right outside of the hotel lobby! Plenty of parking. I got lucky with parking right in the front. $4 for

We weren't sure what to expect when we booked this hotel, however were not disappointed! It is exceptionaly good value for money! The hotel is about a 10 to 15 minute walk to Disney and very close to many dining options. The rooms are very clean, simple and nicely renovated. We wanted a hotel to mainly sleep as we were at Disney most of the time and this hotel was the perfect choice. In fact we have booked this hotel again for our trip in September and the other three couples that are travelling with us have also booked this hotel too based on our recommendation! We hope we enjoy the experience just as much the second time round!

Our family of four stayed here May 27 - 31 while going to, wherelse, Disneyland.  We booked through Disney Travel.  The upper level room facing the park was not ready, so we decided to take a ground floor room.  It was just fine!  There was no noise coming from the other rooms although the hotel was full.  The only problem we ran into was on the 2nd day when our room was not made up in a timely fashion.  Then on the 5th day our room was not made up at all.  The manager apologized, brought clean towels and offered to make the beds and tidy up.  As it was already 10:30 pm, we declined.  He said to be sure and mention the problem to the morning manager and he would leave a note.  He explained they had recently lost a good portion of their housekeeping staff.  The next morning we

We were visiting Disney and needed a place to stay that was close.  It is within walking distance to Disney and the price was cheaper on a holiday weekend.  It was very loud and semi-clean.  The front desk staff was less than helpful when things needed to be done.  We would walk down to talk with the front desk and the staff was standing around talking about everyday things, not business.  They finished their gossip before they helped us.

We had not expected much but we were pleasingly surprised. Rooms have been remodeled with a minimalistic  design which makes the rooms look and feel much bigger. Hardwood floors are also a nice touch. Really close to Disneyland and other attractions and eateries. Staff was very accommodating.

Summary Heading: Great place very near to Disney
Summary: Recently renovated hotelrooms. We had a room away from the pool and street, very quiet. The beds were harder than all the other beds we had in the USA. Good for people with backproblems. Room and bathroom looked clean but had some black hairs in it that weren't ours. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. The shuttlebus for $ 4,00 pp to Disney stops direct in front of the lobby regularly. Just 5 minutes drive. No breakfast, just coffee in the morning. The little shop in the lobby offers pre packed cereals and muffins, fine for us to start the day. Price of the room was approx $ 75,00 for a weekendnight in May. Good value for the money to visit Disney. You even can enjoy the fireworks in front of the hotel.

I wasn't sure what i'd get for $50 so close to Disney and I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door to a large studio room with a queen size bed and a clean and spacious bathroom. The room boasted a new plasma TV and the bed was comfortable. The staff were incredibly friendly. I would stay again.

Summary Heading: No coffee, hard floors, hard beds, small towels; but service was great!
Summary: Good enough for lower expectations. Floors were very slippery, very uncomfortable beds, no maid service for stay-over, no dressers, no hair dryers and NO COFFEE! Very good location if you're going to Disney Land though, and EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!

I took a chance with this place as Motel 6 doesn't usually have a reputation as a "nice hotel" but it was actually not too shabby! They have really updated the rooms to a more modern/futuristic style with all wooden floors, no rugs or carpet at all, flat screen LCD wall mounted TV, soft wall lighting above each bed, bathrooms very clean, small booth type table and bench, ample parking, nice large pool, safe area, somewhat walking distance to Disneyland however I strongly recommend the shuttle bus service ($4 per adults/$1 per child per day or you can purchase multiple day passes from the lobby) as it picks you up from the lobby and drops you off right smack at the disneyland entrance. The lobby is very clean and well lit, has a small store that has a few useful things including

We stayed here because we were visiting Disney. We also needed a pet friendly hotel. The hotel was clean and there was a nice little shop in the front lobby to shop. We enjoyed our stay here. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was that they don't have breakfast and there isn't a place within walking distance.

Stayed here for two nights in April of 2012. Given that all I really needed during this disneyland vacation was a clean place to sleep and take a shower, this hotel was good enough. There is definitely room for improvement with the bedding, you only really get sheets and no blanket. The floor was dirty, but not too terrible. Walls are paper thin, so just hope you get quiet neighbors. Over all, I was pretty impressed considering the price and the fact that it is a motel 6. I would stay here again if I was on a tight budget, otherwise i might pay more for something else.

Summary Heading: A Nice, Clean Hotel with the Lowest Rates in Town
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights in April, 2012. The rooms were very clean and nicely styled. The beds were firm, but comfortable. I checked the room and mattresses thoroughly and saw no signs of any kind of bugs anywhere. As I was checking, I noticed how clean the place was.  (I like clean) I really like the faux hardwood floor, it's so much cleaner than the disgusting carpet you usually find in hotels.    The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly and the housekeeping ladies did a great job and were friendly too. The pool and spa were clean. The spa was plenty hot and worked well. We took a mid-day break from Disneyland, took ART back to the hotel, got a foot massage by the spa jets, took a nap, and were back on rides by 6pm.   The TV is big and has plugs in the front to plug
Would never go back my family and I stayed there and we all got bed bugs and think we brought them home too that place sucks don't stay there

Summary Heading: You will think you are in Ikea
Summary: I stayed here 1 night on March 13th, 2012 before my wedding. The rooms were very clean and very simple. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of outlets around the bed to make charging phones easy. I really enjoyed the seating area, it was small enough to not take up the entire room, but big enough to sit two people at easily, and it was extremely comfortable. The faux hardwood floor is a nice change to the disgusting carpet you often find in older hotels. We had a room located right outside the pool, but the noise never bothered us. They do have an ART stop right outside the lobby, but is technically "walking distance". Adding a small fridge on to a room is cheap too! They do offer room service as well, but it is from place off site. I didn't try it because it was not

Summary Heading: Great property! Clean and close to DisneyLand.
Summary: We stayed at the hotel Mar 29-Apr 2. We had a one king bed room. The room was clean and our only complaint was that there was no iron/ironing board. I loved that the room had hardwood floors. I didn't feel uncomfortable letting the kids play on the floor as I typically do with carpeted hotel rooms. The front desk staff were very friendly and housekeeping did a great job getting the room together everyday after we destroyed it :). I would definitely stay at this location again. It's a short walk to Disneyland and about 1/3 of the price of the hotels right across the street. The shuttle picks up right in front of the hotel too, so even if you did take a shuttle you'd still save money over the hotels across the street.

This Motel 6 has the new look and what a difference. Clean, modern and fresh. We stay in a few Motel 6 on the road and have generally been satisfied, but this one is just so good. Service was great, bus to the parks, walking distance to shops and park, just off main road so all in all a great place for families to stop if going to Disney.

This hotel was not a good one and Im not picky. They didnt sweep the "hard wood floors". There were absolutely no ammenities. No hairdryer, coffee maker, iron, not even a clock in the room. The beds were hard and sat on a piece of wood that we bumped our knees against constantly. And the towels were paper thin and stained. Other than this being close to disneyland, it was a terrible experience. I would suggest finding something else!!

We wouldn't know how the hotel was, because they overbooked and my whole family was booked in Santa Ana which had no shuttles to Disneyland, totally ruined our vacation and ended up costing me alot of money, on gas and hours spent on the freeway, not to mention cranky grandkids because we couldn't go back to the hotel to rest and also had to pay for parking at Disneyland.
nice room, clean quiet, can see fireworks from  Disney kids loved the pool and us the hot tub  no problem with bringing the dog will go back.  nice fluffy pillows felt so good after Big Disney trip.

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland, you'd think the fireworks were outside your window
Summary: My day at Disneyland was Saturday and I had to be there early, at 10 am at the latest. I checked into the hotel around 5 pm with no problems at all. I had requested an accessable room and the room (except for the floors (no carpet) was perfect.  The shower had the hand held sprayer which I really like and the bathroom is very roomy.  There are plug sockets on either side of the bed for cpap machine and whatever other plug ins that one may have.  So, I finally get to sleep about 8:30 pm after a long 6 hour drive then all of the sudden, BANG, BOOM the fireworks started at the park.  I thought someone was setting off firecrackers in the parking lot!!!!  Then I realized it was the fireworks show at the park.  Also, the room was very sterile.  Just the bed, television and a place to

I like simplicity in my life, and this one fit the bill. The place was clean, the price was right, and  the room was convenient. While being in town for the NAMM Show, it served my needs comfortably for 5 nights. Being able to watch the Disney fireworks across the street from my room was cool, although my room position for that was coincidental. The vending area was OK when needing something. The coffee in the morning helped, and it was close enough for walking to a 7-11 and other restaurants. I'll use it again next year.

I love this Motel six it's always reasonably priced under 60 even on the weekends. Spacious colorful rooms wood flooring which is perfect for those of us who travel with pets friendly service.  We've never had a problem when staying here. The rooms are clean If you are looking for a five star place of course you are going to be disappointed it's a motel 6  cheap serviceable furniture clean comfortable bed nice friendly staff . The only complaint I might have is the lack of a dresser but they do have a shelving unit that works just as well and it gives the room a much more spacious feel.

Summary Heading: Good budget motel for a nite or two
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel before and we needed a budget motel in this area again.  This time we got a room with a refrigerator, which made it a bit nicer to be able to have cold drinks in our room. You can also get drinks and other items from the vending machines in the lobby area or in the little store in the lobby area.  There is a coffee bar and a microwave available in the lobby area for your use if you need it.  Having stayed here before, we remembered to bring our slippers to wear in the room as walking on hard wood floors can make your feet/socks black.  There isn't much seating in the room.  There is a small table attached to the wall with a chair and wall attached seating next to the table.  The bathroom is closed with a hollow type door.  I didn't care that the

Motel 6 @ 100 west disney way  The location is awesome, less then 15 minutes to walk to Disneyland, might be a little far to walk with young kids (especially after a day in the park).  The rooms are clean and modern, light and airy. We stayed for 6 nights and have almost no complaints. Try and get a room away from the street side, it can be a little noisy with the freeway right there. I would reccomend this hotel !!

We have been to this hotel before and just like last time. We had a pleasant stay. As usual the staff were friendly. The pool and spa were awesome. Especially since it was the 4th of July weekend and we were in the middle of a heat wave. So after dealing with record breaking heat during our trip to disneyland. The beds, showers and a/c room felt amazing. I just wish they had a little fridge so we didn't have to log around a cooler. But other than that I can't wait to go back again.

Summary Heading: Best Motel 6 we have stayed at in a LONG time!!
Summary: My family shows and breeds dogs, so we are on the rode a Lot. Motel 6 is one of the few less expensive motels, so we stay at them pretty routinly. even when we go on family trips. first part of december was a trip to Disneyland. we stayed at this Motel and just walking through the doors into the room was suprising... there were wood floors, great if my 3 year old spilled something, or one the the very infrequent accidents by one of the dogs. there staff were all Great, happy, and helpful, even at 10 at night when we arrived. Its a Great distanct from Disneyland main gates, a long enough walk to wear out a 3 year old, but not to long to have to carry them the whole way back. from now on my family will be staying at this motel. that is for sure!

This is the best <$50 room within walking distance from the park. The shuttle is a few dollars a day but it is an easy walk. I usually drop the kids off at the park, then park in the FREE parking at the motel, then I walk to the park in about 10 minutes.   The rooms are all brand new and really are just like their pics on the website! The pool is ample. The staff are super caring. There is a microwave for the guests to use. We always take advantage of that!   The rooms are very clean. Now that we have stayed with the hard wood floors, carpeted hotels kinda creep me out.   It is quiet. THEY WELCOME our dog! Overall, it is a great place to stay. Oh yea, and my hubby likes the free coffee bar in the morning. He needs java to get started. It is nice that we do not have to stop to

Summary Heading: Affordable, 15-min walk to Main Gates at DCA and Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is older, but the decor inside the rooms is much more modern. The description of "IKEA style" is spot on.  The beds were comfortable. Bedding was clean, cozy (not "fluffy" or filled with down...but, warm, clean, comfortable.)  The service at the hotel was pleasant and when I had a problem with my room key not working late at night, they responded quickly, politely and offered to make-up for the inconvenience before I ever had to ask.  The hotel is roughly $50/night...a bargain. I have stayed at The Grand Californian, Disneyland Hotel and the Sheraton by the Convention Center.  This is NOT any of those. But, I didn't expect it to be.    In a nutshell, these things are good to know in advance of your visit: 1) Bring your own "Do Not Disturb | No Maid Svc, Thank you" sign

Summary Heading: Overall decent, but don't go without shoes
Summary: We stayed here from October 16-26. The hotel was ok, nothing awesome. They have re-done the hotel in a Ikea furniture style (without carpeting), but dressers would have been nice. Tee big issue we had was that on the day we checked in I walked around the room for appx 10 minutes and the bottom of my socks wsa black from dirt, I called the front desk to ask if they could please mop the floors the next day when they cleaned the room I was told that it would not be a problem, well the floors were not cleaned. I called the front desk and again asked that the floors be mopped, was promised this would happen. That night everything was finaly clean. Well, we stayed for a total of 10 nights and that was the only time the floors were mopped. Otherwise we had a great trip.

After reading many review about Motel 6 I was nervous. But don't always believe what you read. Our room was VERY clean. Beds not bad at all. And I was concerned about how thin the blankets were but they must have been a thermal kind because we were very warm. The location was save. My daughter even went in the pool and hot tub. Both were heated in Dec. They had coffee in the lobby which was fine. I would stay at this Motel 6 again. We were very happy with our 4 day stay.

Summary Heading: Just good enough not to find a new place, but not good enough to return.
Summary: Was looking for an inexpensive hotel room for our most recent Disneyland stay.  Booked this hotel as the rates were very good, even with missing breakfast being served in the morning.  However, I learned a valuable lesson of reading what is available and what is not before you get to the hotel.  We learned that we were going to be charged extra for fridge a couple hours before arrival and called ahead to request one and also a microwave.  When we arrived we were checked in and told that the fridge was in the room and there was no microwave available.  We were fine with this, but a little irritated that we were charged extra for the fridge.  We got into our room and the room is very simply furnished and has nice hardwood floors in the bedroom area and tile in the bathroom.  No
Very modern looking room.. comfortable beds. The nicest motel I've ever stayed. I will only stay at this

I was a little hesitant at first to stay here since we usually stay at another hotel that is near disneyland as well but there was no rooms available, we do visit anahiem at least once a month.  Overall the agent at the front desk was very nice & friendly. There is plenty of parking, room is very clean especially with wood floors. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay here again. Also, If your planning on going to Disneyland it is close enough to walk but since you will be walking all day at the park I would recommend taking the shuttle called (art bus)  which stops right in front of the hotel and is under $5 and is good for the entire day! :) you can buy those tickets at the front desk just ask the agent for details. Hope this review is helpful.

Summary Heading: The nicest Motel 6 to visit, ever!
Summary: This place was awesome. Nice building, clean room and great service. The rooms are remodeled, comfortable and clean. Clean is the key word here! It's rare to find a place where you feel that the conditions are sanitary enough, but this place was! The floors were all wood, no carpet! The only problem we encountered was hair in a couple of the towels. We complained to the front desk and the lady gave us a free night and was very apologetic. The next time towels were brought into our room, they were perfectly white and clean. To me that's great service. Another plus is that the location is walking distance to Disneyland and is a great price. I know where I'm going to stay next time we go to the Happiest Place on Earth!

We have annual Disneyland passes and have opted to stay at the Motel 6 Maingate.  It is really clean and the staff has always been very nice and helpful.  The motel is only a couple of minutes from Disneyland, so the location is perfect.  The rooms are clean and taken care of and the last time we stayed, our room overlooked the back side of California Adventure.  So we could see everything.  We will continue to stay at this Motel 6 because of the cost and efficiency of the entire staff.  Thank you.

Very clean budget hotel..the front desk staff were always friendly and very helpful with anything we asked of them.The disney shuttle pulls up right at the door, and so did all tour buses we required.Why spend top dollars on somewhere to sleep when you can save a fortune and spend it at disneyland or anywhere else in the area..Im told motel 6 has a bad rep for poor quality but I found nothing wrong with this place at all.

Summary Heading: A good choice for the budget conscious
Summary: This motel has been renovated and the rooms are super clean and furnished in a minimalist style: No rugs, bedding that tucks in instead of hanging to the floor, shelves instead of drawers for your clothing and personal items. We stayed at three hotels in the area during August, and this one was perfectly functional. The staff was friendly and helpful, the pool and hot tub clean, snacks were available, and parking was free. It is also pet friendly and internet was available for under $3 per day.

When going to Disneyland, You have many choices of hotels and motels you can stay at. So why stay at motel 6 ? When you go to disneyland you pretty much spend all day at the parks. So you basically need a place to sleep before getting up and going back to the park, beach or wherever you're going. Disneyland is close enough to walk to. But I recommend the shuttle. The rooms.  are alright for what we need. They are quiet,clean (except for the floors) and relaxing. We can hang out by the pool or sit in the jacuzzi. The main reason to stay here is..,.it is pet friendly. When we travel, we bring the whole family. Including the dogs. Disneyland has a kennel for the dogs . Remember it's not. the Hilton. But it's good enough for the. WHOLE family.

I really wanted to be able to give this motel a good review because my first impressions of it were great . Also it bothers me when I read others reviews about a budget motel and they go on and on about how terrible it was. The only reason anybody stays at a motel six is for the low rates right? If we could we would all be staying in a five star resort.  Like I said the first impressions were good. The hotel is in a good quiet neighborhood. The front desk area is modern and clean and my daughter was thrilled that there was a flat screen playing her favorite disney channel show. There was a  couple of vending machines selling frozen burritos and other microwaveable items and there was a microwave and we were told there was free coffe in the mornings.  Down the hall was a guest

This is honestly the nicest Motel 6 I have ever stayed at. The rooms are always clean and the staff friendly. It is so close to Disneyland (12 minutes walking) or you can take the shuttle which drops you off in front of the hotel and in front of Disneyland for $4 round trip, just buy the tickets at the front desk. There is only one problem that I do have and that is you have to tell the front desk you do not want maid service. There is no do not disturb sign to do that. One of the best aspects of this motel is how much cheaper it is compared to others. Last weekend I paid $77/night a huge bargain considering how close it is to the park.

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland, nice rooms, great value! :)
Summary: This was the nicest motel 6 we have seen. It was literally down the street from Disneyland. It is clean, convenient, and at a great price. Nice pool too. But, with Disneyland down the street who wants to play at the hotel. They also provide packages to purchase for the parks. ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!

I stayed here for 2 nights on a recent trip to Disneyland with my 5 1/2 year old daughter.  I requested a King size bed on the top floor of the hotel based on previous reviews regarding hearing the guests above you.  The staff was very friendly.  The room was very nice and roomy with only 1 bed.  The furniture/overall feel is very IKEA.  As previous reviews have noted, no carpeting, which I liked.  There is a table and chairs in the corner of the room.  Shower pressure was great; no problem with hot water.  Previous reviews had complained because no dresser and only 2 hooks to hang clothing in room.  That was not a problem at all for us.  There is a shelf and 2 hooks.  I brought along an over-the-door hook for additional clothing hanging, but didn't even need it.  That idea

we stayed here last year, we were going to the disney resort for 2 days, we stayed in the Business Room here and it had wood floors which is a plus, I prefer wood over carpet. was super quiet, the staff was super friendly, and they even had a shuttle that went to the Disney front gate, I recommend this place to all, I hope it's still good now.

We arrived and was checked right in and as soon as we brought our suitcases to the room (poolside) the kids went swimming. We walked to Disneyland to purchase our tickets and it was not a long walk at all and we had three kids ages 8, 5, & 3. The rooms are big enough and very clean, although there was not enough towels but the front desk gave me more. I was really impressed with this motel 6 and will definitly stay again!

Room was clean and updated, nice bathroom design! We needed this room to basically just sleep and shower since we were going to be at Disneyland for 2 days.  Motel is close, but after walking all day and night, we did not want to walk to and from.  Motel does have a shuttle, but we didn't ask about it since we wanted to pack stuff in the trunk for Disneyland and make a trip to the parking garage for jackets, water etc.. One gripe of mine is that the beds did not have mattress pads or pillow protectors...so i made my own out of towels ...Lol. But it was perfect for what we needed.

I stayed here one night because the other hotel I normally stayed at was full and was just amazed how nice this Motel 6 was. It so close to Disneyland and price was reasonable. I like how the room had a vinyl floor and not carpet so no worries of carpets that are not clean. The room itself was really clean. Had really nice a television and enough electrical outlets for all my stuff. I will now always stay here when visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive no frills room by Disneyland
Summary: Great way to get a separate room for the kids without breaking the bank.  Since we spent most of our day at the park, we didn't want to spend a bundle on amenities.  Tough to beat for $60/night when it's a block from the Disneyland gate.  Upsides -- big comfortable bed, inexpensive & close, quiet, has a pool (we didn't use it).  Downsides -- no place to store clothes (no dressers, they installed a set of shelves on our 2nd day there), $3/day fee for wi-fi, coffee machines broken, paper thin bath towels.

I would not recommend this place for a family vacation...  Although it did meet my needs for the one night stay I would have hated it for a vacation stay.  Rooms look just like the website pictures.  2 queen beds. the beds were hard but not to uncomfortable. No backache. Mattresses had stains only knew this because fitted sheets did not fit so it exposed the mattress! You would think they would try to hide there imprefections I guess they just don't care. There are only 4 very small, flat pillows. Front desk had no extra pillows. FYI Motel was not full! Bathroom and Vanity are in the same room it was roomy but had no locking door.  Getting ready in the morning took longer because while someone was using the toilete or shower no one can use the vanity to get ready. Towels were

We normally stay at the Marriott...but to save some cash we decided to give this motel a try. On the whole it was clean and comfortable, which is the minimum requirement when spending long days at disney. There is no coffee maker, alarm clock or hairdryer...this keeps the cost down. There was coffee on offer in the lobby, but honestly, it was the most disgusting coffee I have ever tasted, and I can pretty much drink any kind! It is a bit of a hike to find breakfast in the morning...a bus ride or 20 min walk (with a 2 yr old). The last morning there was no hot water in our room...I called to the front desk and they told me they had had an issue overnight and expected it to be resolved quickly. However, it was no fun washing my hair in cold water! On checking out, we were refunded

Summary Heading: a good hotel for the price
Summary: This hotel was the first one we stayed at on our arrival in LA. It was clean and comfortable and staff were excellent, especially front desk staff. The shuttle to Disneyland that departed every 20 minutes was a bonus as it saved us parking costs. There are several good restaurants and stores close in the area. ea and coffee is provided in the lobby in the mornings.

Summary Heading: Stay here and save your money for Disneyland!!! Awesome Value!
Summary: After reading some of the reviews prior to staying here I was really worried. I even booked a backup hotel but didn't cancel this reservation. Well we ended up staying here with our 3 children (ages 7,4, and 7 months) and it was just what we needed! No there is nothing fancy but it had what we needed two beds, a bathroom and a tv. We only used our room to sleep and bathe. Room was clean. No bugs or dirty floor, as previous reviews had mentioned. Customer service was awesome. Free coffee. Nice heated pool that we didn't use cause it rained most of the time. No microwave or refrigerator but we took our own because my daughter likes her bottles warm at night. Our only complaint about this trip was the shuttle. Waste of money!! We had to wait 30-45 minutes then an additional 20 min

When checking in, however, was given a room on the 1st floor near an elevator and when tried to access the internet, could not get a signal at all :( Was told by the front desk that I would either need to come down to the lobby or sit out near the pool (at 10:30pm I should not have to do this). Since I was not able to access the  internet, I decided to lay down and watch tv instead. When I pulled back the top sheet and bedspread, I found several long hairs on top of the bottom sheet. No Tea / Coffee facilities no where to put clothes woken by people screaming in pool area, out of the way not a very pleasant experience we booked out same day we arrived at 3am and were woken up at 6am couldnt even get a cup of tea not what it looks like on website beware

let me start by saying i have always used this motel 6 in the past. this time was worse than bad. somehow my rooms i reserved got rented out some how. when they did finally find us a room it was so nasty filthy. stains on the bedding, bathroom door wouldnt shut, tv didnt work and on top of this we had bed bugs so bad we were eaten alive. i looked under the sheets and they were huge! the office mang wanted me to move in the next room that i rented so he could have terminex come out. i was mad that 9 people had to cram in to 1 room. i will never ever come back and now that we are home i think i brought a a peice of motel 6 with us BED BUGS!!!!!

Just wanted to write a review because Idon't want the chain getting bad reviews,  It Motel 6???  SO I booked this hotel for my daugher and friend both 22, to go to Disneyland, after huge arguements she agreeded to stay.  I was trying to get her a safe, clean hotel near by.  They came home and loved it, they have recently remodeled the hotel it was very clean and comfortable.  The pool area was nice.  They loved the "FREE" coffee cart every morning.   Shuttle picked them up for Disney (4.00 per person all day back and forth) she said they had great restaurants next door.  There both 22 in college and had a great time.  Just want to give the hotel a high five, if she liked it I'm sure it is worth a try.  The only issue we had was I booked it online and the second two nights we was

You always hear those people that say you get what you pay for, however just because you want a good deal by no means should it mean you should have a roach infested room. I went to Disneyland for my daughters 2nd bday and made the mistake of checking in after we were finished with the park. We got to the hotel about 830 and checked in easily enough.
