The employees were very friendly and amazing.  We got there late at 830pm and the room wasn't yet ready, which was surprising, but the man working was able to give us directions to go pick some food up for dinner.  It was me, my sister, and my son (it was his birthday, he just turned 7).  I had read reviews about how dirty the floor could be, so the entire time we wore socks and sure enough it did get really dirty....however the floors are wood so its hard to keep those dust free even if they are cleaned every day.  The room was great especially for the value.  The pillow case had a piece of gum and hair on it and the beds weren't fully made, but they came up and fixed it within 5 minutes.  We felt totally safe and the staff would be reason enough to go back.  The room did

I will admit I was really apprehensive booking this place after reading some of the reviews. However when you are on a budget, you have to make allowances.  From the time we arrived at Motel 6 I was trying to understand where some of the negative reviews came from. As everyone has different standards, here are some of the things I noted during our stay:  Positive Front desk staff were friendly (Antonio in particular) and informative. Rooms were clean though sparsely (think "Ikea") furnished.  We had a King room on the 4th floor (Room 472) as we asked to be placed at the end of the corridor to avoid external noise from people coming and going. Beds were comfortable and the pillows were exactly as I like them - not over stuffed. Our room had laminate floor coverings, which in my

Summary Heading: About what you would expect from a Motel 6
Summary: I stayed at this property for one night in Feb '11.  I was in Anaheim to see a concert and only needed a cheap place to crash and Motel 6 met my needs.  The rooms are spartanly furnished and look the way you might imagine a dorm room in Sweden to appear. The bed was comfortable and I got a good night's sleep.  The check in process was painfully slow even though there were 3 people at the desk and there was only a short line to register.

I took a quick trip to Disneyland in November 2010, with my three girls, ages 12, 2, and 1. Check in was quik and easy, not the friendliest, but not rude either! We had a room on the second floor on the back side of the building, which was quiet! The rooms have a clean modern look, which I loved, and the wood floors... so much better than dirty carpet! I have seen a couple people mention there are no "Do Not Disturb" signs, which there are not, but one quick phone call to the front desk you can request no maid service or dely it till a later time! I requested no maid service for our stay so I am unable to tell you if they do a good job or not... past exeriences at OTHER hotels have made me leary of anyone in my room without my presence! The beds were comfortable and clean,

We stayed at this hotel for our trip to disneyland for valentines day- the whole expierence was great. We got there way before check in, but they let us park our car their while we went to disneyland before we were even guests- then we were able to walk to disneyland (about a 10 minute, easy walk from the hotel) and not have to pay to park at disneyland. The guy at the front desk, Abel, was helpful and able to answer all my questions. The room was very large, wood floors, flat screen tv, very modern. We had no problem with noise from outside or other rooms. Check in and check out was easy, and they let us leave our car their again after checking out so we could go back to disneyland (which saved us $30 for parking their!). The only problem I had was their was no blowdryer or

The room was updated, But took off my shoes and my white socks were black!! Ukk..makes me wonder if they actually clean. No locks to the restroom and no fan! Not  good if you have a big family.  Beds were ok. Staff was friendly..ok for the price.

This location is great if you are willing to walk just under a mile to and from the park. Easy access from the freeway and pet friendly makes this property affordable and convenient . If walking is not for you ,there is a shuttle for a nomiale fee to and from the park. Disneyland has a kennel where you can board your animals daily- $20 each.The rooms have a new decor which does not lend to restroom privacy because of the all in one toilet, sink, shower set up but after being a loyal customer we still would not stay anywhere else. The staff is helpful and friendly.There is coffee in the morning and a small shop open various hours for drinks and sundries. Be sure to make reservations in advance, it fills up... it's Disneyland. Overall our family , pets too, love this property.

Summary Heading: Decent for the money you pay
Summary: A very basic motel and you get what you pay for. Check-in took some time even though my room was confirmed and I had the credit card with me, the persons whose name was on the card wasn't and they would not accept it, luckily I had another in my name. The rooms are all outdoor entry and the window looks out on the corridor so you have no privacy and might need to keep the curtain closed even during the day. The rooms appear spacious probably because there is little to no furnishings. As other reviwers have said they are 'IKEA minimal'. A woodgrain linoleum floor throughout. The bedroom has a bed, sidetable, and a standing table with two chairs. The rest of the room is barren. The bathroom has a couple of shelves and a sink counter; that;s it. Bathroom ammenities include two

Summary Heading: BEST IN THE WEST FOR SURE!!!
Summary: Arthur The Night Manager was EXTREMELY helpful for us to find the location of this Motel. Considering the Fact that we Came from out of town it did not matter How many times we called he was very attentive and sympathetic to out needs. When we entered the room it was extremely roomy and completely comfortable! They Gave us Places near by that would be able to bring us food at 3AM and was completely Helpful regarding anything else as far as extra towels or how to work the TV..By Far THE BEST experience we have ever had!

Summary Heading: Craphole 6 - you're better off sleeping on a bench at a park!
Summary: Upon arrival, we found there to be no carpet in the room. On the back side of our door there was some tagging. Yes, as in, graffitti tagging. Some one named "BiGGZ" had apparently stayed in our room. Mr. "BiGGZ" was kind enough to leave his signature on the wall by the mirror also. The towels had some very long black hairs in them (not mine or my blonde wife's, obviously) and the walls were so paper thin you could hear the person in the next room scratching their nose. The floors of the bathroom had very obvious black marks indicating it had not been cleaned with any sort of attention to detail in who knows how long. We felt dirty walking around there, BLEH! Summary Heading: Worst motel I've ever stayed in.
Summary: We arrived in late September to stay in a king size bed room for five nights and we're disappointed.  The pictures on the website were misleading.  The floor was filthy, there is no storage in the room, no tissues, no coffee maker, and no "do not disturb" sign.  What bothered us the most was the fact that nearly every bath towel we were provided had hair on them.  It was not our hair because we both have short hair and these were long hairs.  Housekeeping never made it to our room until 3:30pm at the earliest when my husband and I wanted to relax in the room.  The pool was small but nice as was the hot tub.  You can hear the noise on the freeway and we must have missed this on the website but they do allow dogs, which loved to bark.  The location was nice and it was only a 10-15

We stayed here one night during the labor day weekend.  We found the room was very basic.  We got a room with one king bed.  We noticed it was remodeled recently since the last time we were here.  It was a nice touch with a wood floor.  But the wood floor felt dirty and there was hair on the floor (not mine).  I would not walk barefoot in the room.  The tv was in the wall.  There was a small two level shelf to put your stuff or luggage on in the bathroom area.  There was a table attached to the wall with one chair and additional seating was attached to the wall.  The bed was ok, which creaked a lot when you move around.  The heating/ac unit was very noisy.  Bathroom had a granite counter with a raised wash basin.  It would have been nice to have a door between the sink area and

We stayed for 2 nights during our trip to Disneyland. Hotel was easy to find, its located on Disney Way which is literally 15 mins walk to Disneyland (we didn't take the ART shuttle in the end, but it is availble to take on route 16). Plenty of car parking available. Check in was quick and easy, staff efficient, room was much larger than we had expected! As we had stayed in San Diego Motel 6 beforehand, it was a small double room there, whereas this was a large 2 double bed room. Was clean enough, floors sometimes a bit dirty but only noticeable if you walk around barefoot. There;s a nice enough pool, although we didn;t have a chance to use it. We stayed at this motel with our two young children, as it was our first family vacation to Disneyland. Arriving at this Motel 6 was not a great start to our trip! I am a bit of a clean freak, but since I was well aware of the cheap price I was trying not to expect much. Walking in to check in, the lobby smelled, the people working in there and the guests were all kind of trashy looking.  Not a great start. The property was ok, except for by the pool/spa, it was very dirty and the people hanging out in the pool were using very foul language around my two small children. One guy kept walking around the place with his dog and he looked like he lived there. Summary Heading: don't make a reservation, they will overbook anyways
Summary: Finding online that this place looked really nice and redone, along with a low rate and close walking distance to Disneyland, we arrive and they tell us that they have overbooked and are sending us to the motel 6 in irvine, 15 minutes away. Luckily they paid for it, but not our second night. That is just ridiculous, they should have either a) paid for both nights to stay there or b) put us in a nicer place here in anaheim. I reserved that room well in advance and it's rather irritating that they tell me they don't have a room for me when I arrive. I work at a hotel myself, and the way they handled this situation was beyond terrible. Do not make reservations here.

This hotel was great for our purposes.  We weren't there long as we went to Disneyland and Angel game.  It was clean, beds comfortable and my 6 year old son enjoyed the pool.  Great location if doing anything in Anaheim.  We will stay there in the future

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: I recomend all disney fans! Close enough to walk to both parks, deffinetly not a normal motel 6.

Summary Heading: Unless you are destitute, DON'T DO IT
Summary: The first time we stayed here was atleast six years ago. It was a Red Roof Inn at that time. The rooms were clean, had carpet, and doors on the bathroom. Six years later made a big difference, it is now a Motel 6. The pool area is still clean and well kept. The rooms have no carpet and you can't walk barefooted because your feet end up looking like you hiked a mile on asphalt! The sheets were drab and didn't look like they had been washed. This place needs a some work. With a bit of work and a good scrubing it would be worth the price but we were not impressed with it now. The staff was most helpfull and seemed to be the one thing that keeps this place on a Disney's Neighbor Hotel List. If the place was given a facelife and a cleaning, it could well become as good as it was when

The toilet was so nasty, hair all in tub and face bowl. The water in the bath tub wouldn't run out. I called and they sent someone , I had to clean the bathrrom it took them so . I had them to mop the floors were dusty in my room and my sister's room. The shuttle service was great. Not a lot parking places.

Summary Heading: A Pleasant Surprise and a Great Value
Summary: I didn't want to stay at a Motel 6. My wife insisted on it because of the very affordable price. I have to admit it was a wonderful surprise. This is not your regular Motel 6. Rooms are good size with large plasma tvs on satelite. Micro and fridge in room on request. Large pool and hot spa. Free coffee, latte machine, hot chocolate and hot tea in the morning. Arcade for kids. Gift shop. Complimentary shampoo is unusual in budget motels. The Disneyland shuttle picks you up right at the motel front door. The service was excellent. The money I saved staying at this motel allowed me more money to spend on my kids on their vacation.

I got a great rate off of Orbitz for this motel during NAMM 2010. It's within walking distance of the convention center, or there is a shuttle. The room was "deluxe," meaning that it was extra large and we had a mini fridge and a microwave. Good enough for me! There is a pool and a hot tub, and everything is clean. Free coffee in the mornings and nice people at the front desk. Not luxe, obviously, but a totally decent place to stay.

Summary Heading: great location for disney But thats it nothing else around
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights had to change rooms due to noise from the pool area its a square around the pool so ask for a room facing outwards. Room is modern flat screen tv didn't find  the cleanliness issues of other reviews, 8 minute walk to both Disney parks or $4 for a all day shuttle pass. I would stay here again if i was visiting disney Staff were great Esp Sorona :-)

The Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate is a great hotel to stay at if you are on a budget. It is close to Disneyland but not right accross the street. It would be about a 15 walk but they do offer a Disneyland shuttle for a small fee. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. We were able to check in to our room about 5 hours earlier then check-in time. The room was clean. The beds are not the most comfortable but they provide a place to sleep after a long day at Disneyland. The room had a nice flat screen TV with cable and also the ability to hook up your own DVD player or game console. The hotel does not provide a hairdryer, iron, lotions, or soaps so remember to bring your own!  The furniture is updated and modern and the rooms are a nice size. There is no refrigerator in the

We went to the Motel 6, not expecting to stay at the Hilton, but to get a clean and safe place to sleep while going to DIsneyland.  The distance from the parks were pretty good.  The walk in the morning was ok and a good way to get your blood going, but the walk back at night was a bit tiring, but not too bad.  Overall, it was ok, except when it came to the cleanliness.  Now, I am not expecting the Hilton, but there were long black hairs on multiple towels, multiple nights which is disgusting.  When we used all the towels on the 1st night, I called down to have some more delivered and they made me to come down to the front desk to pick them up and when I got down there, they were out and had to deliver them to me any ways.  Then, on three different days, they did not clean our

I was worried about our stay here.  My cousin had stayed the month before though and reassured me their stay was fine.  I read the reviews and planned my packing list accordingly.  We brought a cooler for the room, this was a good idea, cold drinks, kept our food fresh and saved us money on eating out each meal.  Brought bathroom spray since reviews said no fan.  Another reviewer said you can "hear bathroom noises" when someone is using the toilet.  So when we had to do our "business" we just ran the tub that is next to it to drown out any "noise".  LOL  There are two double doors that lead into a spacious bathroom.  Bring a rubber band if you want to lock the doors, just wrap it around the knobs, or for petes sake just let them know you are using the bathroom and to keep out.

Summary Heading: Not The Motel 6 I'm Used To - A Nice Update!
Summary: We stayed here the day after Valentine's for a short getaway, since we were at Downtown Disney for dinner and drinks at Catal.  Being in my mid-20s, this motel had a refreshing updated look that I've never seen in any motel I've stayed.  Very modern and trendy looking, with a fairly sized wall-mounted flat-screen TV, modern towel rack, and rooms that didn't smell of smoke.  So the towels weren't plush and the sheets had low threadcount - we were there to get some rest after a night out.  Mission accomplished... I'd stay again.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...not a lot!
Summary: I wish I could say this place was great.  I actually wish I could say the quality was constant.  I actually wish I could say it was something more than eye candy.  It is not.   The Good: --------- The motel has Widescreen LCD HD TVs (although no HD content/stations) MOUNTED to the wall in front of the bed at a height of around 4 1/2 feet.  They have a TV connection panel with 5 different types of connections for iPod video input, computer input, HDMI and movie cameras.  The weird thing?  No place to put the video source.  No shelf, desk, table or anything near the TV set.   They have many good TV channels (that all come in clearly -- no static) and default to the Weather Channel which is nice in that they think the weather at a resort is important enough to tell you how to plan

Then they were insisting on giving us a smoking room (I smoke outside only, my husband doesn't), so I had to repeatedly tell them it doesn't matter what kind of room. Finally found us a room, we get in there and there's NO dresser or anyplace to put your clothes! Luckily there was 2 beds, so we put our clothes on that. Summary Heading: Great Value, Decent Location, Would Stay Again
Summary: My boyfriend and I (ages - 23 and 25) stayed at this Motel for 7 nights during our trip to Anaheim.  We were able to check into our room (1 King Bed) after the front desk put a rush on our room to be cleaned (we had arrived earlier than the 3 pm check in).  We were able to put our luggage into a storage room while we ventured to the nearest 7-11 (gift shop in motel is closed during the afternoon) about a 5 minute walk away.  The room was clean and of course sparse - nothing that we didn't expect.  It was quite spacious.  It was disappointing to find that the bathroom doors would not close perfectly and of course were lacking the locking capacity.  We found the motel very quiet and had no noise complaints during our stay.  We were able to get extra towels from the front desk.  We

Just back from a 4 night stay...the internet rate averaged $43/night.  My room was huge and overlooked the pool.  It was quiet.  The room was very clean (including the floor) and smelled fresh.  There were even packets of shampoo!!  (i stay at a lot of M6's and was shocked and beyond amazed to find those packets.)  The bed (king size) was very comfortable and I slept well.  There were a lot of TV channels available.  There is a small mini-mart in the lobby which sells drinks, snacks and souvenirs.  There is also a vending machine area.    The woman who checked me in was very friendly and efficient. Summary Heading: Don't waste your money unless you like dirty rooms
Summary: We stayed here for 6 days.  The floors which are linoleum were filthy dirty,  the sheets and top blanket were dirty we had them changed the first night.  we complained about the dirty floors nothing was done, I bought new slippers which I had to throw out before we left they were so filthy form the floors.  The noice is awful, they let anyone and everyone scream and run in and out slamming doors at all hours of the night, we got no sleep, after we complained they cleared the drunks out of the pool around 11:00 pm.  The lobby should have been a good indication it was filthy dirty.  The manager hid, when we asked to talk with him he would hide behind the desk in an office.  We stayed here in 2008 and it was great, beautiful clean rooms, quiet, not any more, will never stay here

Summary Heading: PAY A LITTLE LESS, RECEIVE ALOT WORSE
Summary: For starters the hotel is in a corner off the highway about a mile away from any restaurants and about a mile and a half away from disney, No walking distance when traveling with kids. The hotel room has no ventilation  and doors that will NOT lock in the restroom. The beds are hard and the pillows are non existant, very low. I asked for more towels and pillows, but every day they seem to run out. I was there for five nights. Upon arrival there was hair all over the tub and sheets of the bed. The hard wood floor were sticky and the room  had a strange odor. The room also has no privacy. I could hear the conversations of my neighbors and everyone walking outside my room. Summary: Had no problems booking my reservation online. Got to the motel at 7:30am got to check in early which was great. Got everything in my room and left for the park. Great walking distance not right across where there is so much traffic but not far from Disneyland. Got back to the room at 8:30pm. Took a shower and notice a open bar of soap in the shower. Went to get into bed and noticed stains and someone elses hair in the bed. Summary: First of all, we thought it was "across" from the Maingate to Disneyland.  Not so.  You must walk a bit of a distance and at night it is dark along one side of your walk.  However, you can park at Disney for $13 or use a shuttle for $4 all day pass.  We called our room the Ikea special.  No carpet which is great.  Very sparce with furnishings, but clean.  Great flushing toilets/hot water!  Odd bathroom arrangement-no separate shower/toilet w/a door.  No kleenex, shampoo, fridge, microwave or coffee.  Nice pool and landscaping. Summary Heading: Good value & modern look but lacks useful amenities
Summary: Service: I didn't interact with the staff so much but the little that I did, I would rate it as just okay. They weren't rude and they didn't go above and beyond to make us feel welcomed.  Location: I would say it's close enough to walk to the parks but you can also take a trolley if you like. The trolley stops right at the hotel.  The Room:  Good- This place has totally redesigned all their rooms to look ultra modern. I really liked the new look. The room was very clean. It had a flat panel tv hung up on the wall. You could hear someone going to the bathroom. The sink is in the bathroom and it has a

Room was CLEAN and pleasant, love the new decor- have stayed before so was aware I had to bring everything from shampoo to own coffeepot, keep this in mind if you stay here, the lobby coffee is awful- bring your own if you can! Bring shampoo , blow dryer and everything else too, you just get a couple towels and some soap from the motel. Bring your own pillow if you can, theirs are flat. For  only $50 a night, I thought it was great, clean, nice people at the desk.

Summary Heading: Okay, but probably wouldn't stay there again.
Summary: When planning our 5 day trip to Disneyland, we decided to stay at the Motel 6. I had read mixed reviews on it, and figured we'd give it a shot. I will say that it is miles ahead of any other Motel 6 I have personally ever stayed at. The decor was, at first glance, very nice, new and modern. There was a flat screen TV. There was a little table with a chair and a weird corner couch thing. I've read reviews putting down the furniture and decor by saying it was "IKEA-ish". Yes, it was IKEA-ish...but have you ever been to another Motel 6? Normally it just looks like a crappy hotel room. Trust me, IKEA-ish is a GOOD thing when it comes to motels!   Anywho...  The floor was a wood-type laminate, which is much better than "don't walk barefoot" carpet. The floor was kind of sticky, but I

It's not their fault, its managements fault and they should put up signs. Room furniture is new and basic but locks on bathroom doors would be comforting. If your used to 3 stars or more, don't stay here.

Stayed here for 3 nights for a family trip to Disneyland. This motel is near the I-5 freeway and off/on ramps, but this wasn't an issue. Even though our room faced the freeway, noise wasn't a problem [with room fan on low and/or earplugs that all travelers should have] Fireworks are viewable from the freeway-side rooms. I would estimate it is 3/4 mile from motel to the Disneyland front gate if you're willing to get a little exercise. The walk back late at night seemed safe. The fairly spacious room has been refurbished with hardwood floor and flat screen TV. There were no cleanliness or check-in issues. This hotel appears to be on water restriction. We could not fill the tub to give our kids a bath unless we wanted to wait hours, though the shower worked ok. We did not use the

Summary Heading: The WORST hotel in the area
Summary: We stayed at the Motel 6 in Anaheim because we had a pet and were looking for a good deal .  We had multiple issues with this facility which ultimately left us very aggrevated because there was no resolve.  These were just a few of our issues, we had more but you should get the idea from this briefing.  In fairness, the room was nicely furnished in a more modern style.  The bed was comfortable as well.  1.  Incompetent staff- the staff we dealt with clearly  have never heard of the term customer service  2.  Our bathtub was filthy, there were footprints, handprints and hair in the tub and on the shower wall. Rude, and unprofessional.

Summary Heading: Poisoned my family with bad water from ice machine, missed half our vacation
Summary: Avoid this place like the plague. This is supposed to be a Disney Good Neighbor Motel, but I think DIsney must pass out those honors to anyone. Customer service is awful -- both on site and at corporate --  and if you are thinking of staying here while taking the family to Disney, please, pretty please, spend a few extra bucks and stay somewhere else. I read in other reviews that the hotel was being renovated so I did not  hesistate to book wanting to stay in a new room. Rooms are great with a large flat screen TV. The design can be best described as IKEAish. Very modern looking but economical. They have no carpeting but bamboo floors. Also the beds are on a wood platforms which was very tasteful but the mattresses could have been a bit firmer for my tast. They have no closets or drawers but have shelfs and what you can describe as a blace to hand your clothes. I didn't realize that this place was only 1 star which would explain the lack of a hair dryer but it wasn't a deal breaker. Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disney at a budget price
Summary: I stayed in room 370 in the main building wich seems to have been recently updated. And it was surprisingly modern for a Motel6. The room was huge with a single queen bed !! Situated just off the I-5 and at a walking distance from Disney Resort, California Adventures, Downtown Disney and AnaheimGate, it's the perfect budget stay.

Summary Heading: Its showing its Age, but its the best deal in town still
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel at least 6 different times over the last 7 years dating back to when it was the Red Roof inn. Its getting close to its expiry date as a budget hotel, but thankfully they are in the process of starting renovations as we speak, the main building which encompasses the lobby is being done. I paid $51 week night and $64 week end rate with about 2 months notice advance booking on line. My room had a small cold fridge and an almost usless sized microwave ( maybe .3 cf).  The rooms are definately showing their age. My carpet was just on the bareable side of my limit. A few stains and I didnt want to walk on it in sock feet. A steam cleaner would need to work miracles on the rug. The beds are getting to their  last legs, starting to sag and curve. One to many

The Anaheim shuttle brought our teens back and forth safely and cheaply, and on their own. Summary Heading: Good price, normal rooms.  Close to Disneyland !!!
Summary: I have three kids all under ten.  I was traveling on a budget and knew I was not going to spend a lot of time in the room.  I couldn't decide where to stay by Disneyland because we bought three day park hopper tickets and didn't want to drive in traffic and pay for parking everyday.  I had laminate hardwood floors in the room that made it nice for clean up and didn't have to worry about dirty carpets.  I always travel with flip flops any way, my feet don't touch that floor.  We had a basic room two beds, tv, desk, and bath.  The plus was the fridge and microwave in the room.  Not all rooms have a fridge though, it is based on availability.  Cons are the motel is remodeling so construction started around 8 or 9 am and no breakfast.  I left the room at 9am and came back at 11pm.
The room was disgusting. It smelled like feet and the receptionist was very rude.

Summary Heading: Second stay was not worth the effort
Summary: This is the second time I've stayed here on vacation.  The first time around it was great, was on vacation with my sister, had a great room, staff was great and really enjoyed the stay.  Second time was not the same, our room was dirtier the whole time and the staff were unhelpful. Summary Heading: we got what we paid for
Summary: We are a couple who were travelling  without children on a two-week trip through California in July 2008, and stopping in Anaheim for 6 nights.  Three days were spent in Disneyland, with other day trips to San Diego, Hollywood, etc. This hotel was not good.  Although, in fairness, it was the cheapest hotel in Anaheim and we wanted a deal.  However, it still cost $100 a night, and with that we should be able to expect that we would have a bed with clean sheets.  When we arrived to our room, it hadn't been properly cleaned. The sheets were dirty and gross. The bathroom was not cleaned either.   The rooms were spacious. It was a bit noisy because there is an outdoor pool.  This may be suitable for large families that are on a tight budget -bring your own sheets and cleaning

Stayed here for one night for a free Motel 6 stay while at Disneyland.  Convenient location - is a stop on the Anaheim Resort Transit which takes you to and from Disneyland for I think $2.  Very nice room and had no issues!!

I stayed here with my family (4 adults) on our trip to Disneyland.  When I arrived, the woman at the front desk was very amiable and funny. We had made reservations earlier and everything went fine. When we arrived at our room, everything was very basic. Two queen size beds, a nice size TV, clean room. The carpet was a little wet, it seemed like it had just gotten steamed though. We only spent 2 nights there and never had a single problem. A lot of people seem to complain about this motel, but it's just that...a motel. It's very basic, this obviously isn't the Disney Hotel. It's a modest little motel with great costumer service and nice, decent rooms. There are definitely no complaints from me. A great place to sleep for a cheap price. I would definitely stay here again.

We booked this hotel a few months in advance and decided on it because we had stayed there before when it was the Red Roof Inn. We arrived really late thinking that our room with 2 beds was guaranteed. When my husband went to check in they told him they only had 3 rooms available and only 1 had 2 beds and it would end up costing us more. Well we needed 2 beds so we ended up having to pay more, no big deal. Our first morning, I asked my husband to go to the office to ask some questions. He overheard the guests in front of him complaining that someone just walked into their room and were wondering if the keys worked on other rooms. Then the next morning as we were getting ready some guy was trying to get into our room. When we opened the door he was surprised and walked away.

This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in.  Sewer water bubbled out of the sink and feces dropped from the faucet in the tub.  Absolutely disgusting place to stay.  Wouldn't stay there again if it was free.

Summary Heading: First Half Good Second Half Questionable
Summary: We reserved the motel in advance because they accept dogs and it was a hasel and expensive at other hotels. We arrived an hour early which was no problem. The staff was great.  Our room was in the courtyard by the pool. It was very spacious, a little dated, but large. The carpet had seen better days. It had stains, but we always use flip flops while in hotels. Everything in the room worked fine. The TV was pretty large for a hotel. We knew that there was construction going on at the hotel, they were updating the rooms. The crew started at 8 AM each morning and was rather loud, but it was like our wake up call. We had a three day pass to Disneyland. We walked to and from Disneyland each day. The distance was perfect. On the morning of our third day we were asked if we would agree

Summary Heading: Cheap but some shortcomings & wireless internet does not work
Summary: Was in Anaheim for a conference at the Marriott / Hilton in August and saved more than 60% by staying at this motel. The best thing of this motel is obviously the price. For the rest, my main comments about are the following; 1) Rooms are adequate but bed, chair, and floor could have been cleaned better. 2) Staff was reasonably friendly.  3) There are a number of other cheap motels in Anaheim which are more centrally located. 4) An important problem for me was that the wireless internet network of the motel was not working properly during my entire stay of 6 nights even though I complained about this several times.

Summary Heading: Not what we expected for a Disney Hotel
Summary: Not very clean....Carpets very gross.    Beds wern't made to a motel standard.   looked like someone slept there before us. the motel workers kept taking all the ice from machines and filling up ice chests leaving none for the guests.   Wouldn't reccommend and won't stay there again. IDAHO

My wife and I decided on the spur of the moment to drive to Disneyland from Northern California. We stayed one night.   Stayed in a remodelled room.  It was spacious with a laminate flooring, a small TV, a desk suitable for  business travellors and quiet.  It was okay but NO extras and the beds were a little older and the towels a little thin.   The hotel has some arcade games and a pool which I didn't use.   It is a stop on the Anaheim Resort Transit. which is great.  There are many hotels in Anaheim, I would recommend spending just a few more dollars to stay at a nicer place.

I would never stay here again! Though I have to give the Manager a pat on the back for getting us a refridgerator for my medicine, and the staff was very friendly, that was the only good thing. We did arrive early, like maybe 2 hours ahead of check-in, but due to the full house the night before, they were not allowing early check-in.  Not too big a deal, but would have been nice.  We got a room in the main bldg., on the 4th floor.  Our first impression upon walking in was okay.  My husband was leery due to the fact he stayed at a scummy Motel 6 on a work trip the week before. We booked thru the Disney Travel Company & knew that Motel 6 would be very basic.  No extras (hairdryers, continental breakfast, etc). Our room had just been remodeled.....was a little shocked when we entered our room & there wasn't any carpeting.  They had removed the carpets & put in hardwood flooring (of some sort).  It was actually nice looking & made the room look cleaner & bigger.  We had 3 adults & 2 children with 2 queen beds.  (we brought along a toddler sized blow-up bed) & it worked just fine. We depended on wake up calls every morning & had no problems with them.....right on time every day.  We never made it to the pool but it looked like people were really enjoying it.

Summary Heading: Very basic but just fine for a clean place to sleep!
Summary: Booked through Disney Travel, saved a TON of money. Don't forget your hairdryer, like I did. They really have no extras, but it's a clean, safe place to sleep in between partying at Disneyland. They let us check in early which really helped us!  If you're wanting your hotel experience to be something special, go somewhere else. If, like us, you just need a place to sleep close to the park, BOOK THIS HOTEL.

My family and I recently stayed at Motel 6 from March 3-14th, 2008  We booked through the Disney site and got a bunch of little extra goodies which was nice.  This is what we thought.  Check in:  We got there early and check in was not a problem, there was a room available right away which was a blessing since we got in a 9am.  Consider that it wasn't prime time, so they had extra space available, don't expect this if you go during the busy seasons.  The room did NOT smell at all, the sheets were clean, the towels were fine, absolutely no mildew in the bathroom, everything flushed properly, the water pressure was not horrible.  It was good.  After reading some of the reviews, i was really worried that we would be sleeping standing up, but that wasn't the case at all.  We had a

I wasn't impressed or unimpressed with the place.  We needed a place just to sleep in and store our stuff, basically, and that is what we got with the Motel 6.    We booked the motel through Disneyland.com and enjoyed the travel package and ease that the site provided in booking our stay.  For being a Disneyland "Good Neighbor" Motel, however, I was surprised to find it so off the beaten path.  I thought it would be right across the street. Instead, it was a good 1/2 mile walk to the park.  It wasn't bad; we actually kind've enjoyed it.  Walking there takes approx 18 minutes to get to the front gate.    The main plus about the motel is that they let us check-in early.  We got there early in the morning and wanted to get to Disneyland so it was nice just to check-in and get going

Summary Heading: A disgusting cesspool is the Motel 6.
Summary: After reading all the reviews here on Tripadvisor about the Motel 6 Anaheim Maingate, I knew what to expect when I arrived. Basic standard room, no frills, no extras- but a clean place to stay at a decent price with a pet. WRONG!  There are so many reasons why you should BEWARE of this motel. First off pulling up to the motel, its in dire need of a paint job on the outside. As I checked in (with a pet, which I reminded the employee) they asked me for a credit card. I thought it was just procedure, I didn't know I was paying up front as he just ran my card and didn't say what for. I thought this odd, and I didn't get to tell him about my AAA card since he rushed me--- and then he gave me a map and my keys and pointed me in the direction of my hotel room.   As we pulled to the
We stayed there four nights for our trip to Disneyland. The room was clean, large and very basic. We did not have any problems while staying here and I would stay here again.

the first room we were given had dirty sheets and the refig and microwave did not work. the second room had a dripping sink and the fan in the bathroom didn't work,but we decided to live with it. then they put some people in the room next to us that had a little dog, which the left in there alone, so it barked a lot at night. we complained but got no help. if it would have been any worse we would have left.

We stayed here for a trip to Legoland and Disneyland with  our kids (10 & 8).  We had a room on the bottom floor, facing the pool.  We chose this hotel because of the price, location, and because it had a hot tub/pool and a fridge/micro in the room.    It was two long blocks walk to the Disneyland main gate (which is then another long block to the actual entrance).  We discovered that we could walk to the park in the AM, come back to the hotel in the late afternoon, then park at Downtown Disney for free after 6pm, and take the monorail into the park from there.  This worked out very well.  We ate well in our room, enjoyed the laundry and pool facilities.  It was about an hour from Legoland, but we opted to stay here rather than schlep all of our stuff around southern California.

2 adults & 3 kids visiting Disneyland over Thanksgiving vacation.  .....Good: * Clean, comfortable rooms * Friendly & helpful staff * Plenty of towels * Very close to Disneyland (walking distance) * Shuttle from parking lot to / from Disneyland (every 20 minutes, $3 per day, per person - slightly cheaper if you purchase multi-day pass) * Quiet (however, adjoining room may have been unoccupied as cleaning crew's conversation was audible) * Small fridge & microwave available for just a few $ more * Built in hair-dryer  .....Bad (more like irksome): * Wireless internet service free to TMobile Hot Spot subscribers, must purchase connection time from TMobile otherwise * Fridge was not plugged in when we arrived - I didn't notice until the next day because the cord was tucked behind

Just a short walk to Disneyland.  The location was great, the room was okay. It was just me and my husband, they gave us a room with 2 beds.  I didn't mind. When I checked in the hotel employee made it a point to tell me to make sure to call this 800 number on my paperwork  so that she would get a good review on her customer service skills. Most of time checking in was listening to the employees talk about another employees bad behavior.    The bathroom was clean, except there was no toilet paper.  Thank goodness I carry tissue in my bag at all times.    Great deal when you go to Disneyland, because they have a shuttle every 20 minutes, just remember the shuttle drivers take lunch breaks.    Overall the room was clean and comfortable. I Didn't even turn on the tv.    Thanks.

the room was clean and big. the only thing i did not like was that there is no coffee maker in the room. but they have a great coffee shope in the lobby. we stayed on the 3rd floor and they did have an elevator so u didnt have to walk the stairs. wich was great after a long day @ disneyland! kids loved the swimming pool and we enjoyed the hot tub we are going to be staying there again.

My husband and I wanted to book a fairly inexpensive hotel close to Disneyland.  The location was great, just a short 10 minute walk up the road right to the entrance.    However our first impression of the room was when we opened the door: the smell was so foul that it was nearly unbearable.  Stuffy, moist and mildew-smelling air made us anxious to get out again and go play.  The carpet was filthy, with huge dark stains everywhere.  We did some hotel hunting, but found everywhere booked, so tried to make the best of it.  I immediately filled out a comment card advising of the smell and requesting an air freshener of some kind.  We kept the window open and the A/C running.  I left the comment card on the table (while the comment card advised to leave it in the room or give it to

Once I saw the great reviews of Motel 6 'maingate' here on TripAdvisor, I knew where I would be staying!  Motel 6 was clean, comfortable, and only TWO BLOCKS from Disneyland!   The staff was friendly and professional.   Our room had 2 comfortable queen beds, well-working mini fridge, microwave, and tv with cable.   There are some reports on TripAdvisor about this particular Motel 6 not having good water pressure in the shower. In our room, the water pressure couldn't have been better! The shower, sink and toilet worked just fine.  Being only two blocks from Disneyland, we would have walked there every day, but I had lots of things to carry to Disneyland, so we took ART.  The ART stop is right outside the front doors of Motel 6, and day passes for ART are sold sold at the front

Stayed in Motel 6 Anaheim maingate for three nights (the week before the 4th of July holiday). We booked two rooms, side by side. I stayed with a small 4-year old boy.   It is a very good hotel for the price (about $60 per night) - the rooms are quite large and fairly clean (although I tend not to walk barefoot on hotel carpets, in general.) At least there was no mold in the bathtub. I thought it is about one of the better Motel 6 out there.  Not surprisingly, the motel was completely full, so sometimes we needed to park a bit further, no big deal. Noisewise, it was not too bad, considering that it was high season and there will be lots of families leaving early to go to disney. Besides, we are all deep sleepers and were completely exhausted after a full day at the parks.  No

This motel 6 was located in a great place for visiting Disneyland. It is less than a mile walk or you can take the shuttle as we did. The price is comparable to other surrounding hotels during the weekdays.. We were going to entend our stay through the weekend but the price jumped up to $80 ... it is too basic of a hotel to pay that much. We ended up switching hotels because for $80 a night, many of the other nearby hotels offer a continental breakfast, whereas Motel 6 offers only coffee.  Due to its location and ease of Disneyland transportation, we would stay there again.

Needed a place to stay for four days with my wife and two children while doing Disneyland. We enjoyed the clean, cool room and queen beds. This was formerly a Red Roof Inn and the recent renovation to a Motel 6 was apparent in our room. The paint, carpet, fixtures, and bathroom were all very clean and showed little wear. AC was cold and at night we had to turn it off because the weather outside was mild making the room frosty. It is within walking distance, but take the ART to save your little kids a sleepy walk back to the room. Children 9 and under ride for free. One note about the ART, wait outside the lobby or they will drive off without you. Tickets available in the lobby for those 10 and older at $3 a day.          Ice machines on every floor. Staff was very busy but very

Summary Heading: Great place, but  be cautious of strangers!
Summary: Our family of four stayed in this Motel 6 for four nights.  The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful.  After receiving our room keys (actually magnetic cards), we went out to our rental car to retrieve our luggage.  Some guys exited the car next to ours and asked us if we had any 'gas money'.  As if we were going to fall for that!  We politely answered no, but felt somewhat concerned for our safety after that and promptly moved our car to a different location in the parking lot.  I think these two guys were actually looking for drug money and decided to prey on tourists.  Luckily we did not become victims.  The room was on the 3rd floor facing the pool.  The room was very clean and well maintained.  We did run the fan overnight to mask the pool activity noise, although it

Checked in late on a Wed night, excited for our following day at Disneyland. Right before tucking our twins in bed I pulled back the sheets and to my horror found a huge pee stain. In my disbelief I  bent down and sniffed just to make sure it was not just a stain, but was the real thing. The sheets were not changed from the previous guests. After further inspection, I noticed quite  a few hairs as well. The asst manager Eric was extremely nice and apologetic and promptly moved us to another room. He said to check out the new room and notify if we needed anything. To our utter amazement the, with the sheets once again pulled back, there was another stain! This time a little smaller and stinkier, and yes I stuck my face in it one more time to make sure it was not my imagination.

We just returned from a trip to Disneyland and stayed at Motel 6 Anaheim ( Formerly Red Roof Inn).  The motel provided basic accomadations that were clean and the staff were quite friendly. The location from Disneyland is within an easy walking distance of about 10 minutes. If you so choose the Shuttle picks you up right outside the front door every 20 minutes. The Plus here is that there is only one stop before Disneyland.  They also have a basic pool and hot tub in the centre courtyard which is also clean and great for relaxing after wearing yourself out at the tourist atractions. The only issue is that the motel does not have a restaurant so you need to look elsewhere for breakfast  before heading to the park.  Final words...Great Value...allows you to spend money enjoying

I was really surprized how much I liked this Motel 6.  The location and price were excellant.  The room was spacious and very clean.  The front desk staff (particularly Eric)  was nicer and more helpful than many 5 star hotels that I have stayed at.  I was also quite pleased with the gift shop located in the lobby.  They had everything I was looking for.  I will definately stay here again.  The only thing I would ask to be different is the same problem I have with all budget stays - the towels are just too small.  I would gladly pay a couple of bucks a night more if the towels could be actual bath towels instead of large hand towels.  Note to self - bring your own towel.

Terrific hotel at a terrific price.  The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Disneyland.  If you don't want to do the walk then they offer a shuttle for about $3/day.  The rooms are newly renovated and very clean.  The rooms also have a microwave and refrigerator which is a plus.  The pool and grounds were well maintained.  We have been motel 6 goers for the last few years and this is our favorite hotel so far. By the way you can get wireless internet via some of the nearby hotels.  They sell disney tickets in the lobby and even have a small gift shop.  Parking is ample and we got a room rate for $59 plus tax.  Coffee is free and available in the lobby.  The only downside is other families being noisy as they leave to go to Disney (as early as 7a).  We would stay again!

Just returned from a four night stay 3/19-3/22 with hubby and our two daughters ages 11 and 18.  Perfect location and easy access to ART shuttle which makes a Disneyland run every 20 minutes.  (Bought passes at front desk) Payed a little extra for fridge/microwave combo which was well worth it.  We'd have a big breakfast, go to the parks, come back and eat our hearty sandwiches at lunchtime in the nice air conditioning. We will DEFINITELY be staying her for future Disney trips.  Room conditions not perfect carpetwise, but it worked for us.  We loved the great big showerhead.  Great deal for families on a budget willing to plan out meals.  Laundromat on site with little boxes of Tide and dryer sheets for sale ($1).  Washers/Dryers about $1.25/load.

The first two times I went, my friends and I called in through the 800 number (it was red roof inn).  For 60 bucks a night, it was a good price, considering I went there for Disneyland.  We came to sleep and recharge our batteries.  It's clean and comfortable.  Though, I was checked in by a rude clerk the first time around.  The next stays I was checked in by clerks with various degrees of enthusiasm.  One was very helpful and nice, and it goes downhill from there.  So, if you are going for a convention or for Disneyland, its a great place to stay cheap, clean, consistent, and close, the downside is you don't know what clerk you'll get!!!

Summary Heading: Great deal for the price and DL area
Summary: We just returned from a 4 day stay.  This was excellent for the price $55.00.  I went on Motel 6 site to book it and all they listed were smoking rooms.  So I called them and they told me to book the smoking rooms at the internet price, call back and they would switch us to "Business Kings" NS-King beds.  We requested quite rooms since it is next to the interstate. The staff were very accommodating and put us on the 3rd floor pool side and it was quite.  There is a local Trolley that stops at the front door and is very convenient for $3.00 a day per person.  $11.00 to park at DL and we had to walk further to the DL Tram than where the trolley dropped us at DL.  We wanted a quick trip to DL and this Motel 6 was very clean and close to DL.  We had booked two rooms at the Alamo,

We just returned from a quick getaway to Disneyland, and could not have been happier with our stay here!  We've never brought our dog on vacation with us, but figured it was time to give it a try! I know when you think of Motel 6, the cheapest of the cheap comes to mind, but this property (which until very recently was a Red Roof Inn) was very pleasant surprise.  We found the grounds to be immaculate (plenty of potty spots, and the adjacent Residence Inn has posts with clean up bags), and our room large, comfortable, and clean (there were a few spots here and there on the carpet, but my carpet at home has some too...ha ha!).  I usually book through discount websites, but I found a great rate for a King size bed and micro-fridge combo on the Motel 6 website.  Spend the extra few

Summary Heading: Great Place! Cant Beat The Price!!!
Summary: We stayed here from October 11th to October 14th. Our stay was great. The Staff was very polite and helpful. They let us check in early 9 am which most hotels do not allow. They were out of there deluxe rooms so we had to get a smoking room so I was a bit spectacle but it turned out just fine. The room was clean. It did have a bit of smell because it was a smoking room but it was very tolerable! We did spray the room with air freshener and left the window open the day of arrival while we were at Disneyland and that did the trick.  The beds were so comfortable! There sheets and pillows appeared to be new! The carpet was clean. The bathtub was very clean and white =) .  There water pressure was a bit low. Walls did not appear to be thin. We didn't have any problems with the other

This is a hidden gem.  The local shuttle ($3 per day per adult, free for children) comes RIGHT to the front of the hotel.  They don't have free breakfast, but do have hot chocolate and coffee, which my kids LOVED after a chilly evening at Disney. The rooms were very clean, the staff was polite, the only weird thing was the shower, it was similar to a locker room shower, no tub or enclosure, but it worked, the water was warm, and we got clean!  We will definitely stay here for our next Disney trip

Summary Heading: Average hotel, Great location and price!
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Red Roof Inn on July 3rd and 4th in order to 'do' Disney. I booked it mainly due to price, but also referred to the reviews on this site. I figured we'd get what we paid for. The place was fairly average, I suppose it was exactly what we expected. I didn't think it would be as easy to get to Disney as it was. I was incredibly easy. It cost us $6 for a two day pass on the ART and we got it just outside the Red Roof Inn. As there are only four hotels on this ART route, it was never too busy. At the end of the day we were hardly in the hotel at all so the room itself (which was absolutely fine!) wasn't all that important. The best thing was that it was so easy to get to Disney and back....which of course was why we were there!! (Disney was within

Summary Heading: Good enough for our Disney vacation
Summary: The Red Roof Inn Anaheim Maingate was an ideal hotel for our trip to Disneyland.  Though the amenities are somewhat sparse, the cleanliness and location are most adequate.  Note that there is no continental breakfast nor in-room microwave or fridge.  Also, there is no near-by fast-food breakfast.  There is a single microwave at the coffee station in the lobby.  By the way,  the multi-coffee station (it automatically serves up regular, decaf, cappuccino, latte, flavored coffees, etc.) was a big hit with everyone in our family.  The ice machine on our floor worked very well.  The room was clean and quite functional for a family.  Everything was in good working order.  The hotel is not within a reasonable walking distance of Disneyland.  No one walks from the hotel.  The Anaheim

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for the Budget Minded
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here while attendinga dance competition held at the Disney Land Resort.  The rooms at the Disney resort were atleast $200, this hotel was $76 before taxes and fees.    For those of you on a budget,  I would definitely recommend this hotel.    We stayed in a delux double queen room that included a fridge, microwave, table and desk.   The room had recently been re-modled and fitted with new and improved bedding.   It was plenty big for the two of us, and probably would be for 4.  The TV had plenty of channels including Cartoon Network and Disney Channel for my daughter.   Most of the other guest here at the hotel appeared to be budget minded families.    The fridge and the Mircrowave allowed us to save on food expenses as we went to the Food 4 Less a few

Summary Heading: On a budget? Choose another Hotel
Summary: OK, I understand that alot of travelers are looking for the best hotel for an inexpensive price.  Unfortunately, The Red Roof Inn at the Maingate (Anaheim), is not in that category.  My friend, my son, and I stayed there for three nights and we will never stay there again.  First, this hotel is in need of repair.  The outside stairs on the south end of the property are rotting, the building itself is in need of a paint job, and there is an 'air quality' issue in the lobby due to the fact that the public bathrooms are just around the corner or the ventilation system needs repair.  The rooms (or at least the room we stayed in) are below average.  There are a few rooms that have been upgraded but, NOT all of the rooms.  The layout is bad.  Non-smoking rooms are right next to most

Summary Heading: The worst motel we've stayed in the US
Summary: We took a trip to the US for about two weeks, and this motel was the worst out of all.    First, the sound-proof qualtiy is low.   Second, the receptionist had my name said wrong, i corrected her and she did not seem to care about it at all. VERY RUDE!!   Third, the location was not easy to find.   Fourth, although the price was low, I don't recommend anybody to stay here.    SURE there are far better hotels to stay while having fun at Disney, right?

Summary Heading: Very much enjoyed our stay here....
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here in early April.  My kids are 2 and 4 and they enjoyed the pool, and I loved how clean it was.  Catching the ART shuttle was easy and nice after three long days in the park with a trip back for resting in the afternoon.  I found the staff to be friendly and helpful.  A breakfast service would be nice, but we paid the $5 extra a day for the fridge in the room and went and got yogurt and fruit for our breakfast so it worked out for us this way.  Used the laundry facility after a day of rain at the park and it was clean, dryers took a little long, but it was loaded with jeans so no big deal.  Would stay here again!!

I am a single mom with two teenagers, and it took us a while until we could afford our first vacation to Disneyland, and we let DisneyTravel Book this hotel for us.  I could not have been happier.  The staff was patient and helpful, the rooms clean, and atmosphere was genuine and it was close to everything.  I would certainly stay again.  Only changes...better water pressure in the shower and maybe get a little shuttle for two and from the park.  (But the local bus line was more that adequate).  Will recommend to my freinds on a budget...

This is a great hotel that is near everything.  The staff provides immediate attention to all your needs.  I used to stay in another Red Roof Inn for vacations but this is my spot of choice now.  Staff is very friendly and caring.  They are very honest with their billing practices.  Great pool for kids and you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the third floor!

We stayed at the RR 4 years ago, and were not disappointed this time either. Upon checking in we were given a choice as to what floor we would like and found our room to be exactly as we expected it to be....clean and quite adequate. Our reservations were booked through the internet and included tickets for the Anaheim Trolley. All went well and as expected. The RR was very busy as it was Christmas but it was quiet in our room. One down side is that there is no choice of restaurants within easy walking distance, and there is no continental breakfast offered. We knew this from before and it was not an issue to us. There are plenty of order in menus available. We would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

We stayed in the Red Roof in 2003 and found it to be an acceptable hotel, so we decided to return on our trip at the beginning of December.  The rooms definitely seem to have had an upgrade and our first impression is we were in for a nicer stay than before.  This was before coming back from our first day at the park to discover the maid had stolen my fiancee's pain medication.  Our first attempt at resolution the night we found the theft was ignored. The next morning when I reported it to the desk clerk, they said we would have to delay our trip to the park and wait for the manager and maid to show up. They would not take my cel for a message. After getting Disney involved, I was able to goto the park and await a response.  The response basically stated the maid said she didn't

I had expected to have a nice stay at this inexpensive hotel that was close to Disneyland park. I had high hopes when I came into the lobby, very nice and clean (and according to the website, newly renovated), and the staff was very nice. However, when I came to my room on the bottom level, my hopes sank.  The room smelled musty, like it hadn't been used in a long time. On top of that, it looked NOTHING like the "renovated" rooms that are pictured on the website.   Here comes the bad part: Upon unpacking, I noticed some bug on my socks lying on the bed. I freaked out when I realized what it was.   Fleas.  They were everywhere, on our clothes, the bed, the floor, it was horrific. We had to shake out all of our clothes in the bathtub, it looked like we shook pepper in the tub,

We checked in on the afternoon of the 17th for 5 days.  Front desk was helpful, even when needing more towels.  Beds were comfortable for the 4 of us.  Room was cleaned on time, and the front desk was able to answere questions.  The only drawback was the lack of internet free service as we were led to believe during booking, but most of the time we were too tired to bother anyway.  I would stay there again. as it is close to Disney, and reasonable for rates.

Summary Heading: Red Roof Inn good one nighter
Summary: We (my husband, myself, 4 year old daughter,and 17 month old son) drove straight through from Utah to California and arrived at 2 a.m.  The front desk clerk was friendly and check-in was fast.  After driving so long, all we wanted to do was sleep, which we did.  The room wasn't anything special but it was comfortable for one night.  We were on the 3rd floor, it was kind of a pain to lug our luggage from the parking lot to the elevator, the parking lot was pretty full.  The elevators were a little creaky and the ice machine didn't work on our floor, there wasn't one on the 2nd floor, but we did get ice on the 1st floor.  Check-out went smoothly.  It wasn't far from Disneyland but we checked into another hotel the next day and didn't go that day.  We observed people walking back

Summary Heading: Okay enough, Carsh Pad if all is needed.
Summary: I am writing this for my parents who stayed at this hotel as I could not get them accomodations last minute to the Farifield Inn in Anaheim.  I booked this hotel for them since it was last minute plans, inexpensive, and close by to the Fairfield.  Red Roof Inn is you get what you pay for. It was clean and in a very quiet part off the main "strip" of Disneyland Main Gate row. I have to start with this, on hte actual Red Roof website, it shows a picture of a bright and colorful room, the actual room that my paretns got was not quiete that.  The room was clean and very simple, but the beddinngs althoguh clean, seemed a bit dated or ready to be replaced with something fresh or new.  The bathroom was fine and clean, the room had a small work desk area, and a mini-fridge and

Summary Heading: Do not book 5 people in 1 room at this hotel!!!!
Summary: I had come to this website to read reviews on this hotel before I decided to book here, I knew not to expect much when I showed up. I had booked the reservation through the Disneyland Website as one of there "preferred" hotels, we booked it for 5 people. We drove out from Canada and checked in, at this time the staff seemed to be very friendly. We went to our room and there were only 2 double beds, I called down to the lobby to ask for a cott for the 5th person and was shocked to hear the guy who I was speaking with at the front desk tell me that the hotel could not accomodate 5 people in 1 room. I had asked him why they accepted a reservation for 5 people that was booked over 3 weeks before if the hotel couldn't accomodate 5 people? He over and over again kept blaming it on the

Summary Heading: 'Raising the Roof' Not What It Used To Be
Summary: As Annual Passholders at Disneyland, we have been staying at the Red Roof for many years now. Haven't written too many reviews when we stay at national chain budget type motels. Red Roof is what it is....a budget accomodation. That being said, one shouldn't have ultra-high expectations for place such as this. But after our second stay this year (July 9-21) for DL's 50th, we're starting to rethink our choice of motels.  Things have started to slip, and there's an air of "we don't give a rip" by the staff, housekeeping and maintenance. Our room, on the main floor just opposite the pool is obviously in constant use and one wonders if they ever refurbish, maintain or otherwise take the time to freshen things up a bit. Our rooms' carpet was FILTHY and stained beyond what you would

We loved this hotel. We got a room on the ground floor, as requested (easier to carry our luggage into it). The staff was really friendly, and did everything to fulfil our needs. The room was quite big and clean, with 2 beds for the two of us. We didn't use the swimming pool,  so we can't say anything about it. The proximity to Disney is perfect. We walked to Disney instead of taking the shuttle. What we've notice from the other reviews is that this hotel looks like a hang out place for young people during the weekends. We stayed there from Tuesday to  Friday and we didn't experience any sort of annoyance from other guests. If you're looking for a good hotel, for a reasonable price and close to Disney, this is an excelent choice.
nice room, nice staff, the shuttle to the park was great.  its a great place to stay to save a few bucks while on vacation...

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for little money.
Summary: My daughter and I stayed there for our first trip to Disneyland in May. It's nothing fancy, but we didn't need much except a place to crash after the day's activities. The ART shuttle to the park worked out great. We really enjoyed the pool and were able to get laundry done downstairs. One complaint I do have is that almost all of the vending machines were out of order. A few in the lobby worked, but I visited several out in the halls and couldn't get a soda. We would stay there again. You need to plan for meals since there is no restaurant and none nearby. If you plan well, want to save money, and plan on spending most of your day in the parks, this place works well.

Summary Heading: Okay, but had a problem with hot water... there was none...
Summary: The location was perfect if you wanted to walk to Disneyland and safe some money on parking... but don't expect a hot shower in the morning...The place is clean & close to attractions.. but with three days of staying here... I couldn't wait to get into a hot shower .. or even a warm shower for that matter...

Summary Heading: enjoyed our stay at the red roof
Summary: I stayed at the red roof in early June with my husband and my elderly parents. After reading some not-so-good reviews I was rather nervous as we had spent the previous 3 days in a lovely hotel in San Francisco. However, we were pleasantly surprised. the rooms were nice and clean if basic. No tea making facilities, but we had taken our own kettle. The pillows were nice and plump and the beds were comfortable. The shuttle bus service to the parks was very handy. At $3 per day, you can ride as many times as you like although you could walk to the parks if you were so inclined. We did have one troubled night when a party of marines on a weekend pass were allocated rooms either side of us and partied all night, (There were 20 of them altogether and gathered outside the rooms near

This is an average hotel.  If your looking for fancy things, this is not the place for you, but we just wanted some place cheap and clean.  We found this to be that.  We did not spend a lot of time there.  Very busy touring and things, but it was nice to come back to in the evenings plus my daughter loved the hot tub.   My sister-in-law had a little trouble getting enough wash cloths though, but overall it was a nice place to stay.

My parents stayed in this hotel in May and we really liked it when we visited so we booked our own room for the 4th of July weekend.  They allow pets, so our dog could come with us and the kids could swim all day and see the fireworks at night.  We only live an hour away...We were there for the hotel, not Disney.  Boy were we let down.    Our first day the pool was closed down for a deep cleaning after someone used it as a toilet.  However, they did open the spa in the evening.  We decided to go into the spa but were met with approx 15 VERY drunken young men with beer bottles everywhere.  They were loud and cussing all in the middle of the courtyard.  A couple of them even wolf-whistled at my 15 year old.  We called up the manager who said they'd "Look into it."  Bottom line: No

fairly priced, nice rooms, nice pool, the perfect place to just come and crash after a long day at disneyland. the shuttle to the park picked you up right outside the lobby. Only negative comment, the housekeeping staff was too visable, they were always around. Nice hotel for the price, which was cheaper than many others.

We went to Anaheim to see the Disneyland Resort.  All we wanted was something comfortable and clean. The RRI was that! It was simple, but the staff was friendly and our room was clean! We stayed on the 4th floor facing the park and we could see the park fireworks. That was a plus.  The pool was not heated, and it was kind of small.  We stayed at the park during the day, when we came back all we wanted was something clean, comfortable and safe. We took the ART but it is within walking distance if you want to walk. Recommend purchasing ART! Not bad for the price and location. We felt safe there, security patrolled the lot.  An elevator is available.  There is a mini store downstairs we found helpful! A mini fridge & microwave is available on request for $5.00 each per day.  We

Summary Heading: Felt Gross at Red Roof Inn
Summary: The size of the room was quite ok, but everthing else was kind of yucky... There were flies buzzing around constantly in the hall way.  Our room was never without a fly or two.  The chairs had dirty, questionable stains that still give me shudders.  Table tops felt sticky.  Sheets and comforters were also questionable... Pillows smelled of dirty hair.  The carpet, the bed, the sheets... everything felt moist.  Overall, I felt gross when I was in the room.   The pool was a decent size, but the water looked viscous... had a film of something on top.  Jacuzzi foamed right up when it got going... needless to say, I didn't even go near either one. Disney land is about 0.6 miles.  I don't mind walking at all, so it was no big deal for me, but it may be to some.

We stayed at the hotel from March 36-31 and found the rooms to be clean and fairly well taken care of. There is a definite lack of amenities, but you get what you pay for.  We were always short of towels. We found the walk to Disneyland to be not bad, but usually took the ART.  Continental Breakfast would have been nice, we would take that into consideration next time.  Out major complaint was that the pool was ICE cold.  We complained, more than once, and was told that it was being "looked at".  We had hoped to use the pool at least once in the 5 nights we were there.  I would most likely not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Don't be Fooled, Motel 6 repainted with a red roof
Summary: This motel was very poor at maintaining its rooms and practiced rate hiking(was charged more for a weekday than a booked weekend).  The window would not open in the first room we stayed and you have to ask the front desk if you want shampoo.  The second room had a beeping smoke alarm due to a dead battery which they did change to their credit.  Also the remote control batteries were dead and the back was missing which they did not replace.  In addition,My friend who was staying next door to us found a "crack kit" under his bed and my brother-in-law and sister had their truck vandalized(graffiti) in the supposedly secured parking lot.  Although all of us experienced a poor stay, none were offered any discount or future discount rate for our troubles.  Next time I will stay

let me start by saying this truly is the best kept secret in disneyland. foolish me i had made a reservation at another hotel (rodeway inn) to save 50 dollars........yes 50 dollars..when we walked into the place i felt i was walking into my worst nightmare...ugh my vacation was ruined instantly..luckly i called the Red Roof inn and they still had my reservation i had not cancelled...we RAN ..Drove like crazy...Flew!!! over there and instantly we were in .....DISNEYLAND!!! this hotel was everything i imagined my vacation would be..Clean rooms! great staff...thank you red roof in you made my vacation such an awesome experience.....we got a room on the fourth floor and we saw the fireworks from our window...if you are looking for bad rooms..bad service..rooms renovated in 1966 then

I stayed at the Red Roof Inn 7/23-7/30/04. I have stayed there in the past when it was a different motel. It was nice and then became run down. Since Red Roof has bought the place, the rooms are all BRAND NEW. I was very impressed. It is nothing fancy at all. It is very clean, with nice - helpful staff.  It has a very nice large pool. On the weekends they have on site security guards. Real ones who monitor the parking lot. I got a deal on the internet of $47.99 per night weekday and $55.00 weekend. I almost didn't share because I want to keep this one a secret, but hey - I have used this to find places - so there goes. If you want decent, clean, nice beds, comfortable, coffee in the lobby, newspaper delivered to your door and a wonderful pool and hot tub for a cheap price - GO

Knowing that we would only be sleeping one night in a hotel, I decided to take advantage of a $53 rate for my family of five. I was quickly reminded of the adage, "you get what you pay for." Thing that seem standard in other places (like coffee maker, fridge, toiletries) are missing at the Red Roof Inn. Only tea and coffee are available in the lobby. Ice maker on our floor was broken. There is no privacy...windows face a walkway. It also lacks privacy IN the room. The sink (and the bright light) faces the beds, and the only thing behind a door is the toilet/shower. It was cheap in all respects.

Summary Heading: Great price, clean rooms, wild guests
Summary: We got a great weekly rate at the Red Roof Inn. The rooms were very clean, and spacious for the price. We even had a nice office chair in the room, and plenty of room to set up the laptop to work. The staff was very helpful.Unfortunately, it was very rowdy on the weekend with people who came, it seems, just to party. (Three different groups told me they weren't here to visit the park, but just to "hang out" at the pool.)Two blocks from Disneyland, it's not the most convenient, but we just got such a good rate, and it was very clean.
